MAT	1	<<	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		1	"MATTHEW*~*MATTHEW CHP 1"
MAT	1	1	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		2	" {1} The book of the genealogy of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham."
MAT	1	2	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		3	" ||| DO NOT COMBINE |||*~*{Music--Starts @ v2}*~**~* {2} Abraham became the father of Isaac. Isaac became the father of Jacob. Jacob became the father of Judah and his brothers."
MAT	1	3	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		4	 {3} Judah became the father of Perez and Zerah by Tamar. Perez became the father of Hezron. Hezron became the father of Ram.
MAT	1	4	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		5	 {4} Ram became the father of Amminadab. Amminadab became the father of Nahshon. Nahshon became the father of Salmon.
MAT	1	5	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		6	 {5} Salmon became the father of Boaz by Rahab. Boaz became the father of Obed by Ruth. Obed became the father of Jesse.
MAT	1	6	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		7	 {6} Jesse became the father of King David. David became the father of Solomon by her who had been the wife of Uriah.
MAT	1	7	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		8	 {7} Solomon became the father of Rehoboam. Rehoboam became the father of Abijah. Abijah became the father of Asa.
MAT	1	8	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		9	 {8} Asa became the father of Jehoshaphat. Jehoshaphat became the father of Joram. Joram became the father of Uzziah.
MAT	1	9	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		10	 {9} Uzziah became the father of Jotham. Jotham became the father of Ahaz. Ahaz became the father of Hezekiah.
MAT	1	10	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		11	 {10} Hezekiah became the father of Manasseh. Manasseh became the father of Amon. Amon became the father of Josiah.
MAT	1	11	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		12	" {11} Josiah became the father of Jechoniah and his brothers, at the time of the exile to Babylon."
MAT	1	12	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		13	" {12} After the exile to Babylon, Jechoniah became the father of Shealtiel. Shealtiel became the father of Zerubbabel."
MAT	1	13	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		14	 {13} Zerubbabel became the father of Abiud. Abiud became the father of Eliakim. Eliakim became the father of Azor.
MAT	1	14	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		15	 {14} Azor became the father of Sadoc. Sadoc became the father of Achim. Achim became the father of Eliud.
MAT	1	15	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		16	 {15} Eliud became the father of Eleazar. Eleazar became the father of Matthan. Matthan became the father of Jacob.
MAT	1	16	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		17	" {16} Jacob became the father of Joseph, the husband of Mary, from whom was born Jesus, who is called Christ."
MAT	1	17	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		18	" {17} So all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations; from David to the exile to Babylon fourteen generations; and from the carrying away to Babylon to the Christ, fourteen generations.*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
MAT	1	18	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		19	" {18} Now the birth of Jesus Christ was like this; After his mother, Mary, was engaged to Joseph, before they came together, she was found pregnant by the Holy Spirit."
MAT	1	19	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		20	" {19} Joseph, her husband, being a righteous man, and not willing to make her a public example, intended to put her away secretly."
MAT	1	20	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		21	" {20} But when he thought about these things, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream, saying,"
MAT	1	20	Angel_01-FX1	#10		22	" “Joseph, son of David, don't be afraid to take to yourself Mary, your wife, for that which is conceived in her is of the Holy Spirit."
MAT	1	21	Angel_01-FX1	#10		23	" {21} She shall bring forth a son. You shall call his name Jesus, for it is he who shall save his people from their sins.”"
MAT	1	22	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		24	" {22} Now all this has happened, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying,"
MAT	1	23	God-FX1	#20		25	" {23} “Behold, the virgin shall be with child, and shall bring forth a son. They shall call his name Immanuel”; which is, being interpreted, “God with us.”"
MAT	1	24	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		26	" {24} Joseph arose from his sleep, and did as the angel of the Lord commanded him, and took his wife to himself;"
MAT	1	25	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		27	" {25} and didn't know her sexually until she had brought forth her firstborn son. He named him Jesus. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
MAT	2	<<	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		28	MATTHEW CHP 2
MAT	2	1	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		29	" {1} Now when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea in the days of King Herod, behold, wise men from the east came to Jerusalem, {2} saying,"
MAT	2	2	Wise Man	#17		30	" “Where is the one who is born King of the Jews? For we saw his star in the east, and have come to worship him.”"
MAT	2	3	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		31	" {3} When King Herod heard it, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him."
MAT	2	4	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		32	" {4} Gathering together all the chief priests and scribes of the people, he asked them:"
MAT	2	4	Herod_01	#19		33	" ""Where is the Christ to be be born?"""
MAT	2	5	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		34	" {5} They said to him,"
MAT	2	5	Religious Leader	#05		35	" “In Bethlehem of Judea, for this is written through the prophet,"
MAT	2	6	Religious Leader	#05		36	" {6} 'You Bethlehem, land of Judah, are in no way least among the princes of Judah: for out of you shall come forth a governor, who shall shepherd my people, Israel.”"
MAT	2	7	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		37	" {7} Then Herod secretly called the wise men, and asked them:"
MAT	2	7	Herod_01	#19		38	" ""What time did the star appear?"""
MAT	2	8	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		39	" ||| DO NOT COMBINE |||*~*{Music--Starts @ v8}*~**~* {8} He sent them to Bethlehem, and said,"
MAT	2	8	Herod_01	#19		40	" “Go and search diligently for the young child. When you have found him, bring me word, so that I also may come and worship him.”"
MAT	2	9	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		41	" {9} They, having heard the king, went their way; and behold, the star, which they saw in the east, went before them, until it came and stood over where the young child was."
MAT	2	10	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		42	" {10} When they saw the star, they rejoiced with exceedingly great joy."
MAT	2	11	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		43	" {11} They came into the house and saw the young child with Mary, his mother, and they fell down and worshiped him."
MAT	2	11	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		44	" Opening their treasures, they offered to him gifts: gold, frankincense, and myrrh."
MAT	2	12	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		45	" {12} Being warned in a dream that they shouldn't return to Herod, they went back to their own country another way."
MAT	2	13	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		46	" {13} Now when they had departed, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream, saying,"
MAT	2	13	Angel_01-FX1	#10		47	" “Arise and take the young child and his mother, and flee into Egypt, and stay there until I tell you, for Herod will seek the young child to destroy him.”"
MAT	2	14	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		48	" {14} He arose and took the young child and his mother by night, and departed into Egypt."
MAT	2	15	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		49	" {15} They remained there until the death of Herod; that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying,"
MAT	2	15	God-FX1	#20		50	 “Out of Egypt I called my son.”
MAT	2	16	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		51	" {16} When Herod saw that he was mocked by the wise men, he became exceedingly angry."
MAT	2	16	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		52	" He sent out and killed all the male children who were in Bethlehem and in all the surrounding countryside, from two years old and under, according to the exact time which he had learned from the wise men."
MAT	2	17	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		53	" {17} Then that which was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled, saying,"
MAT	2	18	God-FX1	#20		54	" {18} “A voice was heard in Ramah, lamentation, weeping and great mourning, Rachel weeping for her children; she wouldn't be comforted, because they are no more.”"
MAT	2	19	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		55	" {19} But when Herod was dead, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt, saying,"
MAT	2	20	Angel_01-FX1	#10		56	" {20} “Arise and take the young child and his mother, and go into the land of Israel, for those who sought the young child's life are dead.”"
MAT	2	21	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		57	" {21} He arose and took the young child and his mother, and came into the land of Israel."
MAT	2	22	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		58	" {22} But when he heard that Archelaus was reigning over Judea in the place of his father, Herod, he was afraid to go there."
MAT	2	22	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		59	" Being warned in a dream, he withdrew into the region of Galilee."
MAT	2	23	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		60	 {23} He came and lived in a city called Nazareth; that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through the prophets:
MAT	2	23	Scripture Quote-FX1	#03		61	" “He will be called a Nazarene.”*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
MAT	3	<<	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		62	MATTHEW CHP 3
MAT	3	1	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		63	" {1} In those days, John the Baptizer came, preaching in the wilderness of Judea, saying,"
MAT	3	2	John the Baptist	#06		64	" {2} “Repent, for the Kingdom of Heaven is at hand!”"
MAT	3	3	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		65	" {3} For this is he who was spoken of by Isaiah the prophet, saying,"
MAT	3	3	Isaiah-FX1	#04		66	" “The voice of one crying in the wilderness, make ready the way of the Lord. Make his paths straight.”"
MAT	3	4	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		67	" {4} Now John himself wore clothing made of camel's hair, with a leather belt around his waist. His food was locusts and wild honey."
MAT	3	5	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		68	" {5} Then people from Jerusalem, all of Judea, and all the region around the Jordan went out to him."
MAT	3	6	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		69	" {6} They were baptized by him in the Jordan, confessing their sins."
MAT	3	7	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		70	" {7} But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming for his baptism, he said to them,"
MAT	3	7	John the Baptist	#06		71	" “You offspring of vipers, who warned you to flee from the wrath to come?"
MAT	3	8	John the Baptist	#06		72	 {8} Therefore bring forth fruit worthy of repentance!
MAT	3	9	John the Baptist	#06		73	" {9} Don't think to yourselves, 'We have Abraham for our father,' for I tell you that God is able to raise up children to Abraham from these stones."
MAT	3	10	John the Baptist	#06		74	" {10} “Even now the axe lies at the root of the trees. Therefore every tree that doesn't bring forth good fruit is cut down, and cast into the fire."
MAT	3	11	John the Baptist	#06		75	" {11} I indeed baptize you in water for repentance, but there is one who comes after me is mightier than I, whose shoes I am not worthy to carry."
MAT	3	11	John the Baptist	#06		76	 He will baptize you in the Holy Spirit.
MAT	3	12	John the Baptist	#06		77	" {12} His winnowing fork is in his hand, and he will thoroughly cleanse his threshing floor."
MAT	3	12	John the Baptist	#06		78	" He will gather his wheat into the barn, but the chaff he will burn up with unquenchable fire.”"
MAT	3	13	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		79	" {13} Then Jesus came from Galilee to the Jordan to John, to be baptized by him. {14} But John would have hindered him, saying,"
MAT	3	14	John the Baptist	#06		80	" “I need to be baptized by you, and you come to me?”"
MAT	3	15	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		81	" {15} But Jesus, answering, said to him,"
MAT	3	15	Jesus	#07		82	" “Allow it now, for this is the fitting way for us to fulfill all righteousness.”"
MAT	3	15	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		83	 Then he allowed him.
MAT	3	16	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		84	" {16} Jesus, when he was baptized, went up directly from the water: and behold, the heavens were opened to him. He saw the Spirit of God descending as a dove, and coming on him."
MAT	3	17	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		85	" {17} Behold, a voice out of the heavens said,"
MAT	3	17	God-FX1	#20		86	" “This is my beloved Son, with whom I am well pleased.”*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
MAT	4	<<	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		87	MATTHEW CHP 4
MAT	4	1	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		88	 {1} Then Jesus was led up by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted by the devil.
MAT	4	2	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		89	" {2} When he had fasted forty days and forty nights, he was hungry afterward. {3} The tempter came and said to him,"
MAT	4	3	Devil-FX1	#08		90	" “If you are the Son of God, command that these stones become bread.”"
MAT	4	4	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		91	" {4} But he answered,"
MAT	4	4	Jesus	#07		92	" “It is written, 'Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that proceeds out of the mouth of God.”"
MAT	4	5	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		93	" {5} Then the devil took him into the holy city. He set him on the pinnacle of the temple, {6} and said to him,"
MAT	4	6	Devil-FX1	#08		94	" “If you are the Son of God, throw yourself down, for it is written, 'He will put his angels in charge of you.' and, 'On their hands they will bear you up, so that you don't dash your foot against a stone.”"
MAT	4	7	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		95	" {7} Jesus said to him,"
MAT	4	7	Jesus	#07		96	" “Again, it is written, 'You shall not test the Lord, your God.”"
MAT	4	8	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		97	" {8} Again, the devil took him to an exceedingly high mountain, and showed him all the kingdoms of the world, and their glory. {9} He said to him,"
MAT	4	9	Devil-FX1	#08		98	" “I will give you all of these things, if you will fall down and worship me.”"
MAT	4	10	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		99	" {10} Then Jesus said to him,"
MAT	4	10	Jesus	#07		100	" “Get behind me, Satan! For it is written, 'You shall worship the Lord your God, and you shall serve him only.”"
MAT	4	11	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		101	" {11} Then the devil left him, and behold, angels came and served him.*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
MAT	4	12	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		102	" {12} Now when Jesus heard that John was delivered up, he withdrew into Galilee."
MAT	4	13	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		103	" {13} Leaving Nazareth, he came and lived in Capernaum, which is by the sea, in the region of Zebulun and Naphtali."
MAT	4	14	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		104	 {14} Therefore what was spoken by Isaiah the prophet was fulfulled:
MAT	4	15	Isaiah-FX1	#04		105	" {15} “The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, toward the sea, beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles,"
MAT	4	16	Isaiah-FX1	#04		106	" {16} the people who sat in darkness saw a great light, to those who sat in the region and shadow of death, to them light has dawned.”"
MAT	4	17	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		107	" {17} From that time, Jesus began to preach, and to say,"
MAT	4	17	Jesus	#07		108	" “Repent! For the Kingdom of Heaven is at hand.”*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
MAT	4	18	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		109	" {18} Walking by the sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers: Simon, who is called Peter, and Andrew, his brother, casting a net into the sea; for they were fishermen. {19} He said to them,"
MAT	4	19	Jesus	#07		110	" “Come after me, and I will make you fishers for men.”"
MAT	4	20	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		111	 {20} They immediately left their nets and followed him.
MAT	4	21	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		112	" {21} Going on from there, he saw two other brothers, James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, in the boat with Zebedee their father, mending their nets. He called them."
MAT	4	22	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		113	" {22} They immediately left the boat and their father, and followed him. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
MAT	4	23	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		114	" {23} Jesus went about in all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the Good News of the Kingdom, and healing every disease and every sickness among the people."
MAT	4	24	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		115	" {24} The report about him went out into all Syria. They brought to him all who were sick, afflicted with various diseases and torments, possessed with demons, epileptics, and paralytics; and he healed them."
MAT	4	25	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		116	" {25} Great multitudes from Galilee, Decapolis, Jerusalem, Judea and from beyond the Jordan followed him. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
MAT	5	<<	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		117	MATTHEW CHP 5
MAT	5	1	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		118	" {1} Seeing the multitudes, he went up onto the mountain. When he had sat down, his disciples came to him. {2} He began to teach them, saying,"
MAT	5	3	Jesus	#07		119	" {3} “Blessed are the poor in spirit, for theirs is the Kingdom of Heaven."
MAT	5	4	Jesus	#07		120	" {4} Blessed are those who mourn, for they shall be comforted."
MAT	5	5	Jesus	#07		121	" {5} Blessed are the gentle, for they shall inherit the earth."
MAT	5	6	Jesus	#07		122	" {6} Blessed are those who hunger and thirst after righteousness, for they shall be filled."
MAT	5	7	Jesus	#07		123	" {7} Blessed are the merciful, for they shall obtain mercy."
MAT	5	8	Jesus	#07		124	" {8} Blessed are the pure in heart, for they shall see God."
MAT	5	9	Jesus	#07		125	" {9} Blessed are the peacemakers, for they shall be called children of God."
MAT	5	10	Jesus	#07		126	" {10} Blessed are those who have been persecuted for righteousness' sake, for theirs is the Kingdom of Heaven."
MAT	5	11	Jesus	#07		127	" {11} “Blessed are you when people reproach you, persecute you, and say all kinds of evil against you falsely, for my sake."
MAT	5	12	Jesus	#07		128	" {12} Rejoice, and be exceedingly glad, for great is your reward in heaven. For that is how they persecuted the prophets who were before you."
MAT	5	13	Jesus	#07		129	" {13} “You are the salt of the earth, but if the salt has lost its flavor, with what will it be salted? It is then good for nothing, but to be cast out and trodden under the feet of men."
MAT	5	14	Jesus	#07		130	 {14} You are the light of the world. A city located on a hill can't be hidden.
MAT	5	15	Jesus	#07		131	" {15} Neither do you light a lamp, and put it under a measuring basket, but on a stand; and it shines to all who are in the house."
MAT	5	16	Jesus	#07		132	" {16} Even so, let your light shine before men; that they may see your good works, and glorify your Father who is in heaven."
MAT	5	17	Jesus	#07		133	" {17} “Don't think that I came to destroy the law or the prophets. I didn't come to destroy, but to fulfill."
MAT	5	18	Jesus	#07		134	" {18} For most certainly, I tell you, until heaven and earth pass away, not even one smallest letter or one tiny pen stroke shall in any way pass away from the law, until all things are accomplished."
MAT	5	19	Jesus	#07		135	" {19} Whoever, therefore, shall break one of these least commandments, and teach others to do so, shall be called least in the Kingdom of Heaven;"
MAT	5	19	Jesus	#07		136	 but whoever shall do and teach them shall be called great in the Kingdom of Heaven.
MAT	5	20	Jesus	#07		137	" {20} For I tell you that unless your righteousness exceeds that of the scribes and Pharisees, there is no way you will enter into the Kingdom of Heaven."
MAT	5	21	Jesus	#07		138	" {21} “You have heard that it was said to the ancient ones, 'You shall not murder;' and 'Whoever shall murder shall be in danger of the judgment.'"
MAT	5	22	Jesus	#07		139	" {22} But I tell you, that everyone who is angry with his brother without a cause shall be in danger of the judgment;"
MAT	5	22	Jesus	#07		140	" and whoever shall say to his brother, 'Raca!' shall be in danger of the council; and whoever shall say, 'You fool!' shall be in danger of the fire of Gehenna."
MAT	5	23	Jesus	#07		141	" {23} “If therefore you are offering your gift at the altar, and there remember that your brother has anything against you, {24} leave your gift there before the altar, and go your way. First be reconciled to your brother, and then come and offer your gift."
MAT	5	25	Jesus	#07		142	" {25} Agree with your adversary quickly, while you are with him in the way; lest perhaps the prosecutor deliver you to the judge, and the judge deliver you to the officer, and you be cast into prison."
MAT	5	26	Jesus	#07		143	" {26} Most certainly I tell you, you shall by no means get out of there, until you have paid the last penny."
MAT	5	27	Jesus	#07		144	" {27} “You have heard that it was said, 'You shall not commit adultery;'"
MAT	5	28	Jesus	#07		145	 {28} but I tell you that everyone who gazes at a woman to lust after her has committed adultery with her already in his heart.
MAT	5	29	Jesus	#07		146	" {29} If your right eye causes you to stumble, pluck it out and throw it away from you."
MAT	5	29	Jesus	#07		147	" For it is more profitable for you that one of your members should perish, than for your whole body to be cast into Gehenna."
MAT	5	30	Jesus	#07		148	" {30} If your right hand causes you to stumble, cut it off, and throw it away from you."
MAT	5	30	Jesus	#07		149	" For it is more profitable for you that one of your members should perish, than for your whole body to be cast into Gehenna."
MAT	5	31	Jesus	#07		150	" {31} “It was also said, 'Whoever shall put away his wife, let him give her a writing of divorce.'"
MAT	5	32	Jesus	#07		151	" {32} But I tell you that whoever puts away his wife, except for the cause of sexual immorality, makes her an adulteress;"
MAT	5	32	Jesus	#07		152	 and whoever marries her when she is put away commits adultery.
MAT	5	33	Jesus	#07		153	" {33} “Again you have heard that it was said to them of old time, 'You shall not make false vows, but shall perform to the Lord your vows,'"
MAT	5	34	Jesus	#07		154	" {34} but I tell you, don't swear at all: neither by heaven, for it is the throne of God;"
MAT	5	35	Jesus	#07		155	" {35} nor by the earth, for it is the footstool of his feet; nor by Jerusalem, for it is the city of the great King."
MAT	5	36	Jesus	#07		156	" {36} Neither shall you swear by your head, for you can't make one hair white or black."
MAT	5	37	Jesus	#07		157	 {37} But let your 'Yes' be 'Yes' and your 'No' be 'No.' Whatever is more than these is of the evil one.
MAT	5	38	Jesus	#07		158	" {38} “You have heard that it was said, 'An eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth.'"
MAT	5	39	Jesus	#07		159	" {39} But I tell you, don't resist him who is evil; but whoever strikes you on your right cheek, turn to him the other also."
MAT	5	40	Jesus	#07		160	" {40} If anyone sues you to take away your coat, let him have your cloak also."
MAT	5	41	Jesus	#07		161	" {41} Whoever compels you to go one mile, go with him two."
MAT	5	42	Jesus	#07		162	" {42} Give to him who asks you, and don't turn away him who desires to borrow from you."
MAT	5	43	Jesus	#07		163	" {43} “You have heard that it was said, 'You shall love your neighbor, and hate your enemy.'"
MAT	5	44	Jesus	#07		164	" {44} But I tell you, love your enemies, bless those who curse you, do good to those who hate you, and pray for those who mistreat you and persecute you."
MAT	5	45	Jesus	#07		165	 {45} Then you will be children of your Father who is in heaven.
MAT	5	45	Jesus	#07		166	" For He makes his sun to rise on the evil and the good, and He sends rain on the just and the unjust."
MAT	5	46	Jesus	#07		167	" {46} For if you love those who love you, what reward do you have? Don't even the tax collectors do the same?"
MAT	5	47	Jesus	#07		168	" {47} If you only greet your friends, what more do you do than others? Don't even the tax collectors do the same?"
MAT	5	48	Jesus	#07		169	" {48} Therefore you shall be perfect, just as your Father in heaven is perfect. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
MAT	6	<<	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		170	MATTHEW CHP 6
MAT	6	1	Jesus	#07		171	" {1} “Be careful that you don't do your charitable giving before men, to be seen by them."
MAT	6	1	Jesus	#07		172	 Otherwise you will have no reward from your Father who is in heaven.
MAT	6	2	Jesus	#07		173	" {2} Therefore when you do merciful deeds, don't sound a trumpet before yourself, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may get glory from men."
MAT	6	2	Jesus	#07		174	" Most certainly I tell you, they have received their reward."
MAT	6	3	Jesus	#07		175	" {3} But when you do merciful deeds, don't let your left hand know what your right hand does."
MAT	6	4	Jesus	#07		176	" {4} That way your merciful deeds will be done in secret, then your Father who sees in secret will reward you openly."
MAT	6	5	Jesus	#07		177	" {5} “When you pray, you shall not be as the hypocrites, for they love to stand and pray in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets, that they may be seen by men."

MAT	6	16	Jesus	#07		190	" {16} “Moreover when you fast, don't be like the hypocrites, with sad faces. For they disfigure their faces, that they may be seen by men to be fasting."

MAT	6	20	Jesus	#07		195	" {20} but lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust consume, and where thieves don't break through and steal."
MAT	6	21	Jesus	#07		196	" {21} For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also."
MAT	6	22	Jesus	#07		197	" {22} “The lamp of the body is the eye. If therefore your eye is sound, your whole body will be full of light."
MAT	6	23	Jesus	#07		198	" {23} But if your eye is evil, your whole body will be full of darkness. If therefore the light that is in you is darkness, how great is the darkness!"
MAT	6	24	Jesus	#07		199	" {24} “No one can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one and love the other; or else he will be devoted to one and despise the other. You can't serve both God and Mammon."
MAT	6	25	Jesus	#07		200	" {25} Therefore I tell you, don't be anxious for your life: what you will eat, or what you will drink; nor yet for your body, what you will wear. Isn't life more than food, and the body more than clothing?"
MAT	6	26	Jesus	#07		201	" {26} See the birds of the sky, that they don't sow, neither do they reap, nor gather into barns. Your heavenly Father feeds them. Aren't you of much more value than they?"
MAT	6	27	Jesus	#07		202	" {27} “Which of you, by being anxious, can add one moment to his lifespan?"
MAT	6	28	Jesus	#07		203	" {28} Why are you anxious about clothing? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow. They don't toil, neither do they spin,"
MAT	6	29	Jesus	#07		204	 {29} yet I tell you that even Solomon in all his glory was not dressed like one of these.
MAT	6	30	Jesus	#07		205	" {30} But if God so clothes the grass of the field, which today exists, and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, won't he much more clothe you, you of little faith?"
MAT	6	31	Jesus	#07		206	" {31} “Therefore don't be anxious, saying, 'What will we eat?', 'What will we drink?' or, 'With what will we be clothed?'"

MAT	6	33	Jesus	#07		208	" {33} But seek first God's Kingdom, and his righteousness; and all these things will be given to you as well."
MAT	6	34	Jesus	#07		209	" {34} Therefore don't be anxious for tomorrow, for tomorrow will be anxious for itself. Each day's own evil is sufficient. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"

MAT	10	9	Jesus	#07		370	" {9} Don't take any gold, nor silver, nor brass in your money belts."
MAT	10	10	Jesus	#07		371	" {10} Take no bag for your journey, neither two coats, nor shoes, nor staff: for the laborer is worthy of his food."

MAT	10	19	Jesus	#07		380	" {19} But when they deliver you up, don't be anxious how or what you will say, for it will be given you in that hour what you will say."
MAT	10	20	Jesus	#07		381	" {20} For it is not you who speak, but the Spirit of your Father who speaks in you."
MAT	10	21	Jesus	#07		382	" {21} “Brother will deliver up brother to death, and the father his child. Children will rise up against parents, and cause them to be put to death."
MAT	10	22	Jesus	#07		383	" {22} You will be hated by all men for my name's sake, but he who endures to the end will be saved."
MAT	10	23	Jesus	#07		384	" {23} But when they persecute you in this city, flee into the next, for most certainly I tell you, you will not have gone through all the cities of Israel until the Son of Man has come."
MAT	10	24	Jesus	#07		385	" ||| DO NOT COMBINE |||*~*{Music--Ends before v24}*~**~* {24} “A disciple is not above his teacher, nor a servant above his lord."
MAT	10	25	Jesus	#07		386	" {25} It is enough for the disciple that he be like his teacher, and the servant like his lord. If they have called the master of the house Beelzebul, how much more those of his household!"
MAT	10	26	Jesus	#07		387	" {26} Therefore don't be afraid of them, for there is nothing covered that will not be revealed; and hidden that will not be known."
MAT	10	27	Jesus	#07		388	" {27} What I tell you in the darkness, speak in the light; and what you hear whispered in the ear, proclaim on the housetops."
MAT	10	28	Jesus	#07		389	" {28} Don't be afraid of those who kill the body, but are not able to kill the soul. Rather, fear the one who is able to destroy both soul and body in Gehenna."
MAT	10	29	Jesus	#07		390	 {29} “Aren't two sparrows sold for a penny? Not one of them falls on the ground apart from your Father's will.
MAT	10	30	Jesus	#07		391	 {30} Even the very hairs of your head are all numbered.
MAT	10	31	Jesus	#07		392	 {31} Therefore don't be afraid. You are of more value than many sparrows.
MAT	10	32	Jesus	#07		393	" {32} Everyone therefore who confesses me before men, him I will also confess before my Father who is in heaven."
MAT	10	33	Jesus	#07		394	" {33} But whoever denies me before men, him I will also deny before my Father who is in heaven."
MAT	10	34	Jesus	#07		395	" {34} “Don't think that I came to send peace on the earth. I didn't come to send peace, but a sword."
MAT	10	35	Jesus	#07		396	" {35} For I came to set a man at odds against his father, and a daughter against her mother, and a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law."
MAT	10	36	Jesus	#07		397	 {36} A man's foes will be those of his own household.
MAT	10	37	Jesus	#07		398	 {37} He who loves father or mother more than me is not worthy of me; and he who loves son or daughter more than me isn't worthy of me.
MAT	10	38	Jesus	#07		399	" {38} He who doesn't take his cross and follow after me, isn't worthy of me."
MAT	10	39	Jesus	#07		400	 {39} He who seeks his life will lose it; and he who loses his life for my sake will find it.

MAT	10	41	Jesus	#07		402	 {41} He who receives a prophet in the name of a prophet will receive a prophet's reward. He who receives a righteous man in the name of a righteous man will receive a righteous man's reward.

MAT	12	35	Jesus	#07		482	" {35} The good man out of his good treasure of the heart brings out good things, and the evil man out of his evil treasure brings out evil things."

MAT	13	<<	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		502	MATTHEW CHP 13
MAT	13	1	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		503	" {1} On that day Jesus went out of the house, and sat by the seaside."
MAT	13	2	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		504	" {2} Great multitudes gathered to him, so that he entered into a boat, and sat, and all the multitude stood on the beach."
MAT	13	3	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		505	" {3} He spoke to them many things in parables, saying,"
MAT	13	3	Jesus	#07		506	" “Behold, a farmer went out to sow. {4} As he sowed, some seeds fell by the roadside, and the birds came and devoured them."
MAT	13	5	Jesus	#07		507	" {5} Others fell on rocky ground, where they didn't have much soil, and immediately they sprang up, because they had no depth of earth."
MAT	13	6	Jesus	#07		508	" {6} When the sun had risen, they were scorched. Because they had no root, they withered away."
MAT	13	7	Jesus	#07		509	 {7} Others fell among thorns. The thorns grew up and choked them.
MAT	13	8	Jesus	#07		510	" {8} Others fell on good soil, and yielded fruit: some one hundred times as much, some sixty, and some thirty."
MAT	13	9	Jesus	#07		511	" {9} He who has ears to hear, let him hear.”*~**~*||| + 1.5 SECs |||*~*"
MAT	13	10	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		512	" {10} The disciples came, and said to him,"
MAT	13	10	Disciple	#14		513	 “Why do you speak to them in parables?”
MAT	13	11	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		514	" {11} He answered them,"
MAT	13	11	Jesus	#07		515	" “To you it is given to know the mysteries of the Kingdom of Heaven, but it is not given to them."
MAT	13	12	Jesus	#07		516	" {12} For whoever has, to him will be given, and he will have abundance, but whoever doesn't have, from him will be taken away even that which he has."
MAT	13	13	Jesus	#07		517	" {13} Therefore I speak to them in parables, because seeing they don't see, and hearing, they don't hear, neither do they understand."
MAT	13	14	Jesus	#07		518	" {14} In them the prophecy of Isaiah is fulfilled, which says, 'By hearing you will hear, and will in no way understand; Seeing you will see, and will in no way perceive:"
MAT	13	15	Jesus	#07		519	" {15} for this people's heart has grown callous, their ears are dull of hearing, they have closed their eyes; or else perhaps they might perceive with their eyes, hear with their ears, understand with their heart, and should turn again; and I would heal them.'"
MAT	13	16	Jesus	#07		520	" {16} “But blessed are your eyes, for they see; and your ears, for they hear."
MAT	13	17	Jesus	#07		521	" {17} For most certainly I tell you that many prophets and righteous men desired to see the things which you see, and didn't see them; and to hear the things which you hear, and didn't hear them."
MAT	13	18	Jesus	#07		522	" {18} “Hear, then, the parable of the farmer."
MAT	13	19	Jesus	#07		523	" {19} When anyone hears the word of the Kingdom, and doesn't understand it, the evil one comes, and snatches away that which has been sown in his heart. This is what was sown by the roadside."
MAT	13	20	Jesus	#07		524	" {20} What was sown on the rocky places, this is he who hears the word, and immediately with joy receives it;"
MAT	13	21	Jesus	#07		525	" {21} But since he has no root in himself, he only endures for a short time. When oppression or persecution arises because of the word, immediately he stumbles."
MAT	13	22	Jesus	#07		526	" {22} What was sown among the thorns, this is he who hears the word, but the cares of this age and the deceitfulness of riches choke the word, and he becomes unfruitful."
MAT	13	23	Jesus	#07		527	" {23} What was sown on the good ground, this is he who hears the word, and understands it, who most certainly bears fruit, and brings forth, some one hundred times as much, some sixty, and some thirty.”"
MAT	13	24	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		528	" {24} He set another parable before them, saying,"
MAT	13	24	Jesus	#07		529	 “The Kingdom of Heaven is like a man who sowed good seed in his field.
MAT	13	25	Jesus	#07		530	" {25} But while everyone was sleeping, his enemy came and sowed weeds among the wheat, and went away."
MAT	13	26	Jesus	#07		531	" {26} When the blade sprang up and brought forth fruit, the weeds appeared also."
MAT	13	27	Jesus	#07		532	" {27} The servants of the householder came and said to him, 'Sir, didn't you sow good seed in your field? Where did these weeds come from?'"
MAT	13	28	Jesus	#07		533	" {28} “He said to them, 'An enemy has done this.' “The servants asked him, 'Do you want us to go and gather them up?'"
MAT	13	29	Jesus	#07		534	" {29} “But he said, 'No, lest perhaps while you gather up the weeds, you root up the wheat with them."
MAT	13	30	Jesus	#07		535	" {30} Let both grow together until the harvest, and in the harvest time I will tell the reapers, “First, gather up the weeds, and bind them in bundles to burn them; but gather the wheat into my barn.”"
MAT	13	31	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		536	" {31} He set another parable before them, saying,"
MAT	13	31	Jesus	#07		537	" “The Kingdom of Heaven is like a grain of mustard seed, which a man took, and sowed in his field;"
MAT	13	32	Jesus	#07		538	" {32} which indeed is smaller than all seeds. But when it is grown, it is greater than the herbs, and becomes a tree, so that the birds of the air come and lodge in its branches.”"
MAT	13	33	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		539	 {33} He spoke another parable to them.
MAT	13	33	Jesus	#07		540	" “The Kingdom of Heaven is like yeast, which a woman took, and hid in three measures of meal, until it was all leavened.”"
MAT	13	34	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		541	 {34} Jesus spoke all these things in parables to the multitudes; He didn't say anything to them without using a parable.
MAT	13	35	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		542	 {35} So was fulfilled that which was spoken through the prophet:
MAT	13	35	Scripture Quote-FX1	#04		543	 “I will open my mouth in parables; I will utter things hidden from the foundation of the world.”
MAT	13	36	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		544	" {36} Then Jesus sent the multitudes away, and went into the house. His disciples came to him, saying,"
MAT	13	36	Disciple	#12		545	 “Explain to us the parable of the weeds of the field.”
MAT	13	37	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		546	" {37} He answered them,"
MAT	13	37	Jesus	#07		547	 “He who sows the good seed is the Son of Man.
MAT	13	38	Jesus	#07		548	" {38} The field is the world, and the good seed are the children of the Kingdom. The weeds are the children of the evil one."
MAT	13	39	Jesus	#07		549	" {39} The enemy who sowed them is the devil. The harvest is the end of the age, and the reapers are angels."
MAT	13	40	Jesus	#07		550	 {40} As therefore the weeds are gathered up and burned with fire; so will it be at the end of this age.
MAT	13	41	Jesus	#07		551	" {41} The Son of Man will send out his angels, and they will weed out of his Kingdom all things that cause stumbling, and those who do iniquity."
MAT	13	42	Jesus	#07		552	 {42} They will cast them into the furnace of fire where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
MAT	13	43	Jesus	#07		553	" {43} Then the righteous will shine forth like the sun in the Kingdom of their Father. He who has ears to hear, let him hear."
MAT	13	44	Jesus	#07		554	" {44} “Again, the Kingdom of Heaven is like a treasure hidden in the field, which a man found, and hid. In his joy, he goes and sells all that he has, and buys that field."
MAT	13	45	Jesus	#07		555	" {45} “Again, the Kingdom of Heaven is like a man who is a merchant seeking fine pearls."
MAT	13	46	Jesus	#07		556	" {46} Having found one pearl of great price, he went and sold all that he had, and bought it."
MAT	13	47	Jesus	#07		557	" {47} “Again, the Kingdom of Heaven is like a dragnet, that was cast into the sea, and gathered some fish of every kind."
MAT	13	48	Jesus	#07		558	" {48} When it was filled, they drew up on the beach. They sat down, and gathered the good into containers, but the bad they threw away."
MAT	13	49	Jesus	#07		559	" {49} So will it be in the end of the world. The angels will come forth, and separate the wicked from among the righteous."
MAT	13	50	Jesus	#07		560	 {50} They will cast them into the furnace of fire. There will be the weeping and the gnashing of teeth.”

MAT	21	16	Religious Leader	#11		926	 “Do you hear what these are saying?”
MAT	21	16	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		927	" Jesus said to them,"
MAT	21	16	Jesus	#07		928	" “Yes. Did you never read, 'Out of the mouth of babes and nursing babies you have perfected praise?”"
MAT	21	17	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		929	" {17} He left them, and went out of the city to Bethany, and lodged there.*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
MAT	21	18	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		930	" {18} Now in the morning, as he returned to the city, he was hungry."
MAT	21	19	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		931	" {19} Seeing a fig tree by the road, he came to it, and found nothing on it but leaves. He said to it,"
MAT	21	19	Jesus	#07		932	 “Let there be no fruit from you forever!”
MAT	21	19	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		933	" Immediately the fig tree withered away. {20} When the disciples saw it, they marveled, saying,"
MAT	21	20	Disciple	#12		934	 “How did the fig tree immediately wither away?”
MAT	21	21	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		935	" {21} Jesus answered them,"
MAT	21	21	Jesus	#07		936	" “Most certainly I tell you, if you have faith, and don't doubt, you will not only do what was done to the fig tree, but even if you told this mountain, 'Be taken up and cast into the sea,' it would be done."
MAT	21	22	Jesus	#07		937	" {22} All things, whatever you ask in prayer, believing, you will receive.”*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
MAT	21	23	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		938	" {23} When he had come into the temple, the chief priests and the elders of the people came to him as he was teaching, and said,"
MAT	21	23	Religious Leader	#10		939	 “By what authority do you do these things? Who gave you this authority?”
MAT	21	24	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		940	" {24} Jesus answered them,"
MAT	21	24	Jesus	#07		941	" “I also will ask you one question. If you tell me, I will tell you by what authority I do these things."
MAT	21	25	Jesus	#07		942	" {25} The baptism of John, where was it from? From heaven or from men?”"
MAT	21	25	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		943	" They reasoned with themselves, saying,"
MAT	21	25	Religious Leader	#10		944	" “If we say, 'From heaven,' he will ask us, 'Why then did you not believe him?'"
MAT	21	26	Religious Leader	#10		945	" {26} But if we say, 'From men,' we fear the multitude, for all hold John as a prophet.”"
MAT	21	27	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		946	" {27} They answered Jesus, and said,"
MAT	21	27	Religious Leader	#10		947	 “We don't know.”
MAT	21	27	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		948	" He also said to them,"
MAT	21	27	Jesus	#07		949	 “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.
MAT	21	28	Jesus	#07		950	" {28} But what do you think? A man had two sons, and he came to the first, and said, 'Son, go work today in my vineyard.'"
MAT	21	29	Jesus	#07		951	" {29} He answered, 'I will not,' but afterward he changed his mind, and went."
MAT	21	30	Jesus	#07		952	" {30} He came to the second, and said the same thing. He answered, 'I go, sir,' but he didn't go."
MAT	21	31	Jesus	#07		953	 {31} Which one of the two did the will of his father?”
MAT	21	31	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		954	" They said to him,"
MAT	21	31	Religious Leader	#05		955	 “The first.”
MAT	21	31	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		956	" Jesus said to them,"
MAT	21	31	Jesus	#07		957	 “Most certainly I tell you that the tax collectors and the prostitutes are entering into the Kingdom of God before you.
MAT	21	32	Jesus	#07		958	" {32} For John came to you in the way of righteousness, and you didn't believe him, but the tax collectors and the prostitutes believed him. When you saw it, you didn't even repent afterward, that you might believe him."
MAT	21	33	Jesus	#07		959	" {33} “Hear another parable. There was a man who was a master of a household, who planted a vineyard, set a hedge about it, dug a winepress in it, built a tower, leased it out to farmers, and went into another country."
MAT	21	34	Jesus	#07		960	" {34} When the season for the fruit drew near, he sent his servants to the farmers, to receive his fruit."
MAT	21	35	Jesus	#07		961	" {35} The farmers took his servants, beat one, killed another, and stoned another."
MAT	21	36	Jesus	#07		962	" {36} Again, he sent other servants more than the first: and they treated them the same way."
MAT	21	37	Jesus	#07		963	" {37} But afterward he sent to them his son, saying, 'They will respect my son.'"
MAT	21	38	Jesus	#07		964	" {38} But the farmers, when they saw the son, said among themselves, 'This is the heir. Come, let's kill him, and seize his inheritance.'"
MAT	21	39	Jesus	#07		965	" {39} So they took him, and threw him out of the vineyard, and killed him."
MAT	21	40	Jesus	#07		966	" {40} When therefore the lord of the vineyard comes, what will he do to those farmers?”"
MAT	21	41	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		967	" {41} They told him,"
MAT	21	41	Religious Leader	#05		968	" “He will destroy those miserable men, and will lease out the vineyard to other farmers, who will give him the fruit in its season.”"
MAT	21	42	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		969	" {42} Jesus said to them,"
MAT	21	42	Jesus	#07		970	" “Did you never read in the Scriptures, 'The stone which the builders rejected, the same was made the head of the corner. This was from the Lord. It is marvelous in our eyes?'"
MAT	21	43	Jesus	#07		971	" ||| DO NOT COMBINE |||*~*{Music--Ends before v43}*~**~* {43} “Therefore I tell you, the Kingdom of God will be taken away from you, and will be given to a nation bringing forth its fruit."
MAT	21	44	Jesus	#07		972	" {44} He who falls on this stone will be broken to pieces, but on whomever it will fall, it will scatter him as dust.”"

MAT	22	<<	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		976	MATTHEW CHP 22

MAT	22	2	Jesus	#07		978	" {2} “The Kingdom of Heaven is like a certain king, who made a marriage feast for his son."

MAT	22	4	Jesus	#07		980	" {4} Again he sent out other servants, saying, 'Tell those who are invited, “Behold, I have prepared my dinner. My cattle and my fatlings are killed, and all things are ready. Come to the marriage feast!”"

MAT	22	23	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		1004	" {23} On that day Sadducees (those who say that there is no resurrection) came to him. They asked him, {24} saying,"
MAT	22	24	Religious Leader	#19		1005	" “Teacher, Moses said, 'If a man dies, having no children, his brother shall marry his wife, and raise up seed for his brother.'"
MAT	22	25	Religious Leader	#19		1006	" {25} Now there were with us seven brothers. The first married and died, and since he had no children, he left his wife to his brother."
MAT	22	26	Religious Leader	#19		1007	" {26} In the same way, the second also, and the third, to the seventh."
MAT	22	27	Religious Leader	#19		1008	" {27} After them all, the woman died."
MAT	22	28	Religious Leader	#19		1009	" {28} In the resurrection therefore, whose wife will she be of the seven? For they all had her.”"

MAT	22	30	Jesus	#07		1012	" {30} For in the resurrection they neither marry, nor are given in marriage, but are like God's angels in heaven."
MAT	22	31	Jesus	#07		1013	" {31} But concerning the resurrection of the dead, haven't you read that which was spoken to you by God when He said:"
MAT	22	32	Jesus	#07		1014	" {32} 'I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob?' God is not the God of the dead, but of the living.”"
MAT	22	33	Narr_001: Matthew	#01		1015	" {33} When the multitudes heard it, they were astonished at his teaching.*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"

MAT	22	36	Religious Leader	#05		1018	" {36} “Teacher, which is the greatest commandment in the law?”"

MAT	23	18	Jesus	#07		1051	" {18} 'Whoever swears by the altar, it is nothing; but whoever swears by the gift that is on it, he is obligated?'"
MAT	23	19	Jesus	#07		1052	" {19} You blind fools! For which is greater, the gift, or the altar that sanctifies the gift?"
MAT	23	20	Jesus	#07		1053	" {20} He therefore who swears by the altar, swears by it, and by everything on it."
MAT	23	21	Jesus	#07		1054	" {21} He who swears by the temple, swears by it, and by him who was living in it."
MAT	23	22	Jesus	#07		1055	" {22} He who swears by heaven, swears by the throne of God, and by the one who sits on it."
MAT	23	23	Jesus	#07		1056	" {23} “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you tithe mint, dill, and cumin, and have left undone the weightier matters of the law: justice, mercy, and faith. But you ought to have done these, and not to have left the other undone."
MAT	23	24	Jesus	#07		1057	" {24} You blind guides, who strain out a gnat, and swallow a camel!"
MAT	23	25	Jesus	#07		1058	" {25} “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you clean the outside of the cup and of the platter, but within they are full of extortion and unrighteousness."

MAT	23	27	Jesus	#07		1060	" {27} “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you are like whitened tombs, which outwardly appear beautiful, but inwardly are full of dead men's bones, and of all uncleanness."

MAT	23	29	Jesus	#07		1062	" {29} “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you build the tombs of the prophets, and decorate the tombs of the righteous."

MAT	23	31	Jesus	#07		1064	 {31} Therefore you testify to yourselves that you are children of those who killed the prophets.
MAT	23	32	Jesus	#07		1065	" {32} Fill up, then, the measure of your fathers."
MAT	23	33	Jesus	#07		1066	" {33} You serpents, you offspring of vipers, how will you escape the judgment of Gehenna?"
MAT	23	34	Jesus	#07		1067	" {34} Therefore behold, I send to you prophets, wise men, and scribes. Some of them you will kill and crucify; and some of them you will scourge in your synagogues, and persecute from city to city."
MAT	23	35	Jesus	#07		1068	" {35} And so on you may come all the righteous blood shed on the earth, from the blood of righteous Abel to the blood of Zachariah son of Barachiah, whom you killed between the sanctuary and the altar."

MAT	24	13	Jesus	#07		1090	 {13} But he who endures to the end will be saved.

MAT	24	15	Jesus	#07		1092	" {15} “When, therefore, you see the abomination of desolation, which was spoken of through Daniel the prophet, standing in the holy place (let the reader understand),"
MAT	24	16	Jesus	#07		1093	 {16} then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains.
MAT	24	17	Jesus	#07		1094	 {17} Let him who is on the housetop not go down to take out things that are in his house.
MAT	24	18	Jesus	#07		1095	 {18} Let him who is in the field not return back to get his clothes.
MAT	24	19	Jesus	#07		1096	 {19} But woe to those who are with child and to nursing mothers in those days!
MAT	24	20	Jesus	#07		1097	" {20} Pray that your flight will not be in the winter, nor on a Sabbath."
MAT	24	21	Jesus	#07		1098	" {21} For then there will be great oppression, such as has not been from the beginning of the world until now, no, nor ever will be."
MAT	24	22	Jesus	#07		1099	" {22} Unless those days had been shortened, no flesh would have been saved. But for the sake of the chosen ones, those days will be shortened."
MAT	24	23	Jesus	#07		1100	" {23} “Then if anyone tells you, 'Behold, here is the Christ,' or, 'There,' don't believe it."
MAT	24	24	Jesus	#07		1101	" ||| DO NOT COMBINE |||*~*{Music--Ends before v24}*~**~* {24} For there will arise false christs, and false prophets, and they will show great signs and wonders, so as to lead astray, if possible, even the chosen ones."
MAT	24	25	Jesus	#07		1102	" {25} “Behold, I have told you beforehand."
MAT	24	26	Jesus	#07		1103	" {26} If therefore they tell you, 'Behold, he is in the wilderness,' don't go out; 'Behold, he is in the inner rooms,' don't believe it."
MAT	24	27	Jesus	#07		1104	" {27} For as the lightning flashes from the east, and is seen even to the west, so will be the coming of the Son of Man."
MAT	24	28	Jesus	#07		1105	" {28} For wherever the carcass is, there is where the vultures gather together."
MAT	24	29	Jesus	#07		1106	" {29} But immediately after the oppression of those days, the sun will be darkened, the moon will not give its light, the stars will fall from the sky, and the powers of the heavens will be shaken."
MAT	24	30	Jesus	#07		1107	" {30} Then the sign of the Son of Man will appear in the sky. Then all the tribes of the earth will mourn, and they will see the Son of Man coming on the clouds of the sky with power and great glory."
MAT	24	31	Jesus	#07		1108	" {31} He will send out his angels with a great sound of a trumpet, and they will gather together his chosen ones from the four winds, from one end of the sky to the other."
MAT	24	32	Jesus	#07		1109	" {32} “Now from the fig tree learn this parable. When its branch has now become tender, and puts forth its leaves, you know that the summer is near."

MAT	24	44	Jesus	#07		1121	" {44} Therefore also be ready, for in an hour that you don't expect, the Son of Man will come."

MRK	13	5	Narr_002: Mark	#09		2156	" {5} Jesus, answering, began to tell them,"
MRK	13	5	Jesus	#07		2157	 “Be careful that no one leads you astray.
MRK	13	6	Jesus	#07		2158	" {6} For many will come in my name, saying, 'I am Christ!' and will lead many astray."
MRK	13	7	Jesus	#07		2159	" {7} “When you hear of wars and rumors of wars, don't be troubled. For those must happen, but the end is not yet."
MRK	13	8	Jesus	#07		2160	" {8} For nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be earthquakes in various places. There will be famines and troubles. These things are the beginning of birth pains."
MRK	13	9	Jesus	#07		2161	" {9} But watch yourselves, for they will deliver you up to councils. You will be beaten in synagogues. You will stand before rulers and kings for my sake, for a testimony to them."
MRK	13	10	Jesus	#07		2162	 {10} The Good News must first be preached to all the nations.
MRK	13	11	Jesus	#07		2163	" {11} When they lead you away and deliver you up, don't be anxious beforehand, or premeditate what you will say, but say whatever will be given you in that hour. For it is not you who speak, but the Holy Spirit."
MRK	13	12	Jesus	#07		2164	" {12} “Brother will deliver up brother to death, and the father his child. Children will rise up against parents, and cause them to be put to death."
MRK	13	13	Jesus	#07		2165	" {13} You will be hated by all men for my name's sake, but he who endures to the end, the same will be saved."
MRK	13	14	Jesus	#07		2166	" {14} But when you see the abomination of desolation, spoken of by Daniel the prophet, standing where it ought not (let the reader understand), then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains."
MRK	13	15	Jesus	#07		2167	" {15} Let him who is on the housetop not go down, nor enter in, to take anything out of his house."
MRK	13	16	Jesus	#07		2168	 {16} Let him who is in the field not return back to take his cloak.
MRK	13	17	Jesus	#07		2169	 {17} But woe to those who are with child and to those who nurse babies in those days!
MRK	13	18	Jesus	#07		2170	 {18} Pray that your flight won't be in the winter.
MRK	13	19	Jesus	#07		2171	" {19} For in those days there will be oppression, such as there has not been the like from the beginning of the creation which God created until now, and never will be."
MRK	13	20	Jesus	#07		2172	" {20} Unless the Lord had shortened the days, no flesh would have been saved; but for the sake of the chosen ones, whom he picked out, he shortened the days."
MRK	13	21	Jesus	#07		2173	" {21} Then if anyone tells you, 'Look, here is the Christ!' or, 'Look, there!' don't believe it."
MRK	13	22	Jesus	#07		2174	" {22} For there will arise false christs and false prophets, and will show signs and wonders, that they may lead astray, if possible, even the chosen ones."
MRK	13	23	Jesus	#07		2175	" {23} But you watch. “Behold, I have told you all things beforehand."
MRK	13	24	Jesus	#07		2176	" {24} But in those days, after that oppression, the sun will be darkened, the moon will not give its light,"
MRK	13	25	Jesus	#07		2177	" {25} the stars will be falling from the sky, and the powers that are in the heavens will be shaken."
MRK	13	26	Jesus	#07		2178	 {26} Then they will see the Son of Man coming in clouds with great power and glory.
MRK	13	27	Jesus	#07		2179	" {27} Then he will send out his angels, and will gather together his chosen ones from the four winds, from the ends of the earth to the ends of the sky."
MRK	13	28	Jesus	#07		2180	" {28} “Now from the fig tree, learn this parable. When the branch has now become tender, and puts forth its leaves, you know that the summer is near."
MRK	13	29	Jesus	#07		2181	" {29} Even so you also, when you see these things coming to pass, know that it is near, at the doors."
MRK	13	30	Jesus	#07		2182	" {30} Most certainly I say to you, this generation will not pass away until all these things happen."
MRK	13	31	Jesus	#07		2183	" {31} Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will not pass away."
MRK	13	32	Jesus	#07		2184	" {32} But of that day or that hour no one knows, not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but only the Father."
MRK	13	33	Jesus	#07		2185	" {33} Watch, keep alert, and pray; for you don't know when the time is."
MRK	13	34	Jesus	#07		2186	" {34} “It is like a man, traveling to another country, having left his house, and given authority to his servants, and to each one his work, and also commanded the doorkeeper to keep watch."
MRK	13	35	Jesus	#07		2187	" {35} Watch therefore, for you don't know when the lord of the house is coming, whether at evening, or at midnight, or when the rooster crows, or in the morning; {36} lest coming suddenly he might find you sleeping."
MRK	13	37	Jesus	#07		2188	" {37} What I tell you, I tell all: Watch.”*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
MRK	14	<<	Narr_002: Mark	#09		2189	MARK CHP 14
MRK	14	1	Narr_002: Mark	#09		2190	" {1} It was now two days before the feast of the Passover and the unleavened bread, and the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might seize him by deception, and kill him. {2} For they said,"
MRK	14	2	Religious Leader	#11		2191	" “Not during the feast, because there might be a riot of the people.”"
MRK	14	3	Narr_002: Mark	#09		2192	" {3} While he was at Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper, as he sat at the table, a woman came having an alabaster jar of ointment of pure nard--very costly. She broke the jar, and poured it over his head."
MRK	14	4	Narr_002: Mark	#09		2193	" {4} But there were some who were indignant among themselves, saying,"
MRK	14	4	Disciple	#14		2194	 “Why has this ointment been wasted?

MRK	14	6	Jesus	#07		2197	 “Leave her alone. Why do you trouble her? She has done a good work for me.
MRK	14	7	Jesus	#07		2198	" {7} For you always have the poor with you, and whenever you want to, you can do them good; but you will not always have me."
MRK	14	8	Jesus	#07		2199	 {8} She has done what she could. She has anointed my body beforehand for the burying.
MRK	14	9	Jesus	#07		2200	" {9} Most certainly I tell you, wherever this Good News may be preached throughout the whole world, that which this woman has done will also be spoken of for a memorial of her.”"

LUK	1	<<	Narr_003: Luke	#11		2392	"LUKE*~*LUKE CHP 1"
LUK	1	1	Narr_003: Luke	#11		2393	" {1} Many have undertaken to set in order a narrative concerning those matters which have been fulfilled among us, {2} just as they were handed down to us by those who were eyewitnesses and servants of the word from the beginning."
LUK	1	3	Narr_003: Luke	#11		2394	" {3} Therefore, it seemed good to me also, having carefully investigated from the beginning, to write for you an orderly account, most excellent Theophilus."
LUK	1	4	Narr_003: Luke	#11		2395	" {4} This way, you can be sure you know the truth about the things you have been taught."
LUK	1	5	Narr_003: Luke	#11		2396	" {5} There was in the days of Herod, the king of Judea, a certain priest named Zechariah, of the priestly division of Abijah. He had a wife of the daughters of Aaron, and her name was Elizabeth."
LUK	1	6	Narr_003: Luke	#11		2397	" {6} They were both righteous before God, walking blamelessly in all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord."
LUK	1	7	Narr_003: Luke	#11		2398	" {7} But they had no child, because Elizabeth was barren, and they both were well advanced in years."
LUK	1	8	Narr_003: Luke	#11		2399	 {8} One day Zechariah's division was on duty and he was serving as priest before God.
LUK	1	9	Narr_003: Luke	#11		2400	" {9} According to the custom of the priests, he was chosen by lot to go into the temple of the Lord and burn incense."
LUK	1	10	Narr_003: Luke	#11		2401	 {10} The whole multitude of the people was praying outside at the hour of incense.
LUK	1	11	Narr_003: Luke	#11		2402	" {11} An angel of the Lord appeared to him, standing on the right side of the altar of incense."
LUK	1	12	Narr_003: Luke	#11		2403	" {12} Zechariah was troubled when he saw him, and fear fell upon him. {13} But the angel said to him,"
LUK	1	13	Angel_01-FX1	#10		2404	" “Don't be afraid, Zechariah, because your request has been heard, and your wife, Elizabeth, will bear you a son, and you shall call his name John."
LUK	1	14	Angel_01-FX1	#10		2405	 {14} You will have joy and gladness; and many will rejoice at his birth.
LUK	1	15	Angel_01-FX1	#10		2406	" {15} For he will be great in the sight of the Lord, and he will drink no wine nor strong drink. He will be filled with the Holy Spirit, even from his mother's womb."
LUK	1	16	Angel_01-FX1	#10		2407	" {16} He will turn many of the children of Israel to the Lord, their God."
LUK	1	17	Angel_01-FX1	#10		2408	" {17} He will go before him in the spirit and power of Elijah, 'to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children,' and the disobedient to the wisdom of the just; to prepare a people prepared for the Lord.”"
LUK	1	18	Narr_003: Luke	#11		2409	" {18} Zechariah said to the angel,"
LUK	1	18	Zechariah	#05		2410	" “How can I be sure of this? For I am an old man, and my wife is well advanced in years.”"

LUK	1	20	Angel_01-FX1	#10		2413	" {20} Behold, you will be silent and not able to speak, until the day that these things will happen, because you didn't believe my words, which will be fulfilled in their proper time.”"
LUK	1	21	Narr_003: Luke	#11		2414	" {21} The people were waiting for Zechariah, and they marveled that he delayed in the temple."

LUK	1	23	Narr_003: Luke	#11		2418	" {23} It happened, when the days of his service were fulfilled, he departed to his house."

LUK	3	<<	Narr_003: Luke	#11		2539	LUKE CHP 3
LUK	3	1	Narr_003: Luke	#11		2540	" {1} Now it was the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, Pontius Pilate being governor of Judea, and Herod being tetrarch of Galilee, and his brother Philip tetrarch of the region of Ituraea and Trachonitis, and Lysanias tetrarch of Abilene."
LUK	3	2	Narr_003: Luke	#11		2541	" {2} In the high priesthood of Annas and Caiaphas, the word of God came to John, the son of Zacharias, in the wilderness."
LUK	3	3	Narr_003: Luke	#11		2542	" {3} He came into all the region around the Jordan, preaching and saying:"
LUK	3	3	John the Baptist	#06		2543	" ""Receive this baptism of repentence for the forgiveness of sins."""
LUK	3	4	Narr_003: Luke	#11		2544	" {4} As it is written in the book of the words of Isaiah the prophet,"
LUK	3	4	Isaiah-FX1	#04		2545	" “The voice of one crying in the wilderness, 'Make ready the way of the Lord. Make his paths straight."
LUK	3	5	Isaiah-FX1	#04		2546	" {5} Every valley will be filled. Every mountain and hill will be brought low. The crooked will become straight, and the rough ways smooth. {6} All flesh will see God's salvation.”"
LUK	3	7	Narr_003: Luke	#11		2547	" {7} He said therefore to the multitudes who went out to be baptized by him,"
LUK	3	7	John the Baptist	#06		2548	" “You offspring of vipers, who warned you to flee from the wrath to come?"
LUK	3	8	John the Baptist	#06		2549	" {8} Bring forth therefore fruits worthy of repentance, and don't begin to say among yourselves, 'We have Abraham for our father;' for I tell you that God is able to raise up children to Abraham from these stones!"
LUK	3	9	John the Baptist	#06		2550	" {9} Even now the axe also lies at the root of the trees. Every tree therefore that doesn't bring forth good fruit is cut down, and thrown into the fire.”"
LUK	3	10	Narr_003: Luke	#11		2551	" {10} The multitudes asked him,"
LUK	3	10	Man	#16		2552	 “What then must we do?”
LUK	3	11	Narr_003: Luke	#11		2553	" {11} He answered them,"

LUK	3	13	Narr_003: Luke	#11		2557	" {13} He said to them,"

LUK	6	20	Jesus	#07		2738	" “Blessed are you who are poor, for yours is the Kingdom of God."

LUK	6	22	Jesus	#07		2740	" {22} Blessed are you when men shall hate you, and when they shall exclude and mock you, and throw out your name as evil, for the Son of Man's sake."

LUK	6	25	Jesus	#07		2743	" {25} Woe to you, you who are full now, for you will be hungry. Woe to you who laugh now, for you will mourn and weep."
LUK	6	26	Jesus	#07		2744	" {26} Woe, when men speak well of you, for their fathers did the same thing to the false prophets."
LUK	6	27	Jesus	#07		2745	" {27} “But I tell you who hear: love your enemies, do good to those who hate you;"
LUK	6	28	Jesus	#07		2746	" {28} bless those who curse you, and pray for those who mistreat you."
LUK	6	29	Jesus	#07		2747	" {29} To him who strikes you on the cheek, offer also the other; and from him who takes away your cloak, don't withhold your coat also."
LUK	6	30	Jesus	#07		2748	" {30} Give to everyone who asks you, and don't ask him who takes away your goods to give them back again."
LUK	6	31	Jesus	#07		2749	" {31} “As you would like people to do to you, do exactly so to them."
LUK	6	32	Jesus	#07		2750	" {32} If you love those who love you, what credit is that to you? For even sinners love those who love them."
LUK	6	33	Jesus	#07		2751	" {33} If you do good to those who do good to you, what credit is that to you? For even sinners do the same."
LUK	6	34	Jesus	#07		2752	" {34} If you lend to those from whom you hope to receive, what credit is that to you? Even sinners lend to sinners, to receive back as much."
LUK	6	35	Jesus	#07		2753	" {35} But love your enemies, and do good, and lend, expecting nothing back; and your reward will be great, and you will be children of the Most High; for he is kind toward the unthankful and evil."

LUK	6	37	Jesus	#07		2755	" {37} Don't judge, and you won't be judged. Don't condemn, and you won't be condemned. Set free, and you will be set free."
LUK	6	38	Jesus	#07		2756	" {38} “Give, and it will be given to you: good measure, pressed down, shaken together, and running over, will be given to you. For with the same measure you measure it will be measured back to you.”"
LUK	6	39	Narr_003: Luke	#11		2757	 {39} He spoke a parable to them.
LUK	6	39	Jesus	#07		2758	 “Can the blind guide the blind? Won't they both fall into a pit?
LUK	6	40	Jesus	#07		2759	" {40} A disciple is not above his teacher, but everyone when he is fully trained will be like his teacher."
LUK	6	41	Jesus	#07		2760	" {41} Why do you see the speck of chaff that is in your brother's eye, but don't consider the beam that is in your own eye?"
LUK	6	42	Jesus	#07		2761	" {42} Or how can you tell your brother, 'Brother, let me remove the speck of chaff that is in your eye,' when you yourself don't see the beam that is in your own eye?"
LUK	6	42	Jesus	#07		2762	" You hypocrite! First remove the beam from your own eye, and then you can see clearly to remove the speck of chaff that is in your brother's eye."
LUK	6	43	Jesus	#07		2763	 {43} For there is no good tree that brings forth rotten fruit; nor again a rotten tree that brings forth good fruit.
LUK	6	44	Jesus	#07		2764	" {44} For each tree is known by its own fruit. For people don't gather figs from thorns, nor do they gather grapes from a bramble bush."
LUK	6	45	Jesus	#07		2765	" {45} The good man out of the good treasure of his heart brings out that which is good, and the evil man out of the evil treasure of his heart brings out that which is evil, for out of the abundance of the heart, his mouth speaks."
LUK	6	46	Jesus	#07		2766	" {46} “Why do you call me, 'Lord, Lord,' and don't do the things which I say?"
LUK	6	47	Jesus	#07		2767	" {47} Everyone who comes to me, and hears my words, and does them, I will show you who he is like."
LUK	6	48	Jesus	#07		2768	" {48} He is like a man building a house, who dug and went deep, and laid a foundation on the rock. When a flood arose, the stream broke against that house, and could not shake it, because it was founded on the rock."
LUK	6	49	Jesus	#07		2769	" {49} But he who hears, and doesn't do, is like a man who built a house on the earth without a foundation, against which the stream broke, and immediately it fell, and the ruin of that house was great.”*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"

LUK	11	2	Jesus	#07		3095	" “When you pray, say, 'Our Father in heaven, may your name be kept holy. May your Kingdom come. May your will be done on earth, as it is in heaven."
LUK	11	3	Jesus	#07		3096	 {3} Give us day by day our daily bread.
LUK	11	4	Jesus	#07		3097	" {4} Forgive us our sins, for we ourselves also forgive everyone who is indebted to us. Bring us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil.”"
LUK	11	5	Narr_003: Luke	#11		3098	" {5} He said to them,"
LUK	11	5	Jesus	#07		3099	" “Which of you, if you go to a friend at midnight, and tell him, 'Friend, lend me three loaves of bread."
LUK	11	6	Jesus	#07		3100	" {6} A friend of mine has come to me from a journey, and I have nothing to set before him.'"
LUK	11	7	Jesus	#07		3101	" {7} He from within will answer and say, 'Don't bother me. The door is now shut, and my children are with me in bed. I can't get up and give it to you'?"
LUK	11	8	Jesus	#07		3102	" {8} I tell you, although he will not rise and give it to him because he is his friend, yet because of his persistence, he will get up and give him as many as he needs."
LUK	11	9	Jesus	#07		3103	" {9} “I tell you, keep asking, and it will be given you. Keep seeking, and you will find. Keep knocking, and it will be opened to you."
LUK	11	10	Jesus	#07		3104	 {10} For everyone who asks receives. He who seeks finds. To him who knocks it will be opened.
LUK	11	11	Jesus	#07		3105	" {11} “Which of you fathers, if your son asks for bread, will give him a stone? Or if he asks for a fish, he won't give him a snake instead of a fish, will he?"
LUK	11	12	Jesus	#07		3106	" {12} Or if he asks for an egg, he won't give him a scorpion, will he?"
LUK	11	13	Jesus	#07		3107	" {13} If you then, being evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to those who ask him?”*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
LUK	11	14	Narr_003: Luke	#11		3108	" {14} He was casting out a demon, and it was mute. It happened, when the demon had gone out, the mute man spoke; and the multitudes marveled. {15} But some of them said,"
LUK	11	15	Man (Not Good)	#19		3109	" “He casts out demons by Beelzebul, the prince of the demons.”"
LUK	11	16	Narr_003: Luke	#11		3110	" {16} Others, trying to trap him said:"
LUK	11	16	Man (Not Good)	#10		3111	" ""Show us a sign from Heaven!"""
LUK	11	17	Narr_003: Luke	#11		3112	" {17} But he, knowing their thoughts, said to them,"
LUK	11	17	Jesus	#07		3113	 “Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation. A house divided against itself falls.
LUK	11	18	Jesus	#07		3114	" {18} If Satan also is divided against himself, how will his kingdom stand? For you say that I cast out demons by Beelzebul."
LUK	11	19	Jesus	#07		3115	" {19} But if I cast out demons by Beelzebul, by whom do your children cast them out? Therefore will they be your judges."
LUK	11	20	Jesus	#07		3116	" {20} But if I by the finger of God cast out demons, then the Kingdom of God has come to you."
LUK	11	21	Jesus	#07		3117	" {21} “When the strong man, fully armed, guards his own dwelling, his goods are safe."
LUK	11	22	Jesus	#07		3118	" {22} But when someone stronger attacks him and overcomes him, he takes from him his whole armor in which he trusted, and divides his spoils."
LUK	11	23	Jesus	#07		3119	 {23} “He that is not with me is against me. He who doesn't gather with me scatters.
LUK	11	24	Jesus	#07		3120	" {24} The unclean spirit, when he has gone out of the man, passes through dry places, seeking rest, and finding none, he says, 'I will turn back to my house from which I came out.'"
LUK	11	25	Jesus	#07		3121	" {25} When he returns, he finds it swept and put in order."
LUK	11	26	Jesus	#07		3122	" {26} Then he goes, and takes seven other spirits more evil than himself, and they enter in and dwell there. The last state of that man becomes worse than the first.”"
LUK	11	27	Narr_003: Luke	#11		3123	" {27} It came to pass, as he said these things, a certain woman out of the multitude lifted up her voice, and said to him,"

LUK	11	29	Narr_003: Luke	#11		3127	" {29} As the multitudes continued to increase, he began to say,"

LUK	11	30	Jesus	#07		3129	" {30} For even as Jonah became a sign to the Ninevites, so will also the Son of Man be to this generation."
LUK	11	31	Jesus	#07		3130	" {31} The Queen of the South will rise up in the judgment with the men of this generation, and will condemn them: for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and behold, one greater than Solomon is here."
LUK	11	32	Jesus	#07		3131	" {32} The men of Nineveh will stand up in the judgment with this generation, and will condemn it: for they repented at the preaching of Jonah, and behold, one greater than Jonah is here."
LUK	11	33	Jesus	#07		3132	" {33} “No one, when he has lit a lamp, puts it in a cellar or under a basket, but on a stand, that those who come in may see the light."
LUK	11	34	Jesus	#07		3133	" {34} The lamp of the body is the eye. Therefore when your eye is good, your whole body is also full of light; but when it is evil, your body also is full of darkness."
LUK	11	35	Jesus	#07		3134	 {35} Therefore see whether the light that is in you isn't darkness.
LUK	11	36	Jesus	#07		3135	" {36} If therefore your whole body is full of light, having no part dark, it will be wholly full of light, as when the lamp with its bright shining gives you light.”*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
LUK	11	37	Narr_003: Luke	#11		3136	" {37} When Jesus finished speaking, a Pharisee invited him to dinner at his house, saying:"

LUK	11	42	Jesus	#07		3143	" {42} But woe to you Pharisees! For you tithe mint and rue and every herb, but you bypass justice and the love of God. You ought to have done these, and not to have left the other undone."

LUK	11	52	Jesus	#07		3155	" {52} Woe to you lawyers! For you took away the key of knowledge. You didn't enter in yourselves, and those who were entering in, you hindered.”"

LUK	12	16	Jesus	#07		3179	 “The ground of a certain rich man brought forth abundantly.
LUK	12	17	Jesus	#07		3180	" {17} He reasoned within himself, saying, 'What will I do, because I don't have room to store my crops?'"
LUK	12	18	Jesus	#07		3181	" {18} He said, 'This is what I will do. I will pull down my barns, and build bigger ones, and there I will store all my grain and my goods."
LUK	12	19	Jesus	#07		3182	" {19} I will tell my soul, “Soul, you have many goods laid up for many years. Take your ease, eat, drink, be merry.”'"
LUK	12	20	Jesus	#07		3183	" {20} “But God said to him, 'You foolish one, tonight your soul is required of you. The things which you have prepared--whose will they be?'"
LUK	12	21	Jesus	#07		3184	" {21} It is the same for one who lays up treasure for himself, and is not rich toward God.”"
LUK	12	22	Narr_003: Luke	#11		3185	" {22} He said to his disciples,"
LUK	12	22	Jesus	#07		3186	" “Therefore I tell you, don't be anxious for your life, what you will eat, nor yet for your body, what you will wear."
LUK	12	23	Jesus	#07		3187	" {23} Life is more than food, and the body is more than clothing."
LUK	12	24	Jesus	#07		3188	" {24} Consider the ravens: they don't sow, they don't reap, they have no warehouse or barn, and God feeds them. How much more valuable are you than birds!"
LUK	12	25	Jesus	#07		3189	 {25} Which of you by being anxious can add a cubit to his height?
LUK	12	26	Jesus	#07		3190	" {26} If then you aren't able to do even the least things, why are you anxious about the rest?"
LUK	12	27	Jesus	#07		3191	" {27} Consider the lilies, how they grow. They don't toil, neither do they spin; yet I tell you, even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these."
LUK	12	28	Jesus	#07		3192	" {28} But if this is how God clothes the grass in the field, which today exists, and tomorrow is cast into the oven, how much more will he clothe you, O you of little faith?"
LUK	12	29	Jesus	#07		3193	 {29} Don't seek what you will eat or what you will drink; neither be anxious.
LUK	12	30	Jesus	#07		3194	" {30} For the nations of the world seek after all of these things, but your Father knows that you need these things."
LUK	12	31	Jesus	#07		3195	" {31} But seek God's Kingdom, and all these things will be added to you.*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
LUK	12	32	Jesus	#07		3196	" {32} Don't be afraid, little flock, for it is your Father's good pleasure to give you the Kingdom."
LUK	12	33	Jesus	#07		3197	" {33} Sell that which you have, and give gifts to the needy. Make for yourselves purses which don't grow old, a treasure in the heavens that doesn't fail, where no thief approaches, neither moth destroys."

LUK	12	35	Jesus	#07		3199	 {35} “Be ready and dressed. Have your lamps burning.

LUK	12	39	Jesus	#07		3203	" {39} But know this, that if the master of the house had known in what hour the thief was coming, he would have watched, and not allowed his house to be broken into."
LUK	12	40	Jesus	#07		3204	" {40} Therefore be ready also, for the Son of Man is coming in an hour that you don't expect him.”"
LUK	12	41	Narr_003: Luke	#11		3205	" {41} Peter said to him,"

LUK	12	42	Narr_003: Luke	#11		3207	" {42} The Lord said,"
LUK	12	42	Jesus	#07		3208	" “Who then is the faithful and wise steward, whom his lord will set over his household, to give them their portion of food at the right times?"
LUK	12	43	Jesus	#07		3209	 {43} Blessed is that servant whom his lord will find doing so when he comes.
LUK	12	44	Jesus	#07		3210	" {44} Truly I tell you, that he will set him over all that he has."
LUK	12	45	Jesus	#07		3211	" {45} But suppose that servant says in his heart, 'My lord delays his coming,' and begins to beat the menservants and the maidservants, and to eat and drink, and to be drunken."
LUK	12	46	Jesus	#07		3212	" {46} Then the lord of that servant will come in a day when he isn't expecting him, and in an hour that he doesn't know, and will cut him in two, and place his portion with the unfaithful."
LUK	12	47	Jesus	#07		3213	" {47} That servant, who knew his lord's will, and didn't prepare, nor do what he wanted, will be beaten with many stripes."
LUK	12	48	Jesus	#07		3214	" {48} But he who didn't know, and did things worthy of stripes, will be beaten with few stripes. To whomever much is given, of him will much be required; and to whom much was entrusted, of him more will be asked."
LUK	12	49	Jesus	#07		3215	 {49} “I came to throw fire on the earth. I wish it were already kindled.
LUK	12	50	Jesus	#07		3216	" {50} But I have a baptism to be baptized with, and how distressed I am until it is accomplished!"
LUK	12	51	Jesus	#07		3217	" {51} Do you think that I have come to give peace in the earth? I tell you, no, but rather division."
LUK	12	52	Jesus	#07		3218	" {52} For from now on, there will be five in one house divided, three against two, and two against three."
LUK	12	53	Jesus	#07		3219	" {53} They will be divided, father against son, and son against father; mother against daughter, and daughter against her mother; mother-in-law against her daughter-in-law, and daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.”"
LUK	12	54	Narr_003: Luke	#11		3220	" {54} He said to the multitudes also,"
LUK	12	54	Jesus	#07		3221	" “When you see a cloud rising from the west, immediately you say, 'A shower is coming,' and so it happens."
LUK	12	55	Jesus	#07		3222	" {55} When a south wind blows, you say, 'There will be a scorching heat,' and it happens."
LUK	12	56	Jesus	#07		3223	" {56} You hypocrites! You know how to interpret the appearance of the earth and the sky, but how is it that you don't interpret this time?"
LUK	12	57	Jesus	#07		3224	 {57} Why don't you judge for yourselves what is right?
LUK	12	58	Jesus	#07		3225	" {58} For when you are going with your adversary before the magistrate, try diligently on the way to be released from him, lest perhaps he drag you to the judge, and the judge deliver you to the officer, and the officer throw you into prison."
LUK	12	59	Jesus	#07		3226	" {59} I tell you, you will by no means get out of there, until you have paid the very last penny.”*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"

LUK	13	6	Narr_003: Luke	#11		3233	 {6} He spoke this parable.

LUK	13	8	Jesus	#07		3236	" {8} He answered, 'Lord, leave it alone this year also, until I dig around it, and fertilize it."
LUK	13	9	Jesus	#07		3237	" {9} If it bears fruit, fine; but if not, after that, you can cut it down.”*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
LUK	13	10	Narr_003: Luke	#11		3238	 {10} He was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath day.
