LUK	13	14	Narr_003: Luke	#11		3244	" {14} The ruler of the synagogue, being indignant because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath, said to the multitude,"
LUK	13	14	Religious Leader	#03		3245	" “There are six days in which men ought to work. Therefore come on those days and be healed, and not on the Sabbath day!”"
LUK	13	15	Narr_003: Luke	#11		3246	" {15} Therefore the Lord answered him,"
LUK	13	15	Jesus	#07		3247	" “You hypocrites! Doesn't each one of you free his ox or his donkey from the stall on the Sabbath, and lead him away to water?"
LUK	13	16	Jesus	#07		3248	" {16} Ought not this woman, being a daughter of Abraham, whom Satan had bound eighteen long years, be freed from this bondage on the Sabbath day?”"
LUK	13	17	Narr_003: Luke	#11		3249	" {17} As he said these things, all his adversaries were disappointed, and all the multitude rejoiced for all the glorious things that were done by him. {18} He said,"
LUK	13	18	Jesus	#07		3250	 “What is the Kingdom of God like? To what shall I compare it?
LUK	13	19	Jesus	#07		3251	" {19} It is like a grain of mustard seed, which a man took, and put in his own garden. It grew, and became a large tree, and the birds of the sky lodged in its branches.”"
LUK	13	20	Narr_003: Luke	#11		3252	" {20} Again he said,"
LUK	13	20	Jesus	#07		3253	 “To what shall I compare the Kingdom of God?
LUK	13	21	Jesus	#07		3254	" {21} It is like yeast, which a woman took and hid in three measures of flour, until it was all leavened.”*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
LUK	13	22	Narr_003: Luke	#11		3255	" {22} He went on his way through cities and villages, teaching, and traveling on to Jerusalem. {23} One said to him,"

LUK	13	23	Narr_003: Luke	#11		3257	" He said to them,"
LUK	13	24	Jesus	#07		3258	" {24} “Strive to enter in by the narrow door, for many, I tell you, will seek to enter in, and will not be able."
LUK	13	25	Jesus	#07		3259	" {25} When once the master of the house has risen up, and has shut the door, and you begin to stand outside, and to knock at the door, saying, 'Lord, Lord, open to us!' then he will answer and tell you, 'I don't know you or where you come from.'"
LUK	13	26	Jesus	#07		3260	" {26} Then you will begin to say, 'We ate and drank in your presence, and you taught in our streets.'"
LUK	13	27	Jesus	#07		3261	" {27} He will say, 'I tell you, I don't know where you come from. Depart from me, all you workers of iniquity.'"
LUK	13	28	Jesus	#07		3262	" {28} There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth, when you see Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, and all the prophets, in the Kingdom of God, and yourselves being thrown outside."

LUK	18	<<	Narr_003: Luke	#11		3429	LUKE CHP 18
LUK	18	1	Narr_003: Luke	#11		3430	" {1} He also spoke a parable to them that they must always pray, and not give up, {2} saying,"
LUK	18	2	Jesus	#07		3431	" “There was a judge in a certain city who didn't fear God, and didn't respect man."
LUK	18	3	Jesus	#07		3432	" {3} A widow was in that city, and she often came to him, saying, 'Defend me from my adversary!'"
LUK	18	4	Jesus	#07		3433	" {4} He wouldn't for a while, but afterward he said to himself, 'It is true that I neither fear God, nor respect man."
LUK	18	5	Jesus	#07		3434	" {5} However, because this widow keeps bothering me, I will defend her, or else she will wear me out by her continual coming.”"
LUK	18	6	Narr_003: Luke	#11		3435	" {6} The Lord said,"
LUK	18	6	Jesus	#07		3436	 “Listen to what the unrighteous judge says.
LUK	18	7	Jesus	#07		3437	" {7} Won't God avenge his chosen ones, who are crying out to him day and night, and yet he exercises patience with them?"
LUK	18	8	Jesus	#07		3438	" {8} I tell you that he will avenge them quickly. Nevertheless, when the Son of Man comes, will he find faith on the earth?”"
LUK	18	9	Narr_003: Luke	#11		3439	" {9} He spoke also this parable to certain people who were convinced of their own righteousness, and who despised all others."
LUK	18	10	Jesus	#07		3440	" {10} “Two men went up into the temple to pray; one was a Pharisee, and the other was a tax collector."
LUK	18	11	Jesus	#07		3441	" {11} The Pharisee stood and prayed to himself like this: 'God, I thank you, that I am not like the rest of men, extortioners, unrighteous, adulterers, or even like this tax collector."

LUK	18	13	Jesus	#07		3443	" {13} But the tax collector, standing far away, wouldn't even lift up his eyes to heaven, but beat his breast, saying, 'God, be merciful to me, a sinner!'"
LUK	18	14	Jesus	#07		3444	" {14} I tell you, this man went down to his house justified rather than the other; for everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, but he who humbles himself will be exalted.”"
LUK	18	15	Narr_003: Luke	#11		3445	" {15} They were also bringing their babies to him, that he might touch them. But when the disciples saw it, they said:"
LUK	18	15	Disciple	#14		3446	" ""Do not bother the teacher!"""

LUK	18	16	Jesus	#07		3448	" “Allow the little children to come to me, and don't hinder them, for the Kingdom of God belongs to such as these."

JHN	5	3	Narr_004: John	#05		4157	" {3} In these lay a great multitude of those who were sick, blind, lame, or paralyzed, waiting for the moving of the water;"
JHN	5	4	Narr_004: John	#05		4158	" {4} for an angel went down at certain times into the pool, and stirred up the water. Whoever stepped in first after the stirring of the water was made whole of whatever disease he had."

JHN	5	10	Man	#19		4168	 “It is the Sabbath. It is not lawful for you to carry the mat.”

JHN	5	12	Narr_004: John	#05		4171	" {12} Then they asked him,"
JHN	5	12	Man	#19		4172	" “Who is the man who said to you, 'Take up your mat, and walk'?”"

JHN	5	14	Narr_004: John	#05		4174	" {14} Afterward Jesus found him in the temple, and said to him,"
JHN	5	14	Jesus	#07		4175	" “Behold, you are made well. Sin no more, so that nothing worse happens to you.”"
JHN	5	15	Narr_004: John	#05		4176	" {15} The man went away, and told the Jews that it was Jesus who had made him well."
JHN	5	16	Narr_004: John	#05		4177	" {16} For this cause the Jews persecuted Jesus, and sought to kill him, because he did these things on the Sabbath. {17} But Jesus answered them,"
JHN	5	17	Jesus	#07		4178	" “My Father is still working so I, too, am working.”"
JHN	5	18	Narr_004: John	#05		4179	" {18} For this cause therefore the Jews sought all the more to kill him, because he not only broke the Sabbath, but also called God his own Father, making himself equal with God. {19} Jesus therefore answered them,"
JHN	5	19	Jesus	#07		4180	" “Most certainly, I tell you, the Son can do nothing of himself, but what he sees the Father doing. For whatever things he does, these the Son also does likewise."
JHN	5	20	Jesus	#07		4181	" {20} For the Father has affection for the Son, and shows him all things that he himself does. He will show him greater works than these, that you may marvel."
JHN	5	21	Jesus	#07		4182	" {21} For as the Father raises the dead and gives them life, even so the Son also gives life to whom he desires."
JHN	5	22	Jesus	#07		4183	" {22} For the Father judges no one, but he has given all judgment to the Son, {23} that all may honor the Son, even as they honor the Father. He who doesn't honor the Son doesn't honor the Father who sent him."
JHN	5	24	Jesus	#07		4184	" {24} “Most certainly I tell you, he who hears my word, and believes him who sent me, has eternal life, and doesn't come into judgment, but has passed out of death into life."

JHN	5	27	Jesus	#07		4187	" {27} He also gave him authority to execute judgment, because he is a son of man."

JHN	13	<<	Narr_004: John	#05		4738	JOHN CHP 13

JHN	13	3	Narr_004: John	#05		4741	" {3} Jesus knew that the Father had given all things into his hands, and that he came forth from God, and was going to God."
JHN	13	4	Narr_004: John	#05		4742	" {4} He arose from supper and laid aside his outer garments. He took a towel, and wrapped a towel around his waist."
JHN	13	5	Narr_004: John	#05		4743	" {5} Then he poured water into the basin, and began to wash the disciples' feet, and to wipe them with the towel that was wrapped around him."
JHN	13	6	Narr_004: John	#05		4744	" {6} Then he came to Simon Peter. He said to him,"

JHN	13	7	Narr_004: John	#05		4746	" {7} Jesus answered him,"
JHN	13	7	Jesus	#07		4747	" “You don't know what I am doing now, but you will understand later.”"

JHN	15	<<	Narr_004: John	#05		4834	JOHN CHP 15

JHN	15	4	Jesus	#07		4838	" {4} Remain in me, and I in you. As the branch can't bear fruit by itself, unless it remains in the vine, so neither can you, unless you remain in me."

JHN	17	<<	Narr_004: John	#05		4898	JOHN CHP 17
JHN	17	1	Narr_004: John	#05		4899	" {1} Jesus said these things, and lifting up his eyes to heaven, he said,"
JHN	17	1	Jesus	#07		4900	" “Father, the time has come. Glorify your Son, that your Son may also glorify you."

JHN	17	3	Jesus	#07		4902	" {3} This is eternal life, that they should know you, the only true God, and him whom you sent, Jesus Christ."
JHN	17	4	Jesus	#07		4903	 {4} I glorified you on the earth. I have accomplished the work which you have given me to do.
JHN	17	5	Jesus	#07		4904	" {5} Now, Father, glorify me with your own self with the glory which I had with you before the world existed."
JHN	17	6	Jesus	#07		4905	" {6} I revealed your name to the people whom you have given me out of the world. They were yours, and you have given them to me. They have kept your word."
JHN	17	7	Jesus	#07		4906	 {7} Now they have known that all things whatever you have given me are from you.
JHN	17	8	Jesus	#07		4907	" {8} For the words which you have given me I have given to them, and they received them, and knew for sure that I came forth from you, and they have believed that you sent me."
JHN	17	9	Jesus	#07		4908	" {9} I pray for them. I don't pray for the world, but for those whom you have given me, for they are yours."
JHN	17	10	Jesus	#07		4909	" {10} All things that are mine are yours, and yours are mine, and I am glorified in them."
JHN	17	11	Jesus	#07		4910	" {11} I am no more in the world, but these are in the world, and I am coming to you. Holy Father, keep them through your name which you have given me, that they may be one, even as we are."
JHN	17	12	Jesus	#07		4911	" {12} While I was with them in the world, I kept them in your name. Those whom you have given me I have kept. None of them is lost, except the son of destruction, that the Scripture might be fulfilled."
JHN	17	13	Jesus	#07		4912	" {13} But now I come to you, and I say these things in the world, that they may have my joy made full in themselves."
JHN	17	14	Jesus	#07		4913	" {14} I have given them your word. The world hated them, because they are not of the world, even as I am not of the world."
JHN	17	15	Jesus	#07		4914	" {15} I pray not that you would take them from the world, but that you would keep them from the evil one."
JHN	17	16	Jesus	#07		4915	 {16} They are not of the world even as I am not of the world.
JHN	17	17	Jesus	#07		4916	" {17} Sanctify them in your truth. Your word is truth. {18} As you sent me into the world, even so I have sent them into the world."
JHN	17	19	Jesus	#07		4917	" {19} For their sakes I sanctify myself, that they themselves also may be sanctified in truth."
JHN	17	20	Jesus	#07		4918	" {20} Not for these only do I pray, but for those also who believe in me through their word,"
JHN	17	21	Jesus	#07		4919	" {21} that they may all be one; even as you, Father, are in me, and I in you, that they also may be one in us; that the world may believe that you sent me."
JHN	17	22	Jesus	#07		4920	" {22} The glory which you have given me, I have given to them; that they may be one, even as we are one;"
JHN	17	23	Jesus	#07		4921	" {23} I in them, and you in me, that they may be perfected into one; that the world may know that you sent me, and loved them, even as you loved me."

ACT	3	<<	Narr_005: Acts	#11		5267	ACTS CHP 3
ACT	3	1	Narr_005: Acts	#11		5268	" {1} Peter and John were going up into the temple at the hour of prayer, the ninth hour."
ACT	3	2	Narr_005: Acts	#11		5269	" {2} A certain man who was lame from his mother's womb was being carried, whom they laid daily at the door of the temple which is called Beautiful, to ask gifts for the needy of those who entered into the temple."
ACT	3	3	Narr_005: Acts	#11		5270	" {3} Seeing Peter and John about to go into the temple, he asked to receive gifts for the needy. {4} Peter, fastening his eyes on him, with John, said,"
ACT	3	4	Peter	#13		5271	 “Look at us.”
ACT	3	5	Narr_005: Acts	#11		5272	" {5} He listened to them, expecting to receive something from them. {6} But Peter said,"
ACT	3	6	Peter	#13		5273	" “Silver and gold have I none, but what I have, that I give you. In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, get up and walk!”"
ACT	3	7	Narr_005: Acts	#11		5274	" {7} He took him by the right hand, and raised him up. Immediately his feet and his ankle bones received strength."
ACT	3	8	Narr_005: Acts	#11		5275	" {8} Leaping up, he stood, and began to walk. He entered with them into the temple, walking, leaping, and praising God."
ACT	3	9	Narr_005: Acts	#11		5276	 {9} All the people saw him walking and praising God.
ACT	3	10	Narr_005: Acts	#11		5277	" {10} They recognized him. They knew that he was the crippled man who used to sit begging at the temple gate. They were filled with wonder, and they said:"
ACT	3	10	Man	#04		5278	" ""What has happened to him is truly amazing!"""
ACT	3	11	Narr_005: Acts	#11		5279	" {11} As the lame man who was healed held on to Peter and John, all the people ran together to them in the porch that is called Solomon's, greatly wondering."
ACT	3	12	Narr_005: Acts	#11		5280	" {12} When Peter saw it, he responded to the people,"
ACT	3	12	Peter	#13		5281	" “You men of Israel, why do you marvel at this man? Why do you fasten your eyes on us, as though by our own power or godliness we had made him walk?"
ACT	3	13	Peter	#13		5282	" {13} The God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, the God of our fathers, has glorified his Servant Jesus, whom you delivered up, and denied in the presence of Pilate, when he had determined to release him."
ACT	3	14	Peter	#13		5283	" {14} But you denied the Holy and Righteous One, and asked for a murderer to be granted to you."
ACT	3	15	Peter	#13		5284	" {15} You killed the Prince of life, whom God raised from the dead, to which we are witnesses."
ACT	3	16	Peter	#13		5285	" {16} By faith in his name, his name has made this man strong, whom you see and know. Yes, the faith which is through him has given him this perfect soundness in the presence of you all."
ACT	3	17	Peter	#13		5286	" {17} “Now, brothers, I know that you did this in ignorance, as did also your rulers."

ACT	3	19	Peter	#13		5288	" {19} “Repent therefore, and turn again, that your sins may be blotted out, so that there may come times of refreshing from the presence of the Lord, {20} and that he may send Christ Jesus, who was ordained for you before."

ACT	7	1	Narr_005: Acts	#11		5415	" {1} The high priest said,"
ACT	7	1	High Priest	#15		5416	 “Are these things so?”
ACT	7	2	Narr_005: Acts	#11		5417	" {2} He said,"
ACT	7	2	Stephen	#09		5418	" “Brothers and fathers, listen. The God of glory appeared to our father Abraham, when he was in Mesopotamia, before he lived in Haran."
ACT	7	3	Stephen	#09		5419	" {3} God said to him, 'Get out of your land, and from your relatives, and come into a land which I will show you.'"
ACT	7	4	Stephen	#09		5420	" {4} Then he came out of the land of the Chaldaeans, and lived in Haran. From there, when his father was dead, God moved him into this land, where you are now living."
ACT	7	5	Stephen	#09		5421	" {5} He gave him no inheritance in it, no, not so much as to set his foot on."
ACT	7	5	Stephen	#09		5422	" God promised that he would give it to him for a possession, and to his seed after him, when he still had no child."
ACT	7	6	Stephen	#09		5423	" {6} God spoke in this way: that his seed would live as aliens in a strange land, and that they would be enslaved and mistreated for four hundred years."
ACT	7	7	Stephen	#09		5424	" {7} 'I will judge the nation to which they will be in bondage,' said God, 'and after that will they come out, and serve me in this place.'"
ACT	7	8	Stephen	#09		5425	" {8} He gave him the covenant of circumcision. So Abraham became the father of Isaac, and circumcised him the eighth day. Isaac became the father of Jacob, and Jacob became the father of the twelve patriarchs."
ACT	7	9	Stephen	#09		5426	" {9} “The patriarchs, moved with jealousy against Joseph, sold him into Egypt. God was with him"
ACT	7	10	Stephen	#09		5427	" {10} He delivered him out of all his afflictions and gave him favor and wisdom before Pharaoh, king of Egypt. He made him governor over Egypt and all his house."
ACT	7	11	Stephen	#09		5428	" {11} Now a famine came over all the land of Egypt and Canaan, and great affliction. Our fathers found no food."
ACT	7	12	Stephen	#09		5429	" {12} But when Jacob heard that there was grain in Egypt, he sent out our fathers the first time."
ACT	7	13	Stephen	#09		5430	" {13} On the second time Joseph was made known to his brothers, and Joseph's race was revealed to Pharaoh."
ACT	7	14	Stephen	#09		5431	" {14} Joseph sent, and summoned Jacob, his father, and all his relatives, seventy-five souls."
ACT	7	15	Stephen	#09		5432	" {15} Jacob went down into Egypt, and he died. Our forefathers died there also."
ACT	7	16	Stephen	#09		5433	 {16} They were all brought back to Shechem and laid in the tomb that Abraham bought for a price in silver from the children of Hamor of Shechem.
ACT	7	17	Stephen	#09		5434	" {17} “But as the time of the promise came close which God had sworn to Abraham, the people grew and multiplied in Egypt."
ACT	7	18	Stephen	#09		5435	" {18} Then there arose a different king, who didn't know Joseph."
ACT	7	19	Stephen	#09		5436	" {19} The same took advantage of our race, and mistreated our fathers, and forced them to throw out their babies, so that they wouldn't stay alive."
ACT	7	20	Stephen	#09		5437	" ||| DO NOT COMBINE |||*~*{Music--Starts @ v20}*~**~* {20} At that time Moses was born, and was exceedingly handsome. He was nourished three months in his father's house."
ACT	7	21	Stephen	#09		5438	" {21} When he was thrown out, Pharaoh's daughter took him up, and reared him as her own son."
ACT	7	22	Stephen	#09		5439	 {22} Moses was instructed in all the wisdom of the Egyptians. He was mighty in his words and works.
ACT	7	23	Stephen	#09		5440	" {23} But when he was forty years old, it came into his heart to visit his brothers, the children of Israel."
ACT	7	24	Stephen	#09		5441	" {24} Seeing one of them suffer wrong, he defended him, and avenged him who was oppressed, striking the Egyptian."
ACT	7	25	Stephen	#09		5442	" {25} He supposed that his brothers understood that God, by his hand, was giving them deliverance; but they didn't understand."
ACT	7	26	Stephen	#09		5443	" {26} “The day following, he appeared to them as they fought, and urged them to be at peace again, saying, 'Sirs, you are brothers. Why do you wrong one another?'"
ACT	7	27	Stephen	#09		5444	" {27} But he who did his neighbor wrong pushed him away, saying, 'Who made you a ruler and a judge over us?"
ACT	7	28	Stephen	#09		5445	" {28} Do you want to kill me, as you killed the Egyptian yesterday?'"
ACT	7	29	Stephen	#09		5446	" {29} Moses fled at this saying, and became a stranger in the land of Midian, where he became the father of two sons."
ACT	7	30	Stephen	#09		5447	" {30} “When forty years were fulfilled, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in the wilderness of Mount Sinai, in a flame of fire in a bush."
ACT	7	31	Stephen	#09		5448	" {31} When Moses saw it, he wondered at the sight. As he came close to see, a voice of the Lord came to him and said:"
ACT	7	32	Stephen	#09		5449	" {32} 'I am the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.' Moses trembled, and dared not look."
ACT	7	33	Stephen	#09		5450	" {33} The Lord said to him, 'Take your sandals off of your feet, for the place where you stand is holy ground."
ACT	7	34	Stephen	#09		5451	" {34} I have surely seen the affliction of my people that is in Egypt, and have heard their groaning. I have come down to deliver them. Now come, I will send you into Egypt.'"

ACT	13	36	Paul	#19		5804	" {36} For David, after he had in his own generation served the counsel of God, fell asleep, and was laid with his fathers, and saw decay."

ACT	13	38	Paul	#19		5806	" {38} Be it known unto you therefore, brethren, that through this man is preached unto you the forgiveness of sins."
ACT	13	39	Paul	#19		5807	" {39} Through him everyone who believes is justified from all things, from which they could not be justified by the law of Moses."

ACT	13	41	Paul	#19		5809	" {41} 'Behold, you scoffers, and wonder, and perish; for I work a work in your days, a work which you will in no way believe, if one declares it to you.”"
ACT	13	42	Narr_005: Acts	#11		5810	" {42} So when the Jews went out of the synagogue, the Gentiles begged him, saying:"

ACT	13	43	Narr_005: Acts	#11		5813	 Paul and Barnabas spoke to them and urged them to continue in the grace of God.
ACT	13	44	Narr_005: Acts	#11		5814	 {44} The next Sabbath almost the whole city was gathered together to hear the word of God.
ACT	13	45	Narr_005: Acts	#11		5815	" {45} But when the Jews saw the multitudes, they were filled with jealousy, and contradicted the things which were spoken by Paul, and blasphemed."
ACT	13	46	Narr_005: Acts	#11		5816	" {46} Paul and Barnabas spoke out boldly, and said,"
ACT	13	46	Paul	#19		5817	 “It was necessary that God's word should be spoken to you first.
ACT	13	46	Paul	#19		5818	" Since indeed you thrust it from you, and judge yourselves unworthy of eternal life, behold, we turn to the Gentiles."
ACT	13	47	Paul	#19		5819	" {47} For so has the Lord commanded us, saying,"
ACT	13	47	Paul	#19		5820	" 'I have set you as a light for the Gentiles, that you should bring salvation to the uttermost parts of the earth.”"
ACT	13	48	Narr_005: Acts	#11		5821	" {48} As the Gentiles heard this, they were glad, and glorified the word of God. As many as were appointed to eternal life believed."
ACT	13	49	Narr_005: Acts	#11		5822	 {49} The Lord's word was spread abroad throughout all the region.
ACT	13	50	Narr_005: Acts	#11		5823	" {50} But the Jews stirred up the devout and prominent women and the chief men of the city, and stirred up a persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and threw them out of their borders."

ACT	17	9	Narr_005: Acts	#11		5991	" {9} When they had taken security from Jason and the rest, they let them go.*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"

ACT	17	10	Narr_005: Acts	#11		5993	" When they arrived, they went into the Jewish synagogue."
ACT	17	11	Narr_005: Acts	#11		5994	 {11} Now these were more noble than those in Thessalonica.
ACT	17	11	Narr_005: Acts	#11		5995	" This is because they received the word with all readiness of the mind, examining the Scriptures daily to see whether these things were so."
ACT	17	12	Narr_005: Acts	#11		5996	" ||| DO NOT COMBINE |||*~*{Music--Starts @ v12}*~**~* {12} Many of them therefore believed; also of the prominent Greek women, and not a few men."
ACT	17	13	Narr_005: Acts	#11		5997	" {13} But when the Jews of Thessalonica had knowledge that the word of God was proclaimed by Paul at Beroea also, they came there likewise, agitating the multitudes."
ACT	17	14	Narr_005: Acts	#11		5998	" {14} Then the brothers immediately sent out Paul to go as far as to the sea, and Silas and Timothy still stayed there."
ACT	17	15	Narr_005: Acts	#11		5999	 {15} But those who escorted Paul brought him as far as Athens.
ACT	17	15	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6000	" Receiving a commandment to Silas and Timothy that they should come to him very quickly, they departed."
ACT	17	16	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6001	" {16} Now while Paul waited for them at Athens, his spirit was stirred within him as he saw the city full of idols."
ACT	17	17	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6002	" {17} So he reasoned in the synagogue with the Jews and the devout persons, and in the marketplace every day with those who met him."
ACT	17	18	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6003	" ||| DO NOT COMBINE |||*~*{SFX--Men talking--Starts @ v18}*~**~* {18} Some of the Epicurean and Stoic philosophers also were conversing with him. Some said,"
ACT	17	18	Philosopher	#03		6004	 “What does this babbler want to say?”
ACT	17	18	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6005	" Others said,"
ACT	17	18	Philosopher	#04		6006	" “He seems to be advocating foreign deities,"""
ACT	17	18	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6007	 because he preached Jesus and the resurrection.
ACT	17	19	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6008	" {19} They took hold of him, and brought him to a meeting of the Areopagus, saying:"
ACT	17	19	Philosopher	#03		6009	" “May we know what this new teaching is, which is spoken by you?"
ACT	17	20	Philosopher	#03		6010	 {20} For you bring certain strange things to our ears. We want to know therefore what these things mean.”
ACT	17	21	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6011	" {21} Now all the Athenians and the strangers living there spent their time in nothing else, but either to tell or to hear some new thing."
ACT	17	22	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6012	" {22} Paul stood in the middle of the Areopagus and said,"
ACT	17	22	Paul	#19		6013	" “You men of Athens, I perceive that you are very religious in all things."
ACT	17	23	Paul	#19		6014	" {23} For as I passed along, and observed the objects of your worship, I found also an altar with this inscription: 'TO AN UNKNOWN GOD.'"
ACT	17	23	Paul	#19		6015	" What therefore you worship in ignorance, this I announce to you."
ACT	17	24	Paul	#19		6016	" {24} The God who made the world and all things in it, he, being Lord of heaven and earth, doesn't dwell in temples made with hands."
ACT	17	25	Paul	#19		6017	" {25} Neither is he served by men's hands, as though he needed anything, since he himself gives to all life and breath, and all things."
ACT	17	26	Paul	#19		6018	" {26} He made from one blood every nation of men to dwell on all the surface of the earth, having determined appointed seasons, and the boundaries of their dwellings."
ACT	17	27	Paul	#19		6019	" {27} God did this so that men would seek the Lord, if perhaps they might reach out for him and find him, though he is not far from each one of us."
ACT	17	28	Paul	#19		6020	" {28} 'For in him we live, and move, and have our being.' As some of your own poets have said, 'For we are also his offspring.'"
ACT	17	29	Paul	#19		6021	" {29} Being then the offspring of God, we ought not to think that the Godhead is like gold, or silver, or stone, engraved by art and design of man."
ACT	17	30	Paul	#19		6022	 {30} The times of ignorance therefore God overlooked. But now he commands that all people everywhere should repent.
ACT	17	31	Paul	#19		6023	" {31} For he has appointed a day in which he will judge the world in righteousness by the man whom he has ordained; of which he has given assurance to all men, in that he has raised him from the dead.”"
ACT	17	32	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6024	" {32} Now when they heard of the resurrection of the dead, some mocked; but others said,"
ACT	17	32	Philosopher	#04		6025	 “We want to hear you again concerning this.”
ACT	17	33	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6026	 {33} Thus Paul went out from among them.
ACT	17	34	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6027	" {34} But certain men joined with him, and believed, among whom also was Dionysius the Areopagite, and a woman named Damaris, and others with them. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"

ACT	18	1	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6029	" {1} After these things Paul departed from Athens, and came to Corinth."

ACT	18	2	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6032	 Paul went to see Aquila and Priscilla.

ACT	18	10	Jesus-FX1	#07		6043	" {10} for I am with you, and no one will attack you to harm you, for I have many people in this city.”"
ACT	18	11	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6044	" {11} He lived there a year and six months, teaching the word of God among them."
ACT	18	12	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6045	" ||| DO NOT COMBINE |||*~*{SFX--Men talking--Starts @ v12}*~**~* {12} But when Gallio was proconsul of Achaia, the Jews with one accord rose up against Paul and brought him before the judgment seat, {13} saying,"
ACT	18	13	Man	#18		6046	 “This man persuades men to worship God contrary to the law.”
ACT	18	14	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6047	" {14} But when Paul was about to open his mouth, Gallio said to the Jews,"
ACT	18	14	Governor	#17		6048	" “If indeed it were a matter of wrong or of wicked crime, you Jews, it would be reasonable that I should bear with you;"
ACT	18	15	Governor	#17		6049	" {15} but if they are questions about words and names and your own law, look to it yourselves. For I don't want to be a judge of these matters.”"
ACT	18	16	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6050	 {16} He drove them from the judgment seat.
ACT	18	17	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6051	" {17} Then all the Greeks laid hold on Sosthenes, the ruler of the synagogue, and beat him before the judgment seat. Gallio didn't care about any of these things."
ACT	18	18	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6052	" {18} Paul, having stayed after this many more days, took his leave of the brothers, and sailed from there for Syria, together with Priscilla and Aquila."
ACT	18	18	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6053	" He shaved his head in Cenchreae, for he had a vow."
ACT	18	19	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6054	" {19} He came to Ephesus, and he left them there; but he himself entered into the synagogue, and reasoned with the Jews."
ACT	18	20	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6055	" {20} When they asked him to stay with them a longer time, he declined;"
ACT	18	21	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6056	" {21} but taking his leave of them, he said,"
ACT	18	21	Paul	#19		6057	" “I must by all means keep this coming feast in Jerusalem, but I will return again to you if God wills,"""
ACT	18	21	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6058	 he set sail from Ephesus.
ACT	18	22	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6059	" {22} When he had landed at Caesarea, he went up and greeted the assembly, and went down to Antioch."
ACT	18	23	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6060	" {23} Having spent some time there, he departed."
ACT	18	23	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6061	" He went through the region of Galatia, and Phrygia, establishing all the disciples in each place."
ACT	18	24	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6062	" {24} Now a certain Jew named Apollos, an Alexandrian by race, an eloquent man, came to Ephesus."
ACT	18	24	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6063	 He was well versed in the Scriptures.
ACT	18	25	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6064	" {25} This man had been instructed in the way of the Lord; and being fervent in spirit, he spoke and taught accurately the things concerning Jesus, although he knew only the baptism of John."
ACT	18	26	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6065	" {26} He began to speak boldly in the synagogue. But when Priscilla and Aquila heard him, they took him aside, and explained to him the way of God more accurately."

ACT	19	12	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6090	" {12} Even handkerchiefs or aprons were carried away from his body to the sick, and the evil spirits went out."
ACT	19	13	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6091	" {13} But some of the itinerant Jews, exorcists, took on themselves to invoke over those who had the evil spirits the name of the Lord Jesus, saying,"
ACT	19	13	Man (Not Good)	#14		6092	 “We adjure you by Jesus whom Paul preaches.”
ACT	19	14	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6093	" {14} There were seven sons of one Sceva, a Jewish chief priest, who did this."
ACT	19	15	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6094	" {15} The evil spirit answered,"
ACT	19	15	Man (Possessed)-FX3	#08		6095	" “Jesus I know, and Paul I know, but who are you?”"
ACT	19	16	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6096	" {16} The man who had the evil spirit leaped on them, and overpowered them. He prevailed against them, so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded."
ACT	19	17	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6097	" {17} This became known to all, both Jews and Greeks, who lived at Ephesus."
ACT	19	17	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6098	" Fear fell on them all, and the name of the Lord Jesus was magnified."
ACT	19	18	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6099	" {18} Many also of those who had believed came, confessing, and declaring their deeds."
ACT	19	19	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6100	 {19} Many of those who practiced magical arts brought their books together and burned them in the sight of all.
ACT	19	19	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6101	" They counted their price, and found it to be fifty thousand pieces of silver."
ACT	19	20	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6102	 {20} So the word of the Lord was growing and becoming mighty.
ACT	19	21	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6103	" ||| DO NOT COMBINE |||*~*{Music--Ends before v21}*~**~* {21} Now after these things had ended, Paul determined in the spirit, when he had passed through Macedonia and Achaia, to go to Jerusalem, saying,"

ACT	19	22	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6105	" {22} Having sent into Macedonia two of those who served him, Timothy and Erastus, he himself stayed in Asia for a while.*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
ACT	19	23	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6106	" ||| DO NOT COMBINE |||*~*{SFX--Men talking--Starts @ v23}*~**~* {23} About that time there arose no small stir concerning the Way."
ACT	19	24	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6107	" {24} For a certain man named Demetrius, a silversmith, who made silver shrines of Artemis, brought no little business to the craftsmen."
ACT	19	25	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6108	" {25} He gathered together with the workmen of like occupation, and said,"
ACT	19	25	Demetrius	#12		6109	" “Sirs, you know that by this business we have our wealth."
ACT	19	26	Demetrius	#12		6110	" {26} You see and hear, that not at Ephesus alone, but almost throughout all Asia, this Paul has persuaded and turned away many people, saying that they are no gods, that are made with hands."
ACT	19	27	Demetrius	#12		6111	" {27} Not only is there danger that this our trade come into disrepute, but also that the temple of the great goddess Artemis will be counted as nothing."
ACT	19	27	Demetrius	#12		6112	" The goddess herself, who is worshipped throughout the province of Asia and the world will be robbed of her divine majesty.”"
ACT	19	28	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6113	" {28} When they heard this they were filled with anger, and cried out, saying,"
ACT	19	28	Man (Not Good)	#05		6114	 “Great is Artemis of the Ephesians!”
ACT	19	29	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6115	" {29} The whole city was filled with confusion. They rushed with one accord into the theater, having seized Gaius and Aristarchus, men of Macedonia, Paul's companions in travel."
ACT	19	30	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6116	" {30} When Paul wanted to enter in to the people, the disciples didn't allow him."
ACT	19	31	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6117	" {31} Certain also of the Asiarchs, being his friends, sent to him and begged him not to venture into the theater."
ACT	19	32	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6118	" {32} Some therefore cried one thing, and some another, for the assembly was in confusion."
ACT	19	32	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6119	 Most of them didn't know why they had come together.
ACT	19	33	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6120	" {33} They brought Alexander out of the crowd, the Jews putting him forward."
ACT	19	33	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6121	" Alexander beckoned with his hand, and would have made a defense to the people."
ACT	19	34	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6122	" {34} But when they perceived that he was a Jew, all with one voice for a time of about two hours cried out,"
ACT	19	34	Man (Not Good)	#05		6123	 “Great is Artemis of the Ephesians!”
ACT	19	35	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6124	" {35} When the town clerk had quieted the crowd, he said,"
ACT	19	35	City Clerk	#03		6125	" “You men of Ephesus, what man is there who doesn't know that the city of the Ephesians is worshipper of the great goddess Artemis, and of the image which fell down from Zeus?"
ACT	19	36	City Clerk	#03		6126	" {36} Seeing then that these things can't be denied, you ought to be quiet, and to do nothing rash."
ACT	19	37	City Clerk	#03		6127	" {37} For you have brought these men here, who are neither robbers of temples nor blasphemers of your goddess."
ACT	19	38	City Clerk	#03		6128	" {38} If therefore Demetrius and the craftsmen who are with him have a matter against anyone, the courts are open, and there are proconsuls. Let them press charges against one another."
ACT	19	39	City Clerk	#03		6129	" {39} But if you seek anything about other matters, it will be settled in the regular assembly."
ACT	19	40	City Clerk	#03		6130	" {40} For indeed we are in danger of being accused concerning this day's riot, there being no cause."
ACT	19	40	City Clerk	#03		6131	" Concerning it, we wouldn't be able to give an account of this commotion.”"

ACT	20	13	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6153	" {13} But we who went ahead to the ship set sail for Assos, intending to take Paul aboard there. He had arranged this because he was going there on foot."

ACT	20	17	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6158	" {17} From Miletus he sent to Ephesus, and called to himself the elders of the assembly."
ACT	20	18	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6159	" {18} When they had come to him, he said to them,"
ACT	20	18	Paul	#19		6160	" “You yourselves know, from the first day that I set foot in Asia, how I was with you all the time."
ACT	20	19	Paul	#19		6161	" {19} I served the Lord with all humility, with many tears, and with trials which happened to me by the plots of the Jews;"
ACT	20	20	Paul	#19		6162	" {20} I didn't shrink from declaring to you anything that was profitable. I taught you publically, from house to house."
ACT	20	21	Paul	#19		6163	" {21} I testified both to Jews and to Greeks of repentance toward God, and faith toward our Lord Jesus Christ."
ACT	20	22	Paul	#19		6164	" {22} Now, behold, I go bound by the Spirit to Jerusalem, not knowing what will happen to me there;"
ACT	20	23	Paul	#19		6165	" {23} I only know that the Holy Spirit testifies in every city, saying that bonds and afflictions wait for me."
ACT	20	24	Paul	#19		6166	" {24} But these things don't count; nor do I hold my life dear to myself, so that I may finish my race with joy, and the ministry which I received from the Lord Jesus, to fully testify to the Good News of the grace of God."
ACT	20	25	Paul	#19		6167	" {25} “Now, behold, I know that you all, among whom I went about preaching the Kingdom of God, will see my face no more."
ACT	20	26	Paul	#19		6168	 {26} Therefore I testify to you this day that I am clean from the blood of all men.
ACT	20	27	Paul	#19		6169	 {27} For I didn't shrink from declaring to you the whole counsel of God.

ACT	24	1	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6358	" {1} After five days, the high priest, Ananias, came down with certain elders and an orator, one Tertullus."
ACT	24	1	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6359	 They informed the governor against Paul.
ACT	24	2	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6360	" {2} When he was called, Tertullus began to accuse him, saying,"
ACT	24	2	Tertullus	#03		6361	" ""We have enjoyed a long period of peace under you, and your foresight has brought about reforms in this nation."
ACT	24	3	Tertullus	#03		6362	" {3} Everywhere and in every way, most excellent Felix, we acknowledge this with profound gratitude."
ACT	24	4	Tertullus	#03		6363	" {4} But, that I don't delay you, I entreat you to bear with us and hear a few words."
ACT	24	5	Tertullus	#03		6364	" {5} We have found this man to be a plague, an instigator of insurrections among all the Jews throughout the world, and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes."
ACT	24	6	Tertullus	#03		6365	" {6} He even tried to profane the temple, and we arrested him."
ACT	24	7	Tertullus	#03		6366	" {7} But the chief captain Lysias came upon us, and violently took him away out of our hands."
ACT	24	8	Tertullus	#03		6367	 {8} By examining him yourself you may ascertain all these things of which we accuse him.”
ACT	24	9	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6368	" {9} The Jews also joined in the attack, affirming that these things were so."
ACT	24	10	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6369	" {10} When the governor had beckoned to him to speak, Paul answered,"
ACT	24	10	Paul	#19		6370	" “Because I know that you have been a judge of this nation for many years, I cheerfully make my defense."
ACT	24	11	Paul	#19		6371	 {11} You can recognize that it is not more than twelve days since I went up to worship at Jerusalem.
ACT	24	12	Paul	#19		6372	" {12} In the temple they didn't find me disputing with anyone or stirring up a crowd, either in the synagogues, or in the city."
ACT	24	13	Paul	#19		6373	 {13} Nor can they prove to you the things of which they now accuse me.
ACT	24	14	Paul	#19		6374	" {14} But this I confess to you, that after the Way, which they call heresy, so I serve the God of our fathers, believing all things which are according to the law, and which are written in the prophets."
ACT	24	15	Paul	#19		6375	" {15} I have the same hope toward God which these also themselves look for, that there will be a resurrection of the dead, both of the just and unjust."
ACT	24	16	Paul	#19		6376	 {16} Herein I also practice always having a conscience void of offense toward God and men.
ACT	24	17	Paul	#19		6377	" {17} Now after some years, I came to bring gifts for the needy to my nation, and offerings."
ACT	24	18	Paul	#19		6378	" {18} Certain Jews from Asia found me purified in the temple, not with a mob, nor with turmoil."
ACT	24	19	Paul	#19		6379	" {19} They ought to have been here before you, and to make accusation, if they had anything against me."
ACT	24	20	Paul	#19		6380	 {20} Or else let these men themselves say what injustice they found in me when I stood before the council --
ACT	24	21	Paul	#19		6381	" {21} unless it is for this one thing that I cried standing among them, 'Concerning the resurrection of the dead I am being judged before you today!”"
ACT	24	22	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6382	" {22} But Felix, having more exact knowledge concerning the Way, deferred them, saying,"
ACT	24	22	Felix	#05		6383	" “When Lysias, the commanding officer, comes down, I will decide your case.”"
ACT	24	23	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6384	" {23} He ordered the centurion that Paul should be kept in custody, and should have some privileges, and not to forbid any of his friends to serve him or to visit him.*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
ACT	24	24	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6385	" {24} But after some days, Felix came with Drusilla, his wife, who was a Jewess."
ACT	24	24	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6386	" He sent for Paul, and heard him concerning the faith in Christ Jesus."
ACT	24	25	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6387	" {25} As he reasoned about righteousness, self-control, and the judgment to come, Felix was terrified, and answered,"
ACT	24	25	Felix	#05		6388	" “Go your way for this time, and when it is convenient for me, I will summon you.”"
ACT	24	26	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6389	" {26} Meanwhile, he also hoped that money would be given to him by Paul, that he might release him. Therefore also he sent for him more often, and talked with him."
ACT	24	27	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6390	" {27} But when two years were fulfilled, Felix was succeeded by Porcius Festus."
ACT	24	27	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6391	" Felix desired to gain favor with the Jews, so he left Paul in bonds. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"

ACT	25	1	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6393	" {1} Festus therefore, having come into the province, after three days went up to Jerusalem from Caesarea."
ACT	25	2	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6394	 {2} Then the high priest and the principal men of the Jews informed him against Paul.
ACT	25	3	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6395	" {3} They asked Festus for a favor against him, that he would summon him to Jerusalem; plotting to kill him on the way. {4} However Festus answered saying:"
ACT	25	4	Festus	#10		6396	" ""Paul is being held at Caesarea, and I myself am going there soon."
ACT	25	5	Festus	#10		6397	" {5} Let some of your leaders come with me and press charges against him there, if he has done anything wrong."""
ACT	25	6	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6398	" {6} When he had stayed among them more than ten days, he went down to Caesarea."
ACT	25	6	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6399	" On the next day he sat on the judgment seat, and commanded Paul to be brought."
ACT	25	7	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6400	" {7} When he had come, the Jews who had come down from Jerusalem stood around him, bringing against him many and grievous charges which they could not prove."
ACT	25	8	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6401	" {8} Paul defended himself saying,"
ACT	25	8	Paul	#19		6402	" “Neither against the law of the Jews, nor against the temple, nor against Caesar, have I sinned at all.”"
ACT	25	9	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6403	" {9} But Festus, desiring to gain favor with the Jews, answered Paul and said,"
ACT	25	9	Festus	#10		6404	" “Are you willing to go up to Jerusalem, and be judged by me there concerning these things?”"
ACT	25	10	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6405	" {10} But Paul said,"
ACT	25	10	Paul	#19		6406	" “I am standing before Caesar's judgment seat, where I ought to be tried."
ACT	25	10	Paul	#19		6407	" I have done no wrong to the Jews, as you also know very well."
ACT	25	11	Paul	#19		6408	" {11} For if I have done wrong, and have committed anything worthy of death, I don't refuse to die."
ACT	25	11	Paul	#19		6409	" But if none of those things is true that they accuse me of, no one can give me up to them. I appeal to Caesar!”"
ACT	25	12	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6410	" {12} Then Festus, when he had conferred with the council, answered,"
ACT	25	12	Festus	#10		6411	" “You have appealed to Caesar. To Caesar you shall go.”*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
ACT	25	13	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6412	" {13} Now when some days had passed, King Agrippa and Bernice arrived at Caesarea, and greeted Festus."
ACT	25	14	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6413	" {14} As he stayed there many days, Festus laid Paul's case before the king, saying,"
ACT	25	14	Festus	#10		6414	 “There is a certain man here whom Felix left as a prisoner.
ACT	25	15	Festus	#10		6415	" {15} When I went to Jerusalem, the chief priests and the elders of the Jews brought charges against him and asked that he be condemned."
ACT	25	16	Festus	#10		6416	" {16} I said to them that it is not the custom of the Romans to give up any man to destruction, before the accused has met the accusers face to face, and has had opportunity to make his defense concerning the matter laid against him."
ACT	25	17	Festus	#10		6417	" {17} When therefore they had come together here, I didn't delay, but on the next day sat on the judgment seat, and commanded the man to be brought."
ACT	25	18	Festus	#10		6418	" {18} Concerning whom, when the accusers stood up, they brought no charge of such things as I supposed."
ACT	25	19	Festus	#10		6419	" {19} But they had certain questions against him about their own religion, and about one Jesus, who was dead, whom Paul affirmed to be alive."
ACT	25	20	Festus	#10		6420	" {20} Being perplexed how to inquire concerning these things, I asked whether he was willing to go to Jerusalem and there be judged concerning these matters."
ACT	25	21	Festus	#10		6421	" {21} But when Paul had appealed to be kept for the decision of the emperor, I commanded him to be kept until I could send him to Caesar.”"
ACT	25	22	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6422	" {22} Agrippa said to Festus,"
ACT	25	22	King Agrippa	#06		6423	 “I also would like to hear the man myself.”
ACT	25	22	Festus	#10		6424	" “Tomorrow,"""
ACT	25	22	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6425	" he said,"
ACT	25	22	Festus	#10		6426	" “you shall hear him.”*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
ACT	25	23	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6427	" {23} So on the next day, Agrippa and Bernice had come with great pomp, and they entered into the place of hearing with the commanding officers and principal men of the city."
ACT	25	23	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6428	" At the command of Festus, Paul was brought in. {24} Festus said,"
ACT	25	24	Festus	#10		6429	" “King Agrippa, and all men who are here present with us, you see this man."
ACT	25	24	Festus	#10		6430	" All the multitude of the Jews petitioned me, both at Jerusalem and here. They shouted that he ought not to live any longer."
ACT	25	25	Festus	#10		6431	" {25} But when I found that he had committed nothing worthy of death, and as he himself appealed to the emperor I determined to send him."
ACT	25	26	Festus	#10		6432	 {26} But I have nothing definite to write to my lord.
ACT	25	26	Festus	#10		6433	" Therefore I have brought him forth before you, and especially before you, King Agrippa, that, after examination, I may have something to write."
ACT	25	27	Festus	#10		6434	" {27} For it seems to me unreasonable, in sending a prisoner, not to also specify the charges against him.”*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
ACT	26	<<	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6435	ACTS CHP 26
ACT	26	1	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6436	" {1} Agrippa said to Paul,"
ACT	26	1	King Agrippa	#06		6437	 “You may speak for yourself.”
ACT	26	1	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6438	" Then Paul stretched out his hand, and made his defense."
ACT	26	2	Paul	#19		6439	" {2} “I think myself happy, King Agrippa, that I am to make my defense before you this day concerning all the things that I am accused of by the Jews,"
ACT	26	3	Paul	#19		6440	 {3} especially because you are expert in all customs and questions which are among the Jews.
ACT	26	3	Paul	#19		6441	 Therefore I beg you to hear me patiently.
ACT	26	4	Paul	#19		6442	" {4} “Indeed, all the Jews know my way of life from my youth up, which was from the beginning among my own nation and at Jerusalem."
ACT	26	5	Paul	#19		6443	" {5} If they are willing to testify, they would say that I lived my life after the strictest sect of our religion. I was a Pharisee."
ACT	26	6	Paul	#19		6444	 {6} Now I stand here to be judged for the hope of the promise made by God to our fathers.
ACT	26	7	Paul	#19		6445	" {7} Our twelve tribes, earnestly serving night and day, hoped to attain this promise."
ACT	26	7	Paul	#19		6446	" Concerning this hope I am accused by the Jews, King Agrippa!"
ACT	26	8	Paul	#19		6447	" {8} Why is it judged incredible with you, if God does raise the dead?"
ACT	26	9	Paul	#19		6448	 {9} “I myself most certainly thought that I ought to do many things contrary to the name of Jesus of Nazareth.
ACT	26	10	Paul	#19		6449	" {10} This I also did in Jerusalem. I both shut up many of the saints in prisons, having received authority from the chief priests."
ACT	26	10	Paul	#19		6450	 And when they were put to death I gave my vote against them.
ACT	26	11	Paul	#19		6451	" {11} Punishing them often in all the synagogues, I tried to make them blaspheme."
ACT	26	11	Paul	#19		6452	" Being exceedingly enraged against them, I persecuted them even to foreign cities."
ACT	26	12	Paul	#19		6453	 {12} “I was traveling to Damascus with the authority and commission from the chief priests.
ACT	26	13	Paul	#19		6454	" {13} At noon, O king, I saw on the way a light from the sky, brighter than the sun, shining around me and those who traveled with me."
ACT	26	14	Paul	#19		6455	" {14} When we had all fallen to the earth, I heard a voice saying to me in the Hebrew language, 'Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting me? It is hard for you to kick against the goads.'"
ACT	26	15	Paul	#19		6456	" {15} “I said, 'Who are you, Lord?' “He said, 'I am Jesus, whom you are persecuting."
ACT	26	16	Paul	#19		6457	" {16} But arise, and stand on your feet, for I have appeared to you for this purpose: to appoint you a servant and a witness both of the things which you have seen, and of the things which I will reveal to you."
ACT	26	17	Paul	#19		6458	" {17} I will keep you safe from the jews and from the Gentiles, to whom I send you."
ACT	26	18	Paul	#19		6459	" {18} You are to open their eyes, that they may turn from darkness to light and from the power of Satan to God."
ACT	26	18	Paul	#19		6460	 In this way they may receive remission of sins and an inheritance among those who are sanctified by faith in me.'
ACT	26	19	Paul	#19		6461	" {19} “Therefore, King Agrippa, I was not disobedient to the heavenly vision."
ACT	26	20	Paul	#19		6462	" {20} I declared first to them of Damascus, at Jerusalem, and throughout all the country of Judea, and also to the Gentiles, that they should repent and turn to God, doing works worthy of repentance."
ACT	26	21	Paul	#19		6463	" {21} For this reason the Jews seized me in the temple, and tried to kill me."
ACT	26	22	Paul	#19		6464	" {22} Having therefore obtained the help that is from God, I stand to this day testifying both to small and great."
ACT	26	22	Paul	#19		6465	 I say nothing but what the prophets and Moses said would happen.
ACT	26	23	Paul	#19		6466	" {23} I explained how the Christ must suffer, and how, by the resurrection of the dead, he would be first to proclaim light both to these people and to the Gentiles.”"
ACT	26	24	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6467	" {24} As he thus made his defense, Festus said with a loud voice,"
ACT	26	24	Festus	#10		6468	" “Paul, you are crazy! Your great learning is driving you insane!”"
ACT	26	25	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6469	" {25} But he said,"
ACT	26	25	Paul	#19		6470	" “I am not crazy, most excellent Festus, but boldly declare words of truth and reasonableness."
ACT	26	26	Paul	#19		6471	" {26} For the king knows of these things, to whom also I speak freely."
ACT	26	26	Paul	#19		6472	" For I am persuaded that none of these things is hidden from him, for this has not been done in a corner."
ACT	26	27	Paul	#19		6473	" {27} King Agrippa, do you believe the prophets? I know that you believe.”"
ACT	26	28	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6474	" {28} Agrippa said to Paul,"
ACT	26	28	King Agrippa	#06		6475	 “With a little persuasion are you trying to make me a Christian?”
ACT	26	29	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6476	" {29} Paul said,"
ACT	26	29	Paul	#19		6477	" “I pray to God, that whether with little or with much, not only you, but also all that hear me this day, might become such as I am, except for these bonds.”"
