ACT	27	<<	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6483	ACTS CHP 27
ACT	27	1	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6484	" {1} When it was determined that we should sail for Italy, they delivered Paul and certain other prisoners to a centurion named Julius, of the Augustan band."
ACT	27	2	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6485	" {2} Embarking in a ship of Adramyttium, which was about to sail to places on the coast of Asia, we put to sea."
ACT	27	2	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6486	" Aristarchus, a Macedonian of Thessalonica was with us."
ACT	27	3	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6487	" ||| DO NOT COMBINE |||*~*{Music--Starts @ v3}*~**~* {3} The next day, we touched at Sidon. Julius treated Paul kindly, and gave him permission to go to his friends and refresh himself."
ACT	27	4	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6488	" {4} Putting to sea from there, we sailed under the lee of Cyprus, because the winds were contrary."
ACT	27	5	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6489	" {5} When we had sailed across the sea which is off Cilicia and Pamphylia, we came to Myra, a city of Lycia."
ACT	27	6	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6490	" {6} There the centurion found a ship of Alexandria sailing for Italy, and he put us on board."
ACT	27	7	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6491	" {7} When we had sailed slowly many days, and had come with difficulty opposite Cnidus, the wind not allowing us further, we sailed under the lee of Crete, opposite Salmone."
ACT	27	8	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6492	" {8} With difficulty sailing along it we came to a certain place called Fair Havens, near the city of Lasea."
ACT	27	9	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6493	" {9} When much time had passed and the voyage was now dangerous, because the Fast had now already gone by, Paul admonished them, {10} and said to them,"
ACT	27	10	Paul	#19		6494	" “Sirs, I perceive that the voyage will be with injury and much loss, not only of the cargo and the ship, but also of our lives.”"
ACT	27	11	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6495	 {11} But the centurion gave more heed to the master and to the owner of the ship than to those things which were spoken by Paul.
ACT	27	12	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6496	" {12} Because the haven was not suitable to winter in, the majority advised going to sea from there, if by any means they could reach Phoenix, and winter there."
ACT	27	12	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6497	" This was a port of Crete, looking northwest and southwest."
ACT	27	13	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6498	" {13} When the south wind blew softly, they supposed that they had obtained their purpose."
ACT	27	13	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6499	" They weighed anchor and sailed along Crete, close to shore."
ACT	27	14	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6500	" ||| DO NOT COMBINE |||*~*{SFX--Wind--Starts @ v14}*~**~* {14} But before long, a stormy wind beat down from shore, which is called Euroclydon."
ACT	27	15	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6501	" {15} When the ship was caught, and couldn't face the wind, {F8 Music--Starts} we gave way to it, and were driven along."
ACT	27	16	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6502	" {16} Running under the lee of a small island called Clauda, we were able, with difficulty, to secure the boat."
ACT	27	17	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6503	" {17} After they had hoisted it up, they used cables to help reinforce the ship."
ACT	27	17	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6504	" Fearing that they would run aground on the Syrtis sand bars, they lowered the sea anchor, and so were driven along."
ACT	27	18	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6505	" {18} As we labored exceedingly with the storm, the next day they began to throw things overboard."
ACT	27	19	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6506	" {19} On the third day, they threw out the ship's tackle with their own hands."
ACT	27	20	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6507	" {20} When neither sun nor stars shone on us for many days, and no small storm pressed on us, all hope that we would be saved was now taken away."
ACT	27	21	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6508	" {21} When they had been long without food, Paul stood up in the middle of them, and said,"
ACT	27	21	Paul	#19		6509	" “Sirs, you should have listened to me, and not have set sail from Crete, and have gotten this injury and loss."
ACT	27	22	Paul	#19		6510	" {22} Now I exhort you to cheer up, for there will be no loss of life among you, but only of the ship."
ACT	27	23	Paul	#19		6511	" {23} For there stood by me this night an angel, belonging to the God whose I am and whom I serve."
ACT	27	24	Paul	#19		6512	" {24} He said, 'Don't be afraid, Paul. You must stand before Caesar. Behold, God has granted you all those who sail with you.'"
ACT	27	25	Paul	#19		6513	" {25} Therefore, sirs, cheer up! For I believe God, that it will be just as it has been spoken to me."
ACT	27	26	Paul	#19		6514	" {26} But we must run aground on a certain island.”*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
ACT	27	27	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6515	" {27} But when the fourteenth night had come, we were driven back and forth in the Adriatic Sea."
ACT	27	27	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6516	 About midnight the sailors surmised that they were drawing near to some land.
ACT	27	28	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6517	" ||| DO NOT COMBINE |||*~*{Music--Starts @ v28}*~**~* {28} They took soundings, and found twenty fathoms."
ACT	27	28	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6518	" After a little while, they took soundings again, and found fifteen fathoms."
ACT	27	29	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6519	" {29} Fearing that we would run aground on rocky ground, they let go four anchors from the stern, and wished for daylight."
ACT	27	30	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6520	" {30} The sailors were trying to flee out of the ship, and had lowered the boat into the sea, pretending that they would lay out anchors from the bow."
ACT	27	31	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6521	" {31} But Paul said to the centurion and to the soldiers,"
ACT	27	31	Paul	#19		6522	" “Unless these stay in the ship, you can't be saved.”"
ACT	27	32	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6523	" {32} Then the soldiers cut away the ropes of the boat, and let it fall off."
ACT	27	33	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6524	" {33} While the day was coming on, Paul begged them all to take some food, saying,"
ACT	27	33	Paul	#19		6525	" “This day is the fourteenth day that you wait and continue fasting, having taken nothing."
ACT	27	34	Paul	#19		6526	" {34} Therefore I beg you to take some food, for this is for your safety."
ACT	27	34	Paul	#19		6527	 Not a hair will perish from any of your heads.”
ACT	27	35	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6528	" {35} When he had said this, and had taken bread, he gave thanks to God in the presence of all, and he broke it, and began to eat."
ACT	27	36	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6529	" {36} Then they all cheered up, and they also took food."
ACT	27	37	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6530	" {37} In all, we were two hundred seventy-six souls on the ship."
ACT	27	38	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6531	" {38} When they had eaten enough, they lightened the ship, throwing out the wheat into the sea."
ACT	27	39	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6532	" {39} When it was day, they didn't recognize the land, but they noticed a certain bay with a beach."
ACT	27	39	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6533	 They decided to try to drive the ship onto it.
ACT	27	40	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6534	" {40} Casting off the anchors, they left them in the sea, at the same time untying the rudder ropes."
ACT	27	40	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6535	" Hoisting up the foresail to the wind, they made for the beach."
ACT	27	41	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6536	" {41} But coming to a place where two seas met, they ran the vessel aground."
ACT	27	41	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6537	" The bow struck and remained immovable, but the stern began to break up by the violence of the waves."
ACT	27	42	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6538	" {42} The soldiers' counsel was to kill the prisoners, so that none of them would swim out and escape."
ACT	27	43	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6539	" {43} But the centurion, desiring to save Paul, stopped them from their purpose."
ACT	27	43	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6540	 He commanded that those who could swim should throw themselves overboard first to go toward the land.
ACT	27	44	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6541	" {44} He commanded the rest to follow, some on planks, and some on other things from the ship."
ACT	27	44	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6542	" So it happened that they all escaped safely to the land.*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
ACT	28	<<	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6543	ACTS CHP 28
ACT	28	1	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6544	" {1} When we had escaped, then they learned that the island was called Malta."
ACT	28	2	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6545	 {2} The natives showed us uncommon kindness.
ACT	28	2	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6546	" They kindled a fire, and received us all, because of the present rain, and because of the cold."
ACT	28	3	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6547	" {3} But when Paul had gathered a bundle of sticks and laid them on the fire, a viper came out because of the heat, and fastened on his hand."
ACT	28	4	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6548	" {4} When the natives saw the creature hanging from his hand, they said one to another,"
ACT	28	4	Man	#16		6549	 “No doubt this man is a murderer.
ACT	28	4	Man	#16		6550	" Though he has escaped from the sea, Justice has not allowed him to live.”"
ACT	28	5	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6551	" {5} However he shook off the creature into the fire, and wasn't harmed."
ACT	28	6	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6552	 {6} But they expected that he would have swollen or fallen down dead suddenly.
ACT	28	6	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6553	" But when they watched for a long time and saw nothing bad happen to him, they changed their minds, and said,"
ACT	28	6	Man	#16		6554	" ""He is a god!"""
ACT	28	7	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6555	" {7} Now in the neighborhood of that place were lands belonging to the chief man of the island, named Publius."
ACT	28	7	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6556	" He received us, and courteously entertained us for three days."
ACT	28	8	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6557	 {8} It happened that the father of Publius lay sick of fever and dysentery.
ACT	28	8	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6558	" Paul entered in to him, prayed, and laying his hands on him, healed him."
ACT	28	9	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6559	" {9} Then when this was done, the rest also who had diseases in the island came, and were cured."
ACT	28	10	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6560	" {10} They also honored us with many honors, and when we sailed, they put on board the things that we needed."
ACT	28	11	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6561	" {11} After three months, we set sail in a ship of Alexandria."
ACT	28	11	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6562	" It had wintered in the island, and its name was “The Twin Brothers.”"
ACT	28	12	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6563	" {12} Touching at Syracuse, we stayed there three days."
ACT	28	13	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6564	" {13} From there we circled around and arrived at Rhegium. After one day, a south wind sprang up, and on the second day we came to Puteoli."
ACT	28	14	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6565	" {14} There we found brothers, and were entreated to stay with them for seven days. So we came to Rome."
ACT	28	15	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6566	" {15} From there the brothers, when they heard of us, came to meet us as far as The Market of Appius and The Three Taverns."
ACT	28	15	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6567	" When Paul saw them, he thanked God, and took courage."
ACT	28	16	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6568	" ||| DO NOT COMBINE |||*~*{Music--Ends before v16}*~**~* {16} When we entered into Rome, the centurion delivered the prisoners to the captain of the guard, but Paul was allowed to stay by himself with the soldier who guarded him.*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
ACT	28	17	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6569	 {17} It happened that after three days Paul called together those who were the leaders of the Jews.
ACT	28	17	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6570	" When they had come together, he said to them,"
ACT	28	17	Paul	#19		6571	" ""Brothers, I have done nothing against our people or against the customs of our ancestors."
ACT	28	17	Paul	#19		6572	" However, I was arrested in Jerusalem and was delivered to the Romans."
ACT	28	18	Paul	#19		6573	" {18} When they had examined me, they desired to set me free because there was no reason for the death penalty in my case."
ACT	28	19	Paul	#19		6574	" {19} But the Jews objected and so I was compelled to appeal to Caesar. However, I had no charge to bring against my nation."
ACT	28	20	Paul	#19		6575	 {20} For this cause therefore I asked to see you and to speak with you.
ACT	28	20	Paul	#19		6576	 For because of the hope of Israel I am bound with this chain.”
ACT	28	21	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6577	" {21} They said to him,"
ACT	28	21	Religious Leader	#17		6578	" “We neither received letters from Judea concerning you, nor did any of the brothers come here and report or speak any evil of you."
ACT	28	22	Religious Leader	#17		6579	 {22} But we desire to hear what your views are. For we know that people everywhere are talking against this sect.”
ACT	28	23	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6580	" {23} When they had appointed him a day, many people came to him at his lodging."
ACT	28	23	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6581	" He explained to them, testifying about the Kingdom of God, and persuading them concerning Jesus, both from the law of Moses and from the prophets, from morning until evening."
ACT	28	24	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6582	" {24} Some believed the things which were spoken, and some disbelieved."
ACT	28	25	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6583	" {25} When they didn't agree among themselves, they departed after Paul had spoken one word,"
ACT	28	25	Paul	#19		6584	" “The Holy Spirit spoke rightly through Isaiah, the prophet, to our fathers, saying,"
ACT	28	26	Paul	#19		6585	" NOTE: This is a Paul line.*~* {26} 'Go to this people, and say, in hearing, you will hear, but will in no way understand. In seeing, you will see, but will in no way perceive."
ACT	28	27	Paul	#19		6586	" {27} For this people's heart has grown callous. Their ears are dull of hearing. Their eyes they have closed. Lest they should see with their eyes, hear with their ears, understand with their heart, and would turn again, and I would heal them.'"
ACT	28	28	Paul	#19		6587	" {28} “Be it known therefore to you, that the salvation of God is sent to the nations. They will also listen.”"
ACT	28	29	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6588	" {29} When he had said these words, the Jews departed, having a great dispute among themselves.*~**~*||| + 1.5 SECs |||*~*"
ACT	28	30	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6589	" {30} Paul stayed two whole years in his own rented house, and received all who were coming to him."
ACT	28	31	Narr_005: Acts	#11		6590	" {31} He preached the Kingdom of God, and taught the things concerning the Lord Jesus Christ with all boldness and without hindrance. *~**~*||| + 5 SECs |||*~*"
ROM	1	<<	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6591	"ROMANS*~*ROMANS CHP 1"
ROM	1	1	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6592	" {1} Paul, a servant of Jesus Christ our Lord, was called to be an apostle, set apart for the Good News of God."
ROM	1	2	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6593	" {2} This Good News is that which he promised before through his prophets in the holy Scriptures,"
ROM	1	3	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6594	" {3} It concerns his Son, who was born of the seed of David according to the flesh."
ROM	1	4	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6595	" {4} He was declared to be the Son of God with power, according to the Spirit of holiness, by the resurrection from the dead, Jesus Christ our Lord,"
ROM	1	5	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6596	" {5} through whom we received grace and apostleship, for obedience of faith among all the nations, for his name's sake;"
ROM	1	6	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6597	 {6} among whom you are also called to belong to Jesus Christ;
ROM	1	7	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6598	" {7} to all who are in Rome, beloved of God, called to be saints:"
ROM	1	7	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6599	 Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
ROM	1	8	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6600	" {8} First, I thank my God through Jesus Christ for all of you, that your faith is proclaimed throughout the whole world."
ROM	1	9	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6601	" {9} For God is my witness, whom I serve in my spirit in the Good News of his Son, how unceasingly I make mention of you always in my prayers."
ROM	1	10	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6602	" {10} I pray that at last, by God's will, the way may be opened for me to visit you."
ROM	1	11	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6603	" {11} For I long to see you, that I may impart to you some spiritual gift, to the end that you may be established;"
ROM	1	12	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6604	" {12} that is, that I with you may be encouraged in you, each of us by the other's faith, both yours and mine."
ROM	1	13	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6605	" {13} Now I don't desire to have you unaware, brothers, that I often planned to come to you, and was hindered so far, that I might have some fruit among you also, even as among the rest of the Gentiles."
ROM	1	14	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6606	" {14} I am debtor both to Greeks and to foreigners, both to the wise and to the foolish."
ROM	1	15	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6607	" {15} So, as much as is in me, I am eager to preach the Good News to you also who are in Rome."
ROM	1	16	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6608	" {16} For I am not ashamed of the Good News of Christ, for it is the power of God for salvation for everyone who believes; for the Jew first, and also for the Greek."
ROM	1	17	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6609	" {17} For in it is revealed God's righteousness from faith to faith. As it is written,"
ROM	1	17	God-FX1	#20		6610	 “But the righteous shall live by faith.”
ROM	1	18	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6611	" {18} For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men, who hold the truth in unrighteousness."
ROM	1	19	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6612	 {19} That which is known of God is revealed in men for God revealed it to them.
ROM	1	20	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6613	" {20} For the invisible things of him since the creation of the world are clearly seen, being perceived through the things that are made, even his everlasting power and divinity; that they may be without excuse."
ROM	1	21	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6614	" {21} Because, knowing God, they didn't glorify him as God, neither did they give thanks."
ROM	1	21	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6615	" Instead, they became vain in their reasoning, and their senseless heart was darkened."
ROM	1	22	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6616	" {22} Professing themselves to be wise, they became fools."
ROM	1	23	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6617	" {23} They traded the glory of the incorruptible God for the likeness of an image of corruptible man, and of birds, and four-footed animals, and creeping things."
ROM	1	24	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6618	" {24} Therefore God also gave them up in the lusts of their hearts to uncleanness, that their bodies should be dishonored among themselves."
ROM	1	25	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6619	" {25} They exchanged the truth of God for a lie, and worshiped and served the creature rather than the Creator, who is blessed forever. Amen."
ROM	1	26	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6620	" {26} For this reason, God gave them up to vile passions."
ROM	1	26	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6621	 For their women changed the natural function into that which is against nature.
ROM	1	27	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6622	" {27} Likewise also the men, leaving the natural function of the woman, burned in their lust toward one another."
ROM	1	27	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6623	" They were doing what is inappropriate with men, and receiving in themselves the due penalty of their error."
ROM	1	28	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6624	" {28} Even as they refused to have God in their knowledge, God gave them up to a reprobate mind, to do those things which are not fitting."
ROM	1	29	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6625	" {29} They are filled with all unrighteousness, sexual immorality, wickedness, covetousness, malice;"
ROM	1	29	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6626	" full of envy, murder, strife, deceit, evil habits, secret slanderers,"
ROM	1	30	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6627	" {30} backbiters, hateful to God, insolent, haughty, boastful, inventors of evil things, disobedient to parents,"
ROM	1	31	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6628	" {31} without understanding, covenant breakers, without natural affection, unforgiving, unmerciful;"
ROM	1	32	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6629	 {32} They know that God said that those who practice such things are worthy of death.
ROM	1	32	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6630	" Yet not only do they do them, they also approve of others who practice them. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
ROM	2	<<	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6631	ROMANS CHP 2
ROM	2	1	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6632	" {1} Therefore you are without excuse, O man, whoever you are who judge."
ROM	2	1	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6633	" For in that which you judge another, you condemn yourself. For you who judge practice the same things."
ROM	2	2	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6634	" ||| DO NOT COMBINE |||*~*{Music--Starts @ v2}*~**~* {2} We know that the judgment of God is according to truth against those who practice such things."
ROM	2	3	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6635	" {3} Do you think this, O man who judges those who practice such things, and do the same, that you will escape the judgment of God?"
ROM	2	4	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6636	" {4} Will you ignore the wealth of His mercy, his patience and his broad-mindedness?"
ROM	2	4	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6637	 Do you not know that God's purpose of grace is to lead you to repentance?
ROM	2	5	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6638	" {5} But according to your hardness and unrepentant heart you are treasuring up for yourself wrath in the day of wrath, revelation, and of the righteous judgment of God;"
ROM	2	6	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6639	 {6} He will pay back to everyone according to their works:”
ROM	2	7	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6640	" {7} Those who by patience in well-doing seek for glory, honor, and incorruptibility, they will receive eternal life."
ROM	2	8	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6641	" {8} But to those who are self-seeking, and don't obey the truth, but obey unrighteousness, there will be wrath and indignation."
ROM	2	9	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6642	" {9} Oppression and anguish will be on every soul of man who works evil, to the Jew first, and also to the Greek."
ROM	2	10	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6643	" {10} But glory, honor, and peace go to every man who works good, to the Jew first, and also to the Greek."
ROM	2	11	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6644	 {11} For there is no partiality with God.
ROM	2	12	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6645	 {12} For as many as have sinned without law will also perish without the law.
ROM	2	12	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6646	 As many as have sinned under the law will be judged by the law.
ROM	2	13	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6647	" {13} For it isn't the hearers of the law who are righteous before God, but the doers of the law will be justified."
ROM	2	14	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6648	" {14} (For when Gentiles who don't have the law do by nature the things of the law, they are a law to themselves, even though they do not have the law."
ROM	2	15	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6649	 {15} They show that the work of the law is written in their hearts.
ROM	2	15	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6650	 Their conscience testifies with them and their thoughts among themselves accusing or else excusing them).
ROM	2	16	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6651	" {16} There will be a day when God will judge the secrets of men, according to the Good News that I preach."
ROM	2	17	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6652	" {17} Indeed you bear the name of a Jew, and rest on the law, and glory in God."
ROM	2	18	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6653	" {18} You know his will, and approve the things that are excellent, being instructed out of the law."
ROM	2	19	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6654	" {19} You are confident that you yourself are a guide of the blind, a light to those who are in darkness."
ROM	2	20	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6655	" {20} You think you are a corrector of the foolish, a teacher of babies, having in the law the form of knowledge and of the truth."
ROM	2	21	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6656	" {21} You therefore who teach another, don't you teach yourself?"
ROM	2	21	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6657	" You who preach that a man shouldn't steal, do you steal?"
ROM	2	22	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6658	" {22} You who say a man shouldn't commit adultery. Do you commit adultery? You who abhor idols, do you rob temples?"
ROM	2	23	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6659	" {23} You who glory in the law, through your disobedience of the law do you dishonor God? {24} For just as it is written:"
ROM	2	24	Scripture Quote-FX1	#13		6660	" “the name of God is blasphemed among the Gentiles because of you,"""
ROM	2	25	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6661	" {25} For circumcision indeed profits, if you are a doer of the law."
ROM	2	25	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6662	" But if you are a transgressor of the law, your circumcision has become uncircumcision."
ROM	2	26	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6663	" {26} If therefore the uncircumcised keep the ordinances of the law, won't his uncircumcision be accounted as circumcision?"
ROM	2	27	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6664	" {27} Won't the uncircumcision which is by nature, if it fulfills the law, judge you, who with the letter and circumcision are a transgressor of the law?"
ROM	2	28	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6665	" {28} For he is not a Jew who is one outwardly, neither is that circumcision which is outward in the flesh;"
ROM	2	29	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6666	" {29} but he is a Jew who is one inwardly, and circumcision is that of the heart."
ROM	2	29	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6667	" It is in the spirit not in the letter; His praise is not from men, but from God. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
ROM	3	<<	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6668	ROMANS CHP 3
ROM	3	1	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6669	 {1} Then what advantage does the Jew have? Or what is the profit of circumcision?
ROM	3	2	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6670	" {2} Much in every way! Because first of all, they were entrusted with the oracles of God."
ROM	3	3	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6671	 {3} For what if some were without faith? Will their lack of faith nullify the faithfulness of God?
ROM	3	4	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6672	" {4} May it never be! Yes, let God be found true, but every man a liar. As it is written,"
ROM	3	4	Scripture Quote-FX1	#13		6673	" “That you might be justified in your words, and might prevail when you come into judgment.”"
ROM	3	5	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6674	" {5} But if our unrighteousness commends the righteousness of God, what will we say?"
ROM	3	5	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6675	 Is God unrighteous who inflicts wrath? I speak like men do.
ROM	3	6	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6676	 {6} May it never be! For then how will God judge the world?
ROM	3	7	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6677	" {7} For if the truth of God through my lie abounded to his glory, why am I also still judged as a sinner?"
ROM	3	8	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6678	" {8} Why not (as we are slanderously reported, and as some affirm that we say), “Let us do evil, that good may come?” Those who say so are justly condemned."
ROM	3	9	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6679	" {9} What then? Are we better than they? No, in no way!"
ROM	3	9	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6680	" For we previously warned both Jews and Greeks, that they are all under sin. {10} As it is written,"
ROM	3	10	Scripture Quote-FX1	#13		6681	" “There is no one righteous; no, not one. {11} There is no one who understands. There is no one who seeks after God."
ROM	3	12	Scripture Quote-FX1	#13		6682	" {12} They have all turned aside. They have together become unprofitable. There is no one who does good, no, not, so much as one.”"
ROM	3	13	Scripture Quote-FX1	#13		6683	 {13} “Their throat is an open tomb. With their tongues they have used deceit.”
ROM	3	13	Scripture Quote-FX1	#13		6684	 “The poison of vipers is under their lips“; {14} “whose mouth is full of cursing and bitterness.”
ROM	3	15	Scripture Quote-FX1	#13		6685	 {15} “Their feet are swift to shed blood. {16} Destruction and misery are in their ways.
ROM	3	17	Scripture Quote-FX1	#13		6686	" {17} The way of peace, they haven't known.” {18} “There is no fear of God before their eyes.”"
ROM	3	19	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6687	" {19} Now we know that whatever things the law says, it speaks to those who are under the law."
ROM	3	19	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6688	" No one can say that he does not know what sin is, and all the world may be held accountable to the judgment of God."
ROM	3	20	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6689	" {20} Because by the works of the law, no flesh will be justified in his sight. For through the law comes the knowledge of sin."
ROM	3	21	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6690	" {21} But now apart from the law, a righteousness of God has been revealed, being testified by the law and the prophets;"
ROM	3	22	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6691	 {22} This righteousness of God comes through faith in Jesus Christ to all and on all those who believe. For there is no distinction.
ROM	3	23	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6692	" {23} For all have sinned, and fall short of the glory of God;"
ROM	3	24	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6693	 {24} Anyone can be justified freely by his grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus.
ROM	3	25	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6694	" {25} God gave him to be an atoning sacrifice, through faith in his blood, for a demonstration of his righteousness through the passing over of prior sins, in God's forbearance;"
ROM	3	26	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6695	" {26} God demonstrates his righteousness at this present time; that he might himself be just, and the justifier of him who has faith in Jesus."
ROM	3	27	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6696	" {27} Where then is the boasting? It is excluded. By what kind of law? Of works? No, but by a law of faith."
ROM	3	28	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6697	 {28} We maintain therefore that a man is justified by faith apart from the works of the law.
ROM	3	29	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6698	" {29} Or is God the God of Jews only? Isn't he the God of Gentiles also? Yes, of Gentiles also."
ROM	3	30	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6699	" {30} Indeed there is one God who will justify the circumcised by faith, and the uncircumcised through faith."
ROM	3	31	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6700	" {31} Do we then nullify the law through faith? May it never be! No, we establish the law. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
ROM	4	<<	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6701	ROMANS CHP 4
ROM	4	1	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6702	" {1} What then will we say that Abraham, our forefather, has found according to the flesh?"
ROM	4	2	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6703	" {2} For if Abraham was justified by works, he has something to boast about, but not toward God. {3} For what does the Scripture say?"
ROM	4	3	Scripture Quote-FX1	#13		6704	" “Abraham believed God, and it was accounted to him for righteousness.”"
ROM	4	4	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6705	" {4} Now to him who works, the reward is not counted as grace, but as something owed."
ROM	4	5	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6706	" {5} But to him who doesn't work, but believes in him who justifies the ungodly, his faith is accounted for righteousness."
ROM	4	6	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6707	 {6} Even as David also pronounces blessing on the man to whom God counts righteousness apart from works. {7} David said:
ROM	4	7	Scripture Quote-FX1	#13		6708	" “Blessed are they whose iniquities are forgiven, whose sins are covered."
ROM	4	8	Scripture Quote-FX1	#13		6709	 {8} Blessed is the man whom the Lord will by no means charge with sin.”
ROM	4	9	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6710	" {9} Is this blessing then pronounced on the circumcised, or on the uncircumcised also?"
ROM	4	9	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6711	 For we say that faith was accounted to Abraham for righteousness.
ROM	4	10	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6712	" {10} How then was it counted? When he was in circumcision, or in uncircumcision? Not in circumcision, but in uncircumcision."
ROM	4	11	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6713	" {11} He received the sign of circumcision, a seal of the righteousness of the faith which he had while he was in uncircumcision."
ROM	4	11	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6714	" In this way Abraham is the spiritual father of all those who believe, though they might be in uncircumcision, that righteousness might also be accounted to them."
ROM	4	12	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6715	" {12} He is the father of circumcision to those who not only are of the circumcision, but who also walk in the steps of that faith of our father Abraham, which he had in uncircumcision."
ROM	4	13	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6716	 {13} God promised Abraham and his descendants that they would be heirs to the world.
ROM	4	13	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6717	" This promise was made not because Abraham had obeyed the law *, but because he believed in God and had been accepted by him."
ROM	4	14	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6718	" {14} For if those who are of the law are heirs, faith is made void, and the promise is made of no effect."
ROM	4	15	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6719	" {15} For the law works wrath, for where there is no law, neither is there disobedience."
ROM	4	16	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6720	" {16} Therefore, God's promise depends on faith, in order that the promise may be guaranteed as God's gift to all the descendants of Abraham."
ROM	4	16	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6721	 It is not only for those who obey the law but also for those who believe as Abraham believed in God because he is the spiritual father of us all. {17} * As the Scriptures say:
ROM	4	17	God-FX1	#20		6722	 “I have made you a father of many nations.”
ROM	4	17	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6723	" Abraham is our father in the sight of God, in whom he believed --- The God who gives life to the dead, and calls the things that are not, as though they were."
ROM	4	18	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6724	" {18} Who in hope believed against hope, to the end that he might become a father of many nations, according to that which had been spoken,"
ROM	4	18	God-FX1	#20		6725	 “So will your seed be.”
ROM	4	19	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6726	" {19} Without being weakened in faith, he didn't consider his own body, already having been worn out, (he being about a hundred years old), and the deadness of Sarah's womb."
ROM	4	20	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6727	" {20} Yet, looking to the promise of God, he didn't waver through unbelief, but grew strong through faith, giving glory to God."
ROM	4	21	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6728	" {21} He was fully assured that what God had promised, God was also able to perform."
ROM	4	22	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6729	 {22} Therefore it also was “reckoned to him for righteousness.”
ROM	4	23	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6730	 {23} Now it was not written that it was accounted to him for his sake alone.
ROM	4	24	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6731	" {24} It was accounted for our sake also, to whom it will be accounted, who believe in him who raised Jesus, our Lord, from the dead."
ROM	4	25	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6732	" {25} Jesus was delivered up for our trespasses, and was raised for our justification. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
ROM	5	<<	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6733	ROMANS CHP 5
ROM	5	1	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6734	" {1} Being therefore justified by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ; {F8 Music--Starts}"
ROM	5	2	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6735	" {2} Through Jesus we also have our access, by faith, into this grace in which we stand. We rejoice in hope of the glory of God."
ROM	5	3	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6736	" {3} Not only this, but we also rejoice in our sufferings, knowing that suffering works perseverance; {4} and perseverance, proven character; and proven character, hope:"
ROM	5	5	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6737	" {5} and hope doesn't disappoint us, because God's love has been poured out into our hearts through the Holy Spirit who was given to us."
ROM	5	6	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6738	" {6} For while we were yet weak, at the right time Christ died for the ungodly."
ROM	5	7	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6739	 {7} For one will hardly die for a righteous man. Yet perhaps for a righteous person someone would even dare to die.
ROM	5	8	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6740	" {8} But God commends his own love toward us, in that while we were yet sinners, Christ died for us."
ROM	5	9	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6741	" {9} Much more then, being now justified by his blood, we will be saved from God's wrath through him."
ROM	5	10	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6742	" {10} For if, while we were enemies, we were reconciled to God through the death of his Son, much more, being reconciled, we will be saved by his life."
ROM	5	11	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6743	" {11} Not only so, but we also rejoice in God through our Lord Jesus Christ, through whom we have now received the reconciliation."
ROM	5	12	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6744	" {12} Sin entered the world through one man, and his sin brought death."
ROM	5	12	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6745	" As a result, death has spread throughout the whole human race because everyone has sinned."
ROM	5	13	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6746	" {13} For until the law, sin was in the world; but sin is not charged when there is no law."
ROM	5	14	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6747	" {14} Nevertheless death reigned from Adam until Moses, even over those whose sins weren't like Adam's disobedience, who is a foreshadowing of him who was to come."
ROM	5	15	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6748	 {15} But the free gift isn't like the trespass.
ROM	5	15	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6749	" For if by the trespass of the one the many died, much more did the grace of God, and the gift by the grace of the one man, Jesus Christ, abound to the many."
ROM	5	16	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6750	 {16} The gift is not as through one who sinned:
ROM	5	16	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6751	" for the judgment came by one to condemnation, but the free gift came of many trespasses to justification."
ROM	5	17	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6752	" {17} For if by the trespass of the one, death reigned through the one, so much more will those who receive the abundance of grace and of the gift of righteousness reign in life through the one, Jesus Christ."
ROM	5	18	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6753	" {18} So then as through one trespass, all men were condemned; even so through one act of righteousness, all men were justified to life."
ROM	5	19	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6754	" {19} For as through the one man's disobedience many were made sinners, even so through the obedience of the one, many will be made righteous."
ROM	5	20	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6755	" {20} The law came in besides, that the trespass might abound;"
ROM	5	20	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6756	" but where sin abounded, grace abounded more exceedingly."
ROM	5	21	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6757	" {21} As sin reigned in death, even so grace might reign through righteousness to eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
ROM	6	<<	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6758	ROMANS CHP 6
ROM	6	1	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6759	" {1} What shall we say then? Shall we continue in sin, that grace may abound?"
ROM	6	2	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6760	" {2} May it never be! We who died to sin, how could we live in it any longer?"
ROM	6	3	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6761	 {3} Or don't you know that all we who were baptized into Christ Jesus were baptized into his death?
ROM	6	4	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6762	" {4} So when we were baptized, we were buried with him because we died with him."
ROM	6	4	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6763	" And therefore, just as Christ was raised by the power of the glorious Father, we too may live a new life."
ROM	6	5	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6764	" {5} For if we have become united with him in the likeness of his death, we will also be part of his resurrection."
ROM	6	6	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6765	" {6} We know this, that our old man was crucified with him, that the body of sin might be done away with, so that we would no longer be in bondage to sin."
ROM	6	7	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6766	 {7} For he who has died has been freed from sin.
ROM	6	8	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6767	" {8} But if we be dead with Christ, we believe that we will also live with him."
ROM	6	9	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6768	" {9} We know that Christ, being raised from the dead, dies no more. Death no more has dominion over him!"
ROM	6	10	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6769	" {10} For the death that he died, he died to sin one time; but the life that he lives, he lives to God."
ROM	6	11	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6770	" {11} Thus consider yourselves also to be dead to sin, but alive to God in Christ Jesus our Lord."
ROM	6	12	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6771	" {12} Therefore don't let sin reign in your mortal body, that you should obey it in its lusts."
ROM	6	13	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6772	 {13} Neither present your members to sin as instruments of unrighteousness.
ROM	6	13	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6773	" Rather, present yourselves to God, as alive from the dead, and your members as instruments of righteousness to God."
ROM	6	14	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6774	" {14} For sin will not have dominion over you. For you are not under law, but under grace."
ROM	6	15	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6775	" {15} What then? Shall we sin, because we are not under law, but under grace? May it never be!"
ROM	6	16	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6776	" {16} You do not know this? When you are put in the service of someone as slaves, you are slaves of the master whom you obey."
ROM	6	16	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6777	" So, either you are slaves to sin, and sin leads you to death, or you are servants of God, and God makes you righteous because you obey him."
ROM	6	17	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6778	" {17} But thanks be to God, that, whereas you were bondservants of sin, you became obedient from the heart to that form of teaching whereunto you were delivered."
ROM	6	18	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6779	" {18} Being made free from sin, you became bondservants of righteousness."
ROM	6	19	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6780	 {19} I use a human comparison because you have trouble understanding.
ROM	6	19	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6781	" Formerly, as slaves, you put your body in the service of an immoral life and ever increasing wickedness, and the result was disobedience to God."
ROM	6	19	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6782	" Similarly, today, as slaves, put your body in the service of what is right, and the result will be a life that pleases God."
ROM	6	20	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6783	" {20} For when you were servants of sin, you were free in regard to righteousness."
ROM	6	21	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6784	 {21} What fruit then did you have at that time in the things of which you are now ashamed? For the end of those things is death.
ROM	6	22	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6785	 {22} But now you have been set free from sin and are slaves of God.
ROM	6	22	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6786	" With that you get a life completely devoted to him, and the result is that you have eternal life."
ROM	6	23	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6787	" {23} For the wages of sin is death, but the free gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
ROM	7	<<	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6788	ROMANS CHP 7
ROM	7	1	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6789	" {1} Or don't you know, brothers (for I speak to men who know the law), that the law has dominion over a man for as long as he lives?"
ROM	7	2	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6790	" ||| DO NOT COMBINE |||*~*{Music--Starts @ v2}*~**~* {2} For the woman that has a husband is bound by law to the husband while he lives."
ROM	7	2	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6791	" But if the husband dies, she is discharged from the law of the husband."
ROM	7	3	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6792	" {3} So then if, while the husband lives, she is joined to another man, she would be called an adulteress."
ROM	7	3	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6793	" But if the husband dies, she is free from the law, so that she is no adulteress, though she is joined to another man."
ROM	7	4	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6794	" {4} Therefore, my brothers, you also were made dead to the law through the body of Christ, that you would be joined to another, to him who was raised from the dead, that we might bring forth fruit to God."
ROM	7	5	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6795	" {5} For when we were in the flesh, the sinful passions which were through the law, worked in our members to bring forth fruit to death."
ROM	7	6	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6796	" {6} But now we have been discharged from the law, having died to that in which we were held;"
ROM	7	6	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6797	" so that we serve in newness of the spirit, and not in oldness of the letter."
ROM	7	7	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6798	 {7} What shall we say then? Is the law sin? May it never be!
ROM	7	7	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6799	" However, I wouldn't have known sin, except through the law. For I wouldn't have known coveting, unless the law had said,"
ROM	7	7	God-FX1	#20		6800	 “You shall not covet.”
ROM	7	8	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6801	" {8} But sin, finding occasion through the commandment, produced in me all kinds of coveting. For apart from the law, sin is dead."
ROM	7	9	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6802	" {9} I was alive apart from the law once, but when the commandment came, sin revived, {10} and I died."
ROM	7	9	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6803	" The commandment, which was for life, this I found to be for death;"
ROM	7	11	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6804	" {11} For sin, finding occasion through the commandment, deceived me, and through it killed me."
ROM	7	12	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6805	" {12} Therefore the law indeed is holy, and the commandment holy, and righteous, and good."
ROM	7	13	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6806	 {13} Did then that which is good become death to me? May it never be!
ROM	7	13	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6807	" In order that sin might be recognized as sin, it produced death in me through what was good. That way, throught he commandment, sin might become utterly sinful."
ROM	7	14	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6808	" {14} For we know that the law is spiritual, but I am fleshly, sold under sin."
ROM	7	15	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6809	" {15} For I don't know what I am doing. For I don't practice what I desire to do; but what I hate, that I do."
ROM	7	16	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6810	" {16} But if what I don't desire, that I do, I consent to the law that it is good."
ROM	7	17	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6811	" {17} So now it is no more I that do it, but sin which dwells in me."
ROM	7	18	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6812	" {18} For I know that in me, that is, in my flesh, dwells no good thing. For desire is present with me, but I don't find it doing that which is good."
ROM	7	19	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6813	" {19} For the good which I desire, I don't do; but the evil which I don't desire, that I practice."
ROM	7	20	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6814	" {20} But if what I don't desire, that I do, it is no more I that do it, but sin which dwells in me."
ROM	7	21	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6815	" {21} I find then the law, that, to me, while I desire to do good, evil is present."
ROM	7	22	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6816	" {22} For in my inward man, I delight in God's law."
ROM	7	23	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6817	" {23} But I see a different law in my members, warring against the law of my mind, and bringing me into captivity under the law of sin which is in my members."
ROM	7	24	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6818	 {24} What a wretched man I am! Who will deliver me out of the body of this death?
ROM	7	25	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6819	" {25} I thank God through Jesus Christ, our Lord! So then with the mind, I myself serve God's law, but with the flesh, the sin's law. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
ROM	8	<<	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6820	ROMANS CHP 8
ROM	8	1	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6821	" {1} There is therefore now no condemnation to those who are in Christ Jesus, who don't walk according to the flesh, but according to the Spirit."
ROM	8	2	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6822	 {2} For the law of the Spirit of life in Christ Jesus made me free from the law of sin and of death.
ROM	8	3	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6823	" {3} For what the law couldn't do because it was weak through the flesh, God did."
ROM	8	3	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6824	" By sending his own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh and for sin, He condemned sin in the flesh."
ROM	8	4	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6825	" {4} In that way, the ordinance of the law might be fulfilled in us, who walk not after the flesh, but after the Spirit."
ROM	8	5	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6826	" {5} For those who live according to the flesh set their minds on the things of the flesh, but those who live according to the Spirit, the things of the Spirit."
ROM	8	6	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6827	" {6} For the mind of the flesh is death, but the mind of the Spirit is life and peace."
ROM	8	7	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6828	" {7} The mind of the flesh is hostile towards God; for it is not subject to God's law, neither indeed can it be."
ROM	8	8	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6829	 {8} Those who are in the flesh can't please God.
ROM	8	9	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6830	 {9} But you are not in the flesh but in the Spirit and so the Spirit of God Dwells in you.
ROM	8	9	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6831	" But if any man does not have the Spirit of Christ, he does not belong to God."
ROM	8	10	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6832	" {10} If Christ is in you, the body is dead because of sin, but the spirit is alive because of righteousness."
ROM	8	11	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6833	" {11} But if the Spirit of him who raised up Jesus from the dead dwells in you, he who raised up Christ Jesus from the dead will also give life to your mortal bodies through his Spirit who dwells in you."
ROM	8	12	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6834	" {12} So then, brothers, we are debtors, not to the flesh, to live after the flesh."
ROM	8	13	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6835	" {13} For if you live after the flesh, you must die; but if by the Spirit you put to death the deeds of the body, you will live."
ROM	8	14	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6836	" {14} For as many as are led by the Spirit of God, these are children of God."
ROM	8	15	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6837	 {15} For you didn't receive the spirit of slavery that leads you back into fear again.
ROM	8	15	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6838	" You received the Spirit of adoption, by whom we cry, “Abba! Father!”"
ROM	8	16	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6839	 {16} The Spirit himself testifies with our spirit that we are children of God.
ROM	8	17	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6840	" {17} And if we are children, then heirs; heirs of God, and joint heirs with Christ."
ROM	8	17	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6841	" Therefore, if we share in his suffering, we also share in his glory."
ROM	8	18	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6842	 {18} For I consider that the sufferings of this present time are not worthy to be compared with the glory which will be revealed toward us.
ROM	8	19	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6843	" ||| DO NOT COMBINE |||*~*{Music--Starts @ v19}*~**~* {19} For the creation waits with eager expectation for the children of God to be revealed."
ROM	8	20	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6844	" {20} For the creation was subjected to vanity, not of its own will, but because of him who subjected it, in hope"
ROM	8	21	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6845	 {21} that the creation itself also will be delivered from the bondage of decay into the liberty of the glory of the children of God.
ROM	8	22	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6846	 {22} For we know that the whole creation groans and travails in pain together until now.
ROM	8	23	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6847	" {23} Not only so, but ourselves also, who have the first fruits of the Spirit, even we ourselves groan within ourselves, waiting for adoption, the redemption of our body."
ROM	8	24	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6848	" {24} For we were saved in hope, but hope that is seen is not hope."
ROM	8	24	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6849	 For who hopes for that which he sees?
ROM	8	25	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6850	" {25} But if we hope for that which we don't see, we wait for it with patience."
ROM	8	26	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6851	" {26} In the same way, the Spirit also helps our weaknesses, for we don't know how to pray as we ought."
ROM	8	26	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6852	 But the Spirit himself makes intercession for us with groanings which can't be uttered.
ROM	8	27	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6853	" {27} He who searches the hearts knows what is on the Spirit's mind, because he makes intercession for the saints according to God."
ROM	8	28	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6854	" {28} We know that all things work together for good for those who love God, to those who are called according to his purpose."
ROM	8	29	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6855	" {29} For whom he foreknew, he also predestined to be conformed to the image of his Son, that he might be the firstborn among many brothers."
ROM	8	30	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6856	" {30} Whom he predestined, those he also called."
ROM	8	30	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6857	" Whom he called, those he also justified. Whom he justified, those he also glorified."
ROM	8	31	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6858	" {31} What then shall we say about these things? If God is for us, who can be against us?"
ROM	8	32	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6859	" {32} He who didn't spare his own Son, but delivered him up for us all, how would he not also with him freely give us all things?"
ROM	8	33	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6860	 {33} Who could bring a charge against God's chosen ones? It is God who justifies.
ROM	8	34	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6861	" {34} Who is he who condemns? It is Christ who died, yes rather, who was raised from the dead, who is at the right hand of God, who also makes intercession for us."
ROM	8	35	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6862	 {35} Who shall separate us from the love of Christ?
ROM	8	35	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6863	" Could oppression, or anguish, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or peril, or sword?"
ROM	8	36	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6864	" {36} Even as it is written,"
ROM	8	36	Scripture Quote-FX1	#13		6865	 “For your sake we are killed all day long. We were accounted as sheep for the slaughter.”
ROM	8	37	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6866	" {37} No, in all these things, we are more than conquerors through him who loved us."
ROM	8	38	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6867	" {38} For I am persuaded, that neither death, nor life, nor angels, nor principalities, nor things present, nor things to come, nor powers,"
ROM	8	39	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6868	" {39} nor height, nor depth, nor any other created thing, will be able to separate us from the love of God, which is in Christ Jesus our Lord. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
ROM	9	<<	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6869	ROMANS CHP 9
ROM	9	1	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6870	" {1} I tell the truth in Christ. I am not lying, my conscience confirms it in the Holy Spirit."
ROM	9	2	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6871	 {2} I have great sorrow and unceasing pain in my heart.
ROM	9	3	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6872	" {3} For I could wish that I myself were accursed from Christ for my brothers' sake, my relatives according to the flesh."
ROM	9	4	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6873	 {4} They are Israelites and are the people God chose for himself;
ROM	9	4	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6874	" the glory, the covenants, the giving of the law, the service, and the promises;"
ROM	9	5	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6875	" {5} Theirs are the patriarchs, and from them is traced the human ancestry of Christ, who is God over all, forever praised! Amen."
ROM	9	6	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6876	" {6} But it is not as though the word of God has come to nothing. For they are not all Israel, that are of Israel."
ROM	9	7	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6877	" {7} Neither, because they are Abraham's seed, are they all children. But,"
ROM	9	7	God-FX1	#20		6878	 “In Isaac will your seed be called.”
ROM	9	8	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6879	" {8} That is, it is not the children of the flesh who are children of God, but the children of the promise are counted as a seed. {9} For this is a word of promise,"
ROM	9	9	God-FX1	#20		6880	" “At the appointed time I will come, and Sarah will have a son.”"
ROM	9	10	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6881	" {10} Not only so, but Rebecca also conceived by one, by our father Isaac."
ROM	9	11	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6882	" {11} For being not yet born, neither having done anything good or bad, that the purpose of God according to election might stand, not of works, but of him who calls, {12} it was said to her,"
ROM	9	12	God-FX1	#20		6883	 “The elder will serve the younger.”
ROM	9	13	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6884	" {13} Even as it is written,"
ROM	9	13	God-FX1	#20		6885	" “Jacob I loved, but Esau I hated.”"
ROM	9	14	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6886	" {14} What shall we say then? Is there unrighteousness with God? May it never be! {15} For he said to Moses,"
ROM	9	15	God-FX1	#20		6887	" “I will have mercy on whom I have mercy, and I will have compassion on whom I have compassion.”"
ROM	9	16	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6888	" {16} So then it is not of him who wills, nor of him who runs, but of God who has mercy. {17} For the Scripture says to Pharaoh,"
ROM	9	17	God-FX1	#20		6889	" “For this very purpose I caused you to be raised up, that I might show in you my power, and that my name might be proclaimed in all the earth.”"
ROM	9	18	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6890	" {18} So then, he has mercy on whom he desires, and he hardens whom he desires."
ROM	9	19	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6891	" {19} You will say then to me, “Why does he still find fault? For who withstands his will?”"
ROM	9	20	God-FX1	#20		6892	" {20} But indeed, O man, who are you to reply against God? Will the thing formed ask him who formed it, “Why did you make me like this?”"
ROM	9	21	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6893	" {21} Or hasn't the potter a right over the clay, from the same lump to make one part a vessel for honor, and another for dishonor?"
ROM	9	22	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6894	" {22} What if God, willing to show his wrath, and to make his power known, endured with much patience vessels of wrath made for destruction."
ROM	9	23	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6895	" {23} What if he did this to make known the riches of his glory on vessels of mercy, which he prepared beforehand for glory."
ROM	9	24	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6896	" {24} We are the ones he chose, not only from the Jews, but also from the Gentiles."
ROM	9	25	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6897	" {25} As he says also in Hosea,"
ROM	9	25	God-FX1	#20		6898	" “I will call them 'my people,' which were not my people; and her 'beloved,' who was not beloved.”"
ROM	9	26	God-FX1	#20		6899	" {26} “It will be that in the place where it was said to them, 'You are not my people,' There they will be called 'children of the living God.”"
ROM	9	27	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6900	" {27} Isaiah cries concerning Israel,"
ROM	9	27	Isaiah-FX1	#04		6901	" “If the number of the children of Israel are as the sand of the sea, it is the remnant who will be saved;"
ROM	9	28	Isaiah-FX1	#04		6902	" {28} for He will finish the work and cut it short in righteousness, because the LORD will make a short work upon the earth.”"
ROM	9	29	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6903	" {29} As Isaiah has said before,"
ROM	9	29	Isaiah-FX1	#04		6904	" “Unless the Lord of Armies had left us a seed, we would have become like Sodom, and would have been made like Gomorrah.”"
ROM	9	30	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6905	" {30} What shall we say then? That the Gentiles, who didn't follow after righteousness, attained to righteousness, even the righteousness which is of faith."
ROM	9	31	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6906	" {31} But Israel, following after a law of righteousness, didn't arrive at the law of righteousness."
ROM	9	32	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6907	" {32} Why? Because they didn't seek it by faith, but as it were by works of the law. They stumbled over the stumbling stone; {33} even as it is written,"
ROM	9	33	God-FX1	#20		6908	" “Behold, I lay in Zion a stumbling stone and a rock of offense; and no one who believes in him will be disappointed.”*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"

ROM	11	12	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6958	" {12} Their disobedience has brought great benefits to the world, and their failure as a people has brought great benefits to those who are not Jewish."
ROM	11	12	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6959	" So when the Jews participate fully in salvation, the benefits are even greater."
ROM	11	13	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6960	" {13} For I speak to you who are Gentiles. Since then as I am an apostle to Gentiles, I glorify my ministry."
ROM	11	14	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6961	" {14} I do this so that by any means I may provoke to jealousy those who are my flesh, and may save some of them."
ROM	11	15	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6962	" {15} For if the rejection of them is the reconciling of the world, what would their acceptance be, but life from the dead?"
ROM	11	16	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6963	" {16} If the first fruit is holy, so is the lump. If the root is holy, so are the branches."
ROM	11	17	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6964	" {17} But some of the branches were broken off, and you, being a wild olive, were grafted in among them."
ROM	11	17	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6965	 You became partakers with them of the root and of the richness of the olive tree.
ROM	11	18	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6966	" {18} Don't boast over the branches. If you boast, it is not you who support the root, but the root supports you."
ROM	11	19	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6967	" {19} You will say then, “Branches were broken off, that I might be grafted in.”"
ROM	11	20	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6968	" {20} True; by their unbelief they were broken off, and you stand by your faith. Don't be conceited, but fear;"
ROM	11	21	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6969	" {21} for if God didn't spare the natural branches, neither will he spare you."
ROM	11	22	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6970	" {22} See then the goodness and severity of God. Toward those who fell, severity; but toward you, goodness, if you continue in his goodness; otherwise you also will be cut off."
ROM	11	23	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6971	" {23} They also, if they don't continue in their unbelief, will be grafted in, for God is able to graft them in again."
ROM	11	24	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6972	" {24} For if you were cut out of that which is by nature a wild olive tree, and were grafted contrary to nature into a good olive tree, how much more will these, which are the natural branches, be grafted into their own olive tree?"
ROM	11	25	Narr_006: Romans	#19		6973	" {25} For I don't desire you to be ignorant, brothers, of this mystery, so that you won't be wise in your own conceits:"

ROM	12	8	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7001	" he who rules, with diligence; he who shows mercy, with cheerfulness."

ROM	12	11	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7004	 {11} Do not lag in diligence. Be fervent in spirit; serving the Lord.
ROM	12	12	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7005	 {12} Rejoice in hope; endure in troubles; continue steadfastly in prayer.

ROM	12	16	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7010	" Don't set your mind on high things, but associate with the humble. Don't be wise in your own conceits."
ROM	12	17	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7011	 {17} Repay no one evil for evil. Respect what is honorable in the sight of all men.
ROM	12	18	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7012	" {18} If it is possible, as much as it is up to you, be at peace with all men."

ROM	13	<<	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7018	ROMANS CHP 13
ROM	13	1	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7019	" {1} Let every soul be in subjection to the higher authorities, for there is no authority except from God, and those who exist are ordained by God."
ROM	13	2	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7020	" {2} Therefore he who resists the authority, withstands the ordinance of God; and those who withstand will receive to themselves damnation."
ROM	13	3	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7021	" {3} For rulers are not a terror for those who do right, but for those who do wrong."
ROM	13	3	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7022	 Do you desire to have no fear of those in authority? Do that which is right and they will commend you.
ROM	13	4	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7023	" {4} A leader is a servant of God to you for good. But if you do that which is evil, be afraid, for he doesn't bear the sword in vain;"
ROM	13	4	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7024	" for he is a servant of God, an avenger for wrath to him who does evil."
ROM	13	5	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7025	" {5} Therefore you need to be in subjection, not only because of the wrath, but also for conscience' sake."
ROM	13	6	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7026	" {6} For this reason you also pay taxes, for they are servants of God's service, attending continually on this very thing."
ROM	13	7	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7027	 {7} Give therefore to everyone what you owe:
ROM	13	7	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7028	 taxes to whom taxes are due; customs to whom customs; respect to whom respect; honor to whom honor.
ROM	13	8	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7029	" {8} Owe no one anything, except to love one another;"
ROM	13	8	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7030	" for he who loves his neighbor has fulfilled the law. {9} For the commandments,"
ROM	13	9	God-FX1	#20		7031	" “You shall not commit adultery,“ “You shall not murder,“ “You shall not steal,“ “You shall not give false testimony,“ “You shall not covet,”"

ROM	13	9	God-FX1	#20		7033	 “You shall love your neighbor as yourself.”
ROM	13	10	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7034	 {10} Love doesn't harm a neighbor. Love therefore is the fulfillment of the law.
ROM	13	11	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7035	" {11} Do this, knowing the time, that it is already time for you to awaken out of sleep,"
ROM	13	11	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7036	 for salvation is now nearer to us than when we first believed.
ROM	13	12	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7037	" {12} The night is far gone, and the day is near. Let's therefore throw off the works of darkness, and let's put on the armor of light."

ROM	13	13	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7039	" not in reveling and drunkenness, not in sexual promiscuity and lustful acts, and not in strife and jealousy."
ROM	13	14	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7040	" {14} But put on the Lord Jesus Christ, and make no provision for the flesh, for its lusts. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
ROM	14	<<	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7041	ROMANS CHP 14
ROM	14	1	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7042	" {1} Now accept one who is weak in faith, but not for disputes over opinions."
ROM	14	2	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7043	" {2} One man has faith to eat all things, but he who is weak eats only vegetables."
ROM	14	3	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7044	" {3} Don't let him who eats despise him who doesn't eat. Don't let him who doesn't eat judge him who eats, for God has accepted him."
ROM	14	4	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7045	" {4} Who are you who judge another's servant? To his own lord he stands or falls. Yes, he will be made to stand, for God has power to make him stand."
ROM	14	5	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7046	 {5} One man esteems one day as more important. Another esteems every day alike. Let each man be fully assured in his own mind.
ROM	14	6	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7047	" {6} He who observes the day, observes it to the Lord; and he who does not observe the day, to the Lord he does not observe it."
ROM	14	6	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7048	" He who eats, eats to the Lord, for he gives God thanks. He who doesn't eat, to the Lord he doesn't eat, and gives God thanks."
ROM	14	7	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7049	" {7} For none of us lives to himself, and none dies to himself."
ROM	14	8	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7050	" {8} For if we live, we live to the Lord. Or if we die, we die to the Lord. If therefore we live or die, we are the Lord's."
ROM	14	9	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7051	" {9} For to this end Christ died, rose, and lived again, that he might be Lord of both the dead and the living."
ROM	14	10	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7052	" {10} But you, why do you judge your brother? Or you again, why do you despise your brother? For we will all stand before the judgment seat of Christ. {11} For it is written,"
ROM	14	11	God-FX1	#20		7053	" “'As I live,' says the Lord, 'to me every knee will bow. Every tongue will confess to God.”"
ROM	14	12	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7054	 {12} So then each one of us will give account of himself to God.
ROM	14	13	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7055	 {13} Therefore let's not judge one another any more.
ROM	14	13	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7056	" But judge this rather, that no man put a stumbling block in his brother's way, or an occasion for falling."
ROM	14	14	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7057	" {14} I know, and am persuaded in the Lord Jesus, that nothing is unclean of itself;"
ROM	14	14	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7058	" Except that to him who considers anything to be unclean, to him it is unclean."
ROM	14	15	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7059	" {15} Yet if because of food your brother is grieved, you walk no longer in love. Don't destroy with your food him for whom Christ died."
ROM	14	16	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7060	" {16} Then don't let your good be slandered,"
ROM	14	17	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7061	" {17} for the Kingdom of God is not eating and drinking, but righteousness, peace, and joy in the Holy Spirit."
ROM	14	18	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7062	 {18} For he who serves Christ in these things is acceptable to God and approved by men.
ROM	14	19	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7063	" {19} So then, let us follow after things which make for peace, and things by which we may build one another up."
ROM	14	20	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7064	" {20} Don't overthrow God's work for food's sake. All things indeed are clean, however it is evil for that man who creates a stumbling block by eating."
ROM	14	21	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7065	" {21} It is good to not eat meat, drink wine, nor do anything by which your brother stumbles, is offended, or is made weak."
ROM	14	22	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7066	 {22} Do you have faith? Have it to yourself before God. Happy is he who doesn't judge himself in that which he approves.
ROM	14	23	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7067	" {23} But he who doubts is damned if he eats, because it isn't of faith; and whatever is not of faith is sin.*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
ROM	14	24	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7068	" Some ancient manuscripts move Rom 16:25-27 to here. Those verses become 14:24-26 *~**~* {24} Now to him who is able to establish you according to my Good News and the preaching of Jesus Christ."
ROM	14	24	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7069	" And this according to the revelation of the mystery which has been kept secret through long ages,"
ROM	14	25	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7070	" {25} but now is revealed, and by the Scriptures of the prophets."
ROM	14	25	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7071	" According to the commandment of the eternal God, it is made known for obedience of faith to all the nations;"
ROM	14	26	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7072	" {26} to the only wise God, through Jesus Christ, to whom be the glory forever! Amen. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"

ROM	15	3	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7076	" {3} For even Christ didn't please himself. But, as it is written,"
ROM	15	3	Scripture Quote-FX1	#13		7077	 “The reproaches of those who reproached you fell on me.”
ROM	15	4	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7078	 {4} For whatever things were written before were written for our learning.
ROM	15	4	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7079	 That through patience and through encouragement of the Scriptures we might have hope.

ROM	15	14	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7093	" ||| DO NOT COMBINE |||*~*{Music--Ends before v14}*~**~* {14} I myself am also persuaded about you, my brothers, that you yourselves are full of goodness."

ROM	15	16	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7096	" {16} That I should be a servant of Christ Jesus to the Gentiles, serving as a priest the Good News of God, that the offering up of the Gentiles might be made acceptable, sanctified by the Holy Spirit."
ROM	15	17	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7097	 {17} I have therefore my boasting in Christ Jesus in things pertaining to God.
ROM	15	18	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7098	" {18} For I will not dare to speak of any things except those which Christ worked through me, for the obedience of the Gentiles, by word and deed,"
ROM	15	19	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7099	" {19} in the power of signs and wonders, in the power of God's Spirit;"
ROM	15	19	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7100	" so that from Jerusalem, and around as far as to Illyricum, I have fully preached the Good News of Christ;"
ROM	15	20	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7101	" {20} yes, making it my aim to preach the Good News, not where Christ was already named, that I might not build on another's foundation. {21} But, as it is written,"
ROM	15	21	God-FX1	#20		7102	" “They will see, to whom no news of him came. They who haven't heard will understand.”"
ROM	15	22	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7103	 {22} Therefore also I was hindered these many times from coming to you.
ROM	15	23	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7104	" {23} But now, no longer having any place in these regions, and having these many years a longing to come to you,"
ROM	15	24	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7105	" {24} when I journey to Spain, I will come to you."
ROM	15	24	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7106	" For I hope to see you on my journey, and to be helped on my way there by you, if first I may enjoy your company for a while."
ROM	15	25	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7107	" {25} But now, I say, I am going to Jerusalem, serving the saints."
ROM	15	26	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7108	 {26} For it has been the good pleasure of Macedonia and Achaia to make a certain contribution for the poor among the saints who are at Jerusalem.
ROM	15	27	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7109	" {27} Yes, it has been their good pleasure, and they are their debtors."
ROM	15	27	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7110	" For if the Gentiles have been made partakers of their spiritual things, they owe it to them also to serve them in fleshly things."
ROM	15	28	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7111	" {28} When therefore I have accomplished this, and have sealed to them this fruit, I will go on by way of you to Spain."
ROM	15	29	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7112	" {29} I know that, when I come to you, I will come in the fullness of the blessing of the Good News of Christ."
ROM	15	30	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7113	" {30} Now I beg you, brothers, by our Lord Jesus Christ, and by the love of the Spirit, that you strive together with me in your prayers to God for me,"
ROM	15	31	Narr_006: Romans	#19		7114	" {31} that I may be delivered from those who are disobedient in Judea, and that my service which I have for Jerusalem may be acceptable to the saints;"

1CO	1	2	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7153	" To those who are called to be saints, with all who call on the name of our Lord Jesus Christ in every place, both theirs and ours:"

1CO	1	4	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7155	" { 4} I always thank my God concerning you, for the grace of God which was given you in Christ Jesus."

1CO	1	7	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7158	 {7} You have the gifts of the Holy Spirit that you need as you wait for the revelation of our Lord Jesus Christ.
