1CO	1	10	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7161	" {10} Now I beg you, brothers, through the name of our Lord, Jesus Christ, that you all speak the same thing and that there be no divisions among you."
1CO	1	10	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7162	 Be perfected together in the same mind and in the same judgment.
1CO	1	11	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7163	" {11} For it has been reported to me concerning you, my brothers, by those who are from Chloe's household, that there are contentions among you."
1CO	1	12	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7164	" {12} Now I mean this, that each one of you says, “I follow Paul,“ “I follow Apollos,“ “I follow Cephas,“ and, “I follow Christ.”"
1CO	1	13	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7165	 {13} Is Christ divided? Was Paul crucified for you? Or were you baptized into the name of Paul?
1CO	1	14	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7166	" {14} I thank God that I baptized none of you, except Crispus and Gaius,"
1CO	1	15	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7167	 {15} so that no one should say that I had baptized you into my own name.
1CO	1	16	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7168	" {16} (I also baptized the household of Stephanas; besides them, I don't know whether I baptized any other.)"
1CO	1	17	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7169	" {17} For Christ sent me not to baptize, but to preach the Good News--not in wisdom of words, so that the cross of Christ wouldn't be made void."
1CO	1	18	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7170	" {18} For the word of the cross is foolishness to those who are dying, but to us who are saved it is the power of God. {19} For it is written,"
1CO	1	19	God-FX1	#20		7171	" “I will destroy the wisdom of the wise, I will bring the discernment of the discerning to nothing.”"
1CO	1	20	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7172	 {20} Where is the wise? Where is the scribe? Where is the lawyer of this world? Hasn't God made foolish the wisdom of this world?
1CO	1	21	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7173	" {21} For seeing that in the wisdom of God, the world through its wisdom didn't know God."
1CO	1	21	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7174	 It was God's good pleasure through the foolishness of the preaching to save those who believe.
1CO	1	22	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7175	" {22} For Jews require a sign, Greeks seek after wisdom."
1CO	1	23	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7176	" {23} But we preach Christ crucified; a stumbling block to Jews, and foolishness to Greeks, {F8 Music--Starts}"
1CO	1	24	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7177	" {24} However, to those who are called, both Jews and Greeks, Christ is the power of God and the wisdom of God."
1CO	1	25	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7178	" {25} Because the foolishness of God is wiser than men, and the weakness of God is stronger than men."
1CO	1	26	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7179	" {26} For you see your calling, brothers, that not many are wise according to the flesh, not many mighty, and not many noble;"
1CO	1	27	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7180	 {27} but God chose the foolish things of the world that he might put to shame those who are wise.
1CO	1	27	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7181	" God chose the weak things of the world, that he might put to shame the things that are strong;"
1CO	1	28	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7182	" {28} and God chose the lowly things of the world, and the things that are despised, and the things that are not, that he might bring to nothing the things that are:"
1CO	1	29	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7183	" {29} In that way, no flesh should boast before God."
1CO	1	30	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7184	" {30} But of him, you are in Christ Jesus, who was made to us wisdom from God, and righteousness and sanctification, and redemption:"
1CO	1	31	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7185	" {31} that, according as it is written,"
1CO	1	31	God-FX1	#20		7186	" “He who boasts, let him boast in the Lord.”*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
1CO	2	<<	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7187	1 CORINTHIANS CHP 2
1CO	2	1	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7188	" {1} When I came to you, brothers, I didn't come with excellence of speech or of wisdom, proclaiming to you the testimony of God."
1CO	2	2	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7189	" {2} For I determined not to know anything among you, except Jesus Christ, and him crucified."
1CO	2	3	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7190	" {3} I was with you in weakness, in fear, and in much trembling."
1CO	2	4	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7191	" {4} My speech and my preaching were not in persuasive words of human wisdom, but in demonstration of the Spirit and of power."
1CO	2	5	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7192	" {5} That way, your faith wouldn't stand in the wisdom of men, but in the power of God."
1CO	2	6	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7193	" {6} We speak wisdom, however, among those who are full grown; yet a wisdom not of this world, nor of the rulers of this world, who are coming to nothing."
1CO	2	7	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7194	" {7} But we speak God's wisdom in a mystery, the wisdom that has been hidden, which God foreordained before the worlds for our glory."
1CO	2	8	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7195	" {8} None of the rulers of this world has understood. For had they known it, they wouldn't have crucified the Lord of glory. {9} But as it is written,"
1CO	2	9	Isaiah-FX1	#04		7196	" “Things which an eye didn't see, and an ear didn't hear, which didn't enter into the heart of man, these God has prepared for those who love him.”"
1CO	2	10	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7197	" {10} But to us, God revealed them through the Spirit. For the Spirit searches all things, yes, the deep things of God."
1CO	2	11	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7198	" {11} For who among men knows the things of a man, except the spirit of the man, which is in him?"
1CO	2	11	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7199	" Even so, no one knows the things of God, except God's Spirit."
1CO	2	12	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7200	" {12} But we received, not the spirit of the world, but the Spirit which is from God, that we might know the things that were freely given to us by God."
1CO	2	13	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7201	" {13} Which things also we speak, not in words which man's wisdom teaches, but which the Holy Spirit teaches, comparing spiritual things with spiritual things."
1CO	2	14	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7202	" {14} Now the natural man doesn't receive the things of God's Spirit, for they are foolishness to him."
1CO	2	14	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7203	" He can't know them, because they are spiritually discerned."
1CO	2	15	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7204	" {15} But he who is spiritual discerns all things, and he himself is judged by no one."
1CO	2	16	Isaiah-FX1	#04		7205	" {16} “For who has known the mind of the Lord, that he should instruct him?”"
1CO	2	16	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7206	" But we have Christ's mind. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
1CO	3	<<	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7207	1 CORINTHIANS CHP 3
1CO	3	1	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7208	" {1} Brothers, I couldn't speak to you as to spiritual, but as to fleshly, as to babies in Christ."
1CO	3	2	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7209	" {2} I fed you with milk, not with meat; for you weren't yet ready. Indeed, not even now are you ready."
1CO	3	3	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7210	" {3} You are still fleshly. For insofar as there is jealousy, strife, and factions among you, aren't you fleshly, and don't you walk in the ways of men?"
1CO	3	4	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7211	" {4} For when one says, “I follow Paul,“ and another, “I follow Apollos,“ aren't you fleshly?"
1CO	3	5	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7212	" {5} Who then is Apollos, and who is Paul, but servants through whom you believed; and each as the Lord gave to him?"
1CO	3	6	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7213	 {6} I planted. Apollos watered. But God gave the increase.
1CO	3	7	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7214	" {7} So then neither he who plants is anything, nor he who waters, but God who gives the increase."
1CO	3	8	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7215	" {8} Now he who plants and he who waters are the same, but each will receive his own reward according to his own labor."
1CO	3	9	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7216	" {9} For we are God's fellow workers. You are God's farming, God's building."
1CO	3	10	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7217	" {10} According to the grace of God which was given to me, as a wise master builder I laid a foundation, and another builds on it."
1CO	3	10	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7218	 But let each man be careful how he builds on it.
1CO	3	11	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7219	" {11} For no one can lay any other foundation than that which has been laid, which is Jesus Christ."
1CO	3	12	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7220	" {12} If any man builds on this foundation using gold, silver, costly stones, wood, hay or straw,"
1CO	3	13	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7221	" {13} his work will be shown for what it is, because the Day will bring it to light. It will be revealed with fire; and the fire itself will test what sort of work each man's work is."
1CO	3	14	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7222	" {14} If any man's work remains which he built on it, he will receive a reward."
1CO	3	15	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7223	" {15} If any man's work is burned, he will suffer loss, but he himself will be saved, but as through fire."
1CO	3	16	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7224	" {16} Don't you know that you are a temple of God, and that God's Spirit lives in you?"
1CO	3	17	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7225	" ||| DO NOT COMBINE |||*~*{Music--Ends before v17}*~**~* {17} If anyone destroys the temple of God, God will destroy him; for God's temple is holy, which you are."
1CO	3	18	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7226	" {18} Let no one deceive himself. If anyone thinks that he is wise among you in this world, let him become a fool, that he may become wise."

1CO	3	19	Scripture Quote-FX1	#13		7228	 “He has taken the wise in their craftiness.”
1CO	3	20	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7229	" {20} And again,"

1CO	6	1	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7278	" {1} Dare any of you, having a matter against his neighbor, go to law before the unrighteous, and not before the saints?"

1CO	6	3	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7280	" {3} Don't you know that we will judge angels? How much more, things that pertain to this life?"
1CO	6	4	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7281	" {4} If then, you have to judge things pertaining to this life, do you set them to judge who are of no account in the assembly?"

1CO	7	24	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7329	" {24} Brothers, let each man, in whatever condition he was called, stay in that condition with God."
1CO	7	25	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7330	" {25} Now concerning virgins, I have no commandment from the Lord, but I give my judgment as one who has obtained mercy from the Lord to be trustworthy."
1CO	7	26	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7331	" {26} I think that it is good therefore, because of the distress that is on us, that it is good for a man to be as he is."
1CO	7	27	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7332	 {27} Are you bound to a wife? Don't seek to be freed. Are you free from a wife? Don't seek a wife.
1CO	7	28	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7333	" {28} But if you marry, you have not sinned. If a virgin marries, she has not sinned."
1CO	7	28	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7334	" Yet such will have oppression in the flesh, and I want to spare you."
1CO	7	29	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7335	" {29} But I say this, brothers: the time is short, that from now on, both those who have wives may be as though they had none;"
1CO	7	30	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7336	" {30} and those who weep, as though they didn't weep; and those who rejoice, as though they didn't rejoice; and those who buy, as though they didn't possess;"
1CO	7	31	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7337	" {31} and those who use the world, as not using it to the fullest. For the mode of this world passes away."
1CO	7	32	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7338	" {32} But I desire to have you to be free from cares. He who is unmarried is concerned for the things of the Lord, how he may please the Lord;"
1CO	7	33	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7339	" {33} but he who is married is concerned about the things of the world, how he may please his wife."
1CO	7	34	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7340	" {34} There is also a difference between a wife and a virgin. The unmarried woman cares about the things of the Lord, that she may be holy both in body and in spirit."
1CO	7	34	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7341	 But she who is married cares about the things of the world--how she may please her husband.
1CO	7	35	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7342	 {35} This I say for your own profit; not that I may ensnare you.
1CO	7	35	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7343	" I hope that you choose what is best, and that you may attend to the Lord without distraction."
1CO	7	36	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7344	" {36} But if any man thinks that he is behaving inappropriately toward his virgin, if she is past the flower of her age, let them marry."
1CO	7	36	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7345	 Let him do what he desires. He doesn't sin. Let them marry.
1CO	7	37	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7346	" {37} But he who stands steadfast in his heart, having no necessity, but has power over his own heart, to keep his own virgin, does well."
1CO	7	38	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7347	" {38} So then both he who gives his own virgin in marriage does well, and he who doesn't give her in marriage does better."
1CO	7	39	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7348	 {39} A wife is bound by law for as long as her husband lives.
1CO	7	39	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7349	" If the husband is dies, she is free to be married to whomever she desires, only in the Lord."
1CO	7	40	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7350	" {40} But she is happier if she stays as she is, in my judgment, and I think that I also have God's Spirit. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
1CO	8	<<	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7351	1 CORINTHIANS CHP 8
1CO	8	1	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7352	" {1} Now concerning things sacrificed to idols: We know that we all have knowledge. Knowledge puffs up, but love builds up."
1CO	8	2	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7353	" {2} But if anyone thinks that he knows anything, he doesn't yet know as he ought to know."
1CO	8	3	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7354	" {3} But if anyone loves God, the same is known by him."
1CO	8	4	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7355	" {4} Therefore concerning the eating of things sacrificed to idols, we know that no idol is anything in the world, and that there is no other God but one."
1CO	8	5	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7356	" {5} For though there are things that are called “gods,“ whether in the heavens or on earth; as there are many “gods “ and many “lords“;"
1CO	8	6	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7357	" {6} yet to us there is one God, the Father, of whom are all things, and we for him."
1CO	8	6	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7358	" And there is one Lord, Jesus Christ, through whom are all things, and we live through him."
1CO	8	7	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7359	" {7} However, that knowledge isn't in all men."
1CO	8	7	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7360	" But some, with consciousness of the idol until now, eat as of a thing sacrificed to an idol, and their conscience, being weak, is defiled."
1CO	8	8	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7361	" {8} But food will not commend us to God. For neither, if we don't eat, are we the worse; nor, if we eat, are we the better."
1CO	8	9	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7362	 {9} But be careful that by no means does this liberty of yours become a stumbling block to the weak.
1CO	8	10	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7363	 {10} For what if a man sees you who have knowledge sitting in an idol's temple?
1CO	8	10	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7364	" Won't his conscience, if he is weak, be emboldened to eat things sacrificed to idols?"
1CO	8	11	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7365	" {11} And through your knowledge, he who is weak perishes, the brother for whose sake Christ died."
1CO	8	12	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7366	" {12} Thus, sinning against the brothers, and wounding their conscience when it is weak, you sin against Christ."
1CO	8	13	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7367	" {13} Therefore if food causes my brother to stumble, I will eat no meat forevermore, that I don't cause my brother to stumble. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"

1CO	12	12	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7494	" {12} For as the body is one, and has many members, and all the members of the body, being many, are one body; so also is Christ."
1CO	12	13	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7495	" {13} For in one Spirit we were all baptized into one body, whether Jews or Greeks, whether bond or free; and were all given to drink into one Spirit."
1CO	12	14	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7496	" {14} For the body is not one member, but many."
1CO	12	15	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7497	" {15} If the foot would say, “Because I'm not the hand, I'm not part of the body,“ it is not therefore not part of the body."
1CO	12	16	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7498	" {16} If the ear would say, “Because I'm not the eye, I'm not part of the body,“ it's not therefore not part of the body."
1CO	12	17	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7499	" {17} If the whole body were an eye, where would the hearing be? If the whole were hearing, where would the smelling be?"
1CO	12	18	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7500	" {18} But now God has set the members, each one of them, in the body, just as he desired."
1CO	12	19	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7501	" {19} If they were all one member, where would the body be? {20} But now they are many members, but one body."
1CO	12	21	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7502	" {21} The eye can't tell the hand, “I have no need for you,“ or again the head to the feet, “I have no need for you.”"
1CO	12	22	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7503	" {22} No, much rather, those members of the body which seem to be weaker are necessary."
1CO	12	23	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7504	" {23} Those parts of the body which we think to be less honorable, on those we bestow more abundant honor;"
1CO	12	23	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7505	 and our unpresentable parts have more abundant propriety.
1CO	12	24	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7506	" {24} Our presentable parts have no such need. But God composed the body together, giving more abundant honor to the inferior part."
1CO	12	25	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7507	" {25} That way there is no division in the body, All the members take care of one another."
1CO	12	26	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7508	" {26} When one member suffers, all the members suffer with it. Or when one member is honored, all the members rejoice with it."
1CO	12	27	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7509	" {27} Now you are the body of Christ, and members individually."
1CO	12	28	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7510	" {28} God has set some in the assembly: first apostles, second prophets, and third teachers."
1CO	12	28	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7511	" Then miracle workers, then gifts of healings, helps, governments, and various kinds of languages."

1CO	12	31	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7514	" {31} But earnestly desire the best gifts. Moreover, I show a most excellent way to you. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
1CO	13	<<	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7515	1 CORINTHIANS CHP 13
1CO	13	1	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7516	" {1} If I speak with the languages of men and of angels, but don't have love, I have become sounding brass, or a clanging cymbal."
1CO	13	2	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7517	" {2} If I have the gift of prophecy, and know all mysteries and all knowledge;"
1CO	13	2	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7518	" and if I have all faith, so as to remove mountains, but don't have love, I am nothing."
1CO	13	3	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7519	" {3} If I dole out all my goods to feed the poor, and if I give my body to be burned, but don't have love, it profits me nothing."
1CO	13	4	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7520	" {4} Love is patient and is kind; love doesn't envy. Love doesn't brag, is not proud."
1CO	13	5	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7521	" {5} Love doesn't behave itself inappropriately, doesn't seek its own way, is not provoked, takes no account of evil."
1CO	13	6	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7522	" {6} It doesn't rejoice in unrighteousness, but rejoices with the truth."
1CO	13	7	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7523	" {7} Love bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things, endures all things."
1CO	13	8	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7524	" {8} Love never fails. But where there are prophecies, they will be done away with."
1CO	13	8	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7525	" Where there are various languages, they will cease. Where there is knowledge, it will be done away with."
1CO	13	9	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7526	" {9} For we know in part, and we prophesy in part;"
1CO	13	10	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7527	" {10} but when that which is complete has come, then that which is partial will be done away with."
1CO	13	11	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7528	" {11} When I was a child, I spoke as a child, I felt as a child, I thought as a child. Now that I have become a man, I have put away childish things."
1CO	13	12	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7529	" {12} For now we see in a mirror, dimly, but then face to face. Now I know in part, but then I will know fully, even as I was also fully known."
1CO	13	13	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7530	" {13} But now faith, hope, and love remain--these three. The greatest of these is love. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
1CO	14	<<	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7531	1 CORINTHIANS CHP 14
1CO	14	1	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7532	" {1} Follow after love, and earnestly desire spiritual gifts, but especially that you may prophesy."
1CO	14	2	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7533	" {2} For he who speaks in another language speaks not to men, but to God; for no one understands; but in the Spirit he speaks mysteries."
1CO	14	3	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7534	" ||| DO NOT COMBINE |||*~*{Music--Starts @ v3}*~**~* {3} But he who prophesies speaks to men for their edification, exhortation, and consolation."
1CO	14	4	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7535	" {4} He who speaks in another language edifies himself, but he who prophesies edifies the assembly."
1CO	14	5	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7536	" {5} Now I desire to have you all speak with other languages, but rather that you would prophesy."
1CO	14	5	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7537	" For he is greater who prophesies than he who speaks with other languages, unless he interprets, that the assembly may be built up."
1CO	14	6	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7538	" {6} But now, brothers, if I come to you speaking with other languages, what would I profit you? Unless I speak to you either by way of revelation, or of knowledge, or of prophesying, or of teaching?"
1CO	14	7	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7539	" {7} Even things without life, giving a voice, whether pipe or harp."
1CO	14	7	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7540	" If they didn't give a distinction in the sounds, how would it be known what is piped or harped?"
1CO	14	8	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7541	" {8} For if the trumpet gave an uncertain sound, who would prepare himself for war?"
1CO	14	9	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7542	" {9} So also you, unless you uttered by the tongue words easy to understand, how would it be known what is spoken? For you would be speaking into the air."
1CO	14	10	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7543	" {10} There are, it may be, so many kinds of sounds in the world, and none of them is without meaning."
1CO	14	11	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7544	" {11} If then I don't know the meaning of the sound, I would be to him who speaks a foreigner, and he who speaks would be a foreigner to me."
1CO	14	12	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7545	" {12} So also you, since you are zealous for spiritual gifts, seek that you may abound to the building up of the assembly."
1CO	14	13	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7546	 {13} Therefore let him who speaks in another language pray that he may interpret.
1CO	14	14	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7547	" {14} For if I pray in another language, my spirit prays, but my understanding is unfruitful."
1CO	14	15	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7548	" {15} What is it then? I will pray with the spirit, and I will pray with the understanding also. I will sing with the spirit, and I will sing with the understanding also."
1CO	14	16	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7549	" {16} Otherwise if you bless with the spirit, how will he who fills the place of the unlearned say the “Amen“ at your giving of thanks?"
1CO	14	16	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7550	 Seeing how he doesn't know what you say.
1CO	14	17	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7551	" {17} For you most certainly give thanks well, but the other person is not built up."
1CO	14	18	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7552	" {18} I thank my God, I speak with other languages more than you all."
1CO	14	19	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7553	" {19} However in the assembly I would rather speak five words with my understanding, that I might instruct others also, than ten thousand words in another language."
1CO	14	20	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7554	" {20} Brothers, don't be children in thoughts, yet in malice be babies, but in thoughts be mature."
1CO	14	21	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7555	" {21} In the law it is written,"
1CO	14	21	God-FX1	#20		7556	" “By men of strange languages and by the lips of strangers I will speak to this people. Not even thus will they hear me, says the Lord.”"
1CO	14	22	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7557	" {22} Therefore other languages are for a sign, not to those who believe, but to the unbelieving."
1CO	14	22	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7558	" Prophesying is for a sign, not to the unbelieving, but to those who believe."
1CO	14	23	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7559	 {23} What if therefore the whole assembly is assembled together and all speak with other languages?
1CO	14	23	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7560	" If unlearned or unbelieving people come in, won't they say that you are crazy?"
1CO	14	24	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7561	" {24} But if all prophesy, and someone unbelieving or unlearned comes in, he is reproved by all, and he is judged by all."
1CO	14	25	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7562	" {25} And thus the secrets of his heart are revealed. So he will fall down on his face and worship God, declaring that God is among you indeed."
1CO	14	26	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7563	" {26} What is it then, brothers?"
1CO	14	26	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7564	" When you come together, each one of you has a psalm, has a teaching, has a revelation, has another language, has an interpretation."
1CO	14	26	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7565	 Let all things be done to build each other up.
1CO	14	27	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7566	" {27} If any man speaks in another language, let it be two, or at the most three, and in turn; and let one interpret."
1CO	14	28	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7567	" {28} But if there is no interpreter, let him keep silent in the assembly, and let him speak to himself, and to God."
1CO	14	29	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7568	" {29} Let the prophets speak, two or three, and let the others discern."
1CO	14	30	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7569	" {30} But if a revelation is made to another sitting by, let the first keep silent."
1CO	14	31	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7570	" {31} For you all can prophesy one by one, that all may learn, and all may be exhorted."
1CO	14	32	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7571	" {32} The spirits of the prophets are subject to the prophets,"
1CO	14	33	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7572	" {33} God is not the author of confusion, but of peace, as in all the assemblies of the saints."
1CO	14	34	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7573	" {34} Let your wives keep silent in the assemblies, for it has not been permitted for them to speak; but let them be in subjection, as the law also says."
1CO	14	35	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7574	" {35} If they desire to learn anything, let them ask their own husbands at home, for it is shameful for a woman to chatter in the assembly."
1CO	14	36	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7575	 {36} What? Was it from you that the word of God went out? Or did it come to you alone?

1CO	15	1	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7581	" {1} Now brothers, I want to remind you of the Good News which I preached to you, which also you received, in which you also stand."
1CO	15	2	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7582	" {2} By this gospel you are saved if you hold firmly the word which I preached to you. Otherwise, you have believed in vain."
1CO	15	3	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7583	" {3} For I delivered to you first of all that which I also received: that Christ died for our sins according to the Scriptures,"
1CO	15	4	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7584	" {4} that he was buried, that he was raised on the third day according to the Scriptures,"
1CO	15	5	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7585	" {5} and that he appeared to Cephas, then to the twelve."
1CO	15	6	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7586	" {6} Then he appeared to over five hundred brothers at once, most of whom remain until now, but some have also fallen asleep."

1CO	15	8	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7588	" {8} Last of all, as to the child born at the wrong time, he appeared to me also."
1CO	15	9	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7589	" {9} For I am the least of the apostles, who is not worthy to be called an apostle, because I persecuted the assembly of God."
1CO	15	10	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7590	 {10} But by the grace of God I am what I am.
1CO	15	10	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7591	" His grace which was bestowed on me was not futile, but I worked more than all of them; yet not I, but the grace of God which was with me."
1CO	15	11	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7592	" {11} Whether then it is I or they, so we preach, and so you believed."
1CO	15	12	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7593	" {12} Now if Christ is preached, that he has been raised from the dead, how do some among you say that there is no resurrection of the dead?"
1CO	15	13	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7594	" {13} But if there is no resurrection of the dead, neither has Christ been raised."
1CO	15	14	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7595	" {14} If Christ has not been raised, then our preaching is in vain, and your faith also is in vain."
1CO	15	15	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7596	" {15} Yes, we are found false witnesses of God, because we testified about God that he raised up Christ, whom he didn't raise up."
1CO	15	15	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7597	" That is, if it is so that the dead are not raised."
1CO	15	16	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7598	" {16} For if the dead aren't raised, neither has Christ been raised."

1CO	15	18	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7600	 {18} Then they also who are fallen asleep in Christ have perished.
1CO	15	19	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7601	" {19} If we have only hoped in Christ in this life, we are of all men most pitiable."
1CO	15	20	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7602	 {20} But now Christ has been raised from the dead. He became the first fruits of those who are asleep.
1CO	15	21	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7603	" {21} For since death came by man, the resurrection of the dead also came by man."
1CO	15	22	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7604	" {22} For as in Adam all die, so also in Christ all will be made alive."
1CO	15	23	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7605	" {23} But each in his own order: Christ the first fruits, then those who are Christ's, at his coming."
1CO	15	24	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7606	" {24} Then the end comes, when he will deliver up the Kingdom to God, even the Father; when he will have abolished all rule and all authority and power."
1CO	15	25	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7607	 {25} For he must reign until he has put all his enemies under his feet.
1CO	15	26	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7608	 {26} The last enemy that will be abolished is death.
1CO	15	27	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7609	" {27} For, “He put all things in subjection under his feet.”"
1CO	15	27	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7610	" But when he says, “All things are put in subjection,“ it is evident that he is excepted who subjected all things to him."
1CO	15	28	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7611	" {28} When all things have been subjected to him, then the Son will also himself be subjected to him who subjected all things to him. That God may be all in all."
1CO	15	29	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7612	" {29} Or else what will they do who are baptized for the dead? If the dead aren't raised at all, why then are they baptized for the dead?"
1CO	15	30	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7613	 {30} Why do we also stand in jeopardy every hour?
1CO	15	31	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7614	" {31} I affirm, by the boasting in you which I have in Christ Jesus our Lord, I die daily."
1CO	15	32	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7615	" {32} If I fought with animals at Ephesus for human purposes, what does it profit me?"
1CO	15	32	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7616	" If the dead are not raised, then “let us eat and drink, for tomorrow we die.”"

1CO	15	35	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7619	" {35} But someone will say, “How are the dead raised?” and, “With what kind of body do they come?”"
1CO	15	36	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7620	" {36} You foolish one, that which you yourself sow is not made alive unless it dies."
1CO	15	37	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7621	" {37} That which you sow, you don't sow the body that will be, but a bare grain, maybe of wheat, or of some other kind."
1CO	15	38	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7622	" {38} But God gives it a body even as it pleased him, and to each seed a body of its own."
1CO	15	39	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7623	" {39} All flesh is not the same flesh, but there is one flesh of men, another flesh of animals, another of fish, and another of birds."
1CO	15	40	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7624	" {40} There are also celestial bodies, and terrestrial bodies; but the glory of the celestial differs from that of the terrestrial."
1CO	15	41	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7625	" {41} There is one glory of the sun, another glory of the moon, and another glory of the stars; for one star differs from another star in glory."
1CO	15	42	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7626	" ||| DO NOT COMBINE |||*~*{Music--Ends before v42}*~**~* {42} So also is the resurrection of the dead."
1CO	15	42	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7627	 It is sown in corruption; it is raised in incorruption.
1CO	15	43	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7628	 {43} It is sown in dishonor; it is raised in glory. It is sown in weakness; it is raised in power.
1CO	15	44	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7629	" {44} It is sown a natural body; it is raised a spiritual body. There is a natural body and there is also a spiritual body. {45} So also it is written,"

1CO	15	45	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7631	 The last Adam became a life-giving spirit.
1CO	15	46	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7632	" {46} However that which is spiritual isn't first, but that which is natural, then that which is spiritual."
1CO	15	47	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7633	" {47} The first man is of the earth, made of dust. The second man is the Lord from heaven."
1CO	15	48	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7634	" {48} As is the one made of dust, such are those who are also made of dust; and as is the heavenly, such are they also that are heavenly."
1CO	15	49	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7635	" {49} As we have borne the image of those made of dust, let's also bear the image of the heavenly."
1CO	15	50	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7636	" {50} Now I say this, brothers, that flesh and blood can't inherit the Kingdom of God; neither does corruption inherit incorruption."
1CO	15	51	Narr_007: 1Corinthians	#19		7637	" {51} Behold, I tell you a mystery. We will not all sleep, but we will all be changed,"
