2CO	1	<<	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7673	"2 CORINTHIANS *~*2 CORINTHIANS CHP 1"
2CO	1	1	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7674	" {1} Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus through the will of God, and Timothy our brother, to the assembly of God which is at Corinth."
2CO	1	1	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7675	 With all the saints who are in the whole of Achaia:
2CO	1	2	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7676	 {2} Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
2CO	1	3	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7677	" {3} Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies and God of all comfort."
2CO	1	4	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7678	" {4} He comforts us in all our affliction, that we may be able to comfort those who are in any affliction."
2CO	1	4	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7679	 We do this through the comfort with which we ourselves are comforted by God.
2CO	1	5	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7680	" {5} For as the sufferings of Christ abound to us, even so our comfort also abounds through Christ."
2CO	1	6	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7681	" {6} But if we are afflicted, it is for your comfort and salvation. If we are comforted, it is for your comfort."
2CO	1	6	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7682	 It produces in you the patient enduring of the same sufferings which we also suffer.
2CO	1	7	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7683	" {7} Our hope for you is steadfast, knowing that, since you are partakers of the sufferings, so also are you of the comfort."
2CO	1	8	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7684	" {8} For we don't desire to have you uninformed, brothers, concerning our affliction which happened to us in Asia."
2CO	1	8	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7685	" We were weighed down exceedingly, beyond our power, so much that we despaired even of life."
2CO	1	9	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7686	" {9} Yes, we ourselves have had the sentence of death within ourselves, that we should not trust in ourselves, but in God who raises the dead."
2CO	1	10	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7687	" {10} God delivered us out of so great a death, and does deliver; on him we have set our hope that he will also still deliver us."
2CO	1	11	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7688	 {11} You also are helping together on our behalf by your supplication;
2CO	1	11	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7689	" that, for the gift bestowed on us by means of many, thanks may be given by many persons on your behalf."
2CO	1	12	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7690	" {12} For our boasting is this: the testimony of our conscience, that in holiness and sincerity of God,"
2CO	1	12	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7691	" not in fleshly wisdom but in the grace of God we behaved ourselves in the world, and more abundantly toward you."
2CO	1	13	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7692	 {13} We write to you only what we know you can understand. I hope you will ubnderstand everything.
2CO	1	14	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7693	" {14} When Jesus comes again, you will be as proud of us as we are of you. Right now you do not understand us very well."
2CO	1	15	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7694	" {15} It was because of this that I was determined to come first to you, that you might have a second benefit."
2CO	1	16	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7695	" {16} I wanted to stop and visit you on my way to Macedonia, and again from Macedonia to come to you, and to be sent forward by you on my journey to Judea."
2CO	1	17	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7696	" {17} When I therefore was thus determined, did I show fickleness?"
2CO	1	17	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7697	" Or the things that I purpose, do I purpose according to the flesh, that with me there should be the “Yes, yes“ and the “No, no?”"
2CO	1	18	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7698	" {18} But as God is faithful, our word toward you was not “Yes and no.”"
2CO	1	19	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7699	" {19} For the Son of God, Jesus Christ, who was preached among you by us, by me, Silvanus, and Timothy, was not “Yes and no,“ but in him is “Yes.”"
2CO	1	20	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7700	" {20} For however many are the promises of God, in him is the “Yes.” Therefore also through him is the “Amen,“ to the glory of God through us."
2CO	1	21	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7701	" {21} Now he who establishes us with you in Christ, and anointed us, is God."
2CO	1	22	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7702	" {22} He has also sealed us, and gave us the down payment of the Spirit in our hearts."
2CO	1	23	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7703	" {23} But I call God for a witness to my soul, that I didn't come to Corinth to spare you."
2CO	1	24	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7704	" {24} Not that we have lordship over your faith, but are fellow workers with you for your joy. For you stand firm in faith. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
2CO	2	<<	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7705	2 CORINTHIANS CHP 2
2CO	2	1	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7706	" {1} But I determined this for myself, that I would not come to you again in sorrow."
2CO	2	2	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7707	" {2} For if I make you sorry, then who will make me glad but he who is made sorry by me?"
2CO	2	3	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7708	" {3} And I wrote this very thing to you, so that, when I came, I wouldn't have sorrow from them of whom I ought to rejoice;"
2CO	2	3	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7709	" having confidence in you all, that my joy would be shared by all of you."
2CO	2	4	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7710	 {4} For out of much affliction and anguish of heart I wrote to you with many tears.
2CO	2	4	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7711	" Not that you should be made sorry, but that you might know the love that I have so abundantly for you."
2CO	2	5	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7712	" {5} But if any has caused sorrow, he has caused sorrow, not to me, but in part (that I not press too heavily) to you all."
2CO	2	6	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7713	 {6} Sufficient to such a one is this punishment which was inflicted by the many;
2CO	2	7	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7714	" ||| DO NOT COMBINE |||*~*{Music--Starts @ v7}*~**~* {7} so that on the contrary you should rather forgive him and comfort him, lest by any means such a one should be swallowed up with his excessive sorrow."
2CO	2	8	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7715	 {8} Therefore I beg you to confirm your love toward him.
2CO	2	9	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7716	" {9} For to this end I also wrote, that I might know the proof of you, whether you are obedient in all things."
2CO	2	10	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7717	 {10} Now I also forgive whomever you forgive anything.
2CO	2	10	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7718	" For if indeed I have forgiven anything, I have forgiven that one for your sakes in the person of Christ."
2CO	2	11	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7719	" {11} That way, no advantage may be gained over us by Satan; for we are not ignorant of his schemes."
2CO	2	12	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7720	" {12} Now when I came to Troas for the Good News of Christ, a door was opened to me in the Lord."
2CO	2	13	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7721	" {13} I had no relief for my spirit, because I didn't find Titus, my brother, but taking my leave of them, I went out into Macedonia."
2CO	2	14	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7722	" {14} Now thanks be to God, who always leads us in triumph in Christ, and reveals through us the sweet aroma of his knowledge in every place."
2CO	2	15	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7723	" {15} For we are a sweet aroma of Christ to God, in those who are saved, and in those who perish;"
2CO	2	16	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7724	 {16} to the one a stench from death to death; to the other a sweet aroma from life to life. Who is sufficient for these things?
2CO	2	17	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7725	" {17} For we are not as so many, which corrupt the word of God."
2CO	2	17	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7726	" But as of sincerity, but as of God, in the sight of God, we speak in Christ. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
2CO	3	<<	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7727	2 CORINTHIANS CHP 3
2CO	3	1	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7728	" {1} Are we beginning again to commend ourselves? Or do we need, as do some, letters of commendation to you or from you?"
2CO	3	2	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7729	" {2} You are our letter, written in our hearts, known and read by all men."
2CO	3	3	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7730	" {3} You are a letter of Christ, served by us."
2CO	3	3	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7731	" Not written with ink, but with the Spirit of the living God; not in tablets of stone, but in tablets that are hearts of flesh."
2CO	3	4	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7732	 {4} Such confidence we have through Christ toward God.
2CO	3	5	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7733	" {5} We know that we are not sufficient of ourselves, to account anything as from ourselves; but our sufficiency is from God."
2CO	3	6	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7734	" {6} God made us sufficient as servants of a new covenant; not of the letter, but of the Spirit. For the letter kills, but the Spirit gives life."
2CO	3	7	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7735	" {7} The service of death, written engraved on stones, came with glory."
2CO	3	7	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7736	 With such glory that the children of Israel could not look steadfastly on the face of Moses for the glory of his face; which was passing away.
2CO	3	8	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7737	 {8} But the service of the Spirit will be with much more glory.
2CO	3	9	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7738	" {9} For if the service of condemnation has glory, the service of righteousness exceeds much more in glory."
2CO	3	10	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7739	" {10} For most certainly that which has been made glorious has not been made glorious in this respect, by reason of the glory that surpasses."
2CO	3	11	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7740	" {11} For if that which passes away was with glory, much more that which remains is in glory."
2CO	3	12	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7741	" {12} Having therefore such a hope, we use great boldness of speech."
2CO	3	13	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7742	" {13} We do not do as Moses, who put a veil on his face, that the children of Israel wouldn't look steadfastly on the end of that which was passing away."
2CO	3	14	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7743	" {14} But their minds were hardened, for until this very day at the reading of the old covenant the same veil remains, because in Christ it passes away."
2CO	3	15	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7744	" {15} But to this day, when Moses is read, a veil lies on their heart."
2CO	3	16	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7745	" {16} But whenever one turns to the Lord, the veil is taken away."
2CO	3	17	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7746	" {17} Now the Lord is the Spirit and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is liberty."
2CO	3	18	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7747	" {18} But we all, with unveiled face beholding as in a mirror the glory of the Lord, are transformed into the same image."
2CO	3	18	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7748	" From glory to glory, even as from the Lord, the Spirit. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
2CO	4	<<	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7749	2 CORINTHIANS CHP 4
2CO	4	1	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7750	" {1} Therefore seeing we have this ministry, even as we obtained mercy, we don't faint."
2CO	4	2	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7751	" {2} But we have renounced the hidden things of shame, not walking in craftiness, nor handling the word of God deceitfully;"
2CO	4	2	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7752	 but by the manifestation of the truth commending ourselves to every man's conscience in the sight of God.
2CO	4	3	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7753	" {3} Even if our Good News is veiled, it is veiled in those who perish;"
2CO	4	4	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7754	" {4} in whom the god of this world has blinded the minds of the unbelieving,"
2CO	4	4	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7755	" that the light of the Good News of the glory of Christ, who is the image of God, should not dawn on them."
2CO	4	5	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7756	" {5} For we don't preach ourselves, but Christ Jesus as Lord, and ourselves as your servants for Jesus' sake."
2CO	4	6	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7757	" {6} It is God who said, “Light will shine out of darkness.“"
2CO	4	6	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7758	" He has shone in our hearts, to give the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ."
2CO	4	7	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7759	" {7} But we have this treasure in clay vessels, that the exceeding greatness of the power may be of God, and not from ourselves."
2CO	4	8	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7760	" {8} We are pressed on every side, yet not crushed; perplexed, yet not to despair;"
2CO	4	9	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7761	" {9} pursued, yet not forsaken; struck down, yet not destroyed;"
2CO	4	10	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7762	" {10} always carrying in the body the putting to death of the Lord Jesus, that the life of Jesus may also be revealed in our body."
2CO	4	11	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7763	" {11} For we who live are always delivered to death for Jesus' sake, that the life also of Jesus may be revealed in our mortal flesh."
2CO	4	12	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7764	" {12} So then death works in us, but life in you. {13} But having the same spirit of faith, according to that which is written,"
2CO	4	13	Scripture Quote-FX1	#13		7765	" “I believed, and therefore I spoke.”"
2CO	4	13	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7766	" We also believe, and therefore also we speak;"
2CO	4	14	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7767	" {14} knowing that he who raised the Lord Jesus will raise us also with Jesus, and will present us with you."
2CO	4	15	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7768	" {15} For all things are for your sakes, that the grace, being multiplied through the many, may cause the thanksgiving to abound to the glory of God."
2CO	4	16	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7769	" {16} Therefore we don't faint, but though our outward man is decaying, yet our inward man is renewed day by day."
2CO	4	17	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7770	" {17} For our light affliction, which is for the moment, works for us more and more exceedingly an eternal weight of glory;"
2CO	4	18	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7771	" {18} We don't look at the things which are seen, but at the things which are not seen."
2CO	4	18	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7772	" For the things which are seen are temporal, but the things which are not seen are eternal. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
2CO	5	<<	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7773	2 CORINTHIANS CHP 5
2CO	5	1	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7774	" {1} For we know that if the earthly house of our tent is dissolved, we have a building from God, a house not made with hands, eternal, in the heavens."
2CO	5	2	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7775	" {2} For most certainly in this we groan, longing to be clothed with our new body which we will have in heaven;"
2CO	5	3	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7776	 {3} We will not be without a body. We will live in a new body.
2CO	5	4	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7777	" {4} For indeed we who are in this tent do groan, being burdened;"
2CO	5	4	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7778	" not that we desire to be unclothed, but that we desire to be clothed, that what is mortal may be swallowed up by life."
2CO	5	5	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7779	" {5} Now he who made us for this very thing is God, who also gave to us the down payment of the Spirit."
2CO	5	6	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7780	" {6} Therefore we are always confident and know that while we are at home in the body, we are absent from the Lord;"
2CO	5	7	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7781	" {7} for we walk by faith, not by sight."
2CO	5	8	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7782	" {8} We are courageous, I say, and are willing rather to be absent from the body, and to be at home with the Lord."
2CO	5	9	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7783	" {9} Therefore also we make it our aim, whether at home or absent, to be well pleasing to him."
2CO	5	10	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7784	 {10} For we must all be revealed before the judgment seat of Christ;
2CO	5	10	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7785	" that each one may receive the things in the body, according to what he has done, whether good or bad."
2CO	5	11	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7786	" {11} Knowing therefore the fear of the Lord, we persuade men, but we are revealed to God; and I hope that we are revealed also in your consciences."
2CO	5	12	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7787	" {12} For we are not commending ourselves to you again, but speak as giving you occasion of boasting on our behalf, that you may have something to answer those who boast in appearance, and not in heart."
2CO	5	13	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7788	" {13} For if we are beside ourselves, it is for God. Or if we are of sober mind, it is for you."
2CO	5	14	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7789	" {14} For the love of Christ constrains us; because we judge thus, that one died for all, therefore all died."
2CO	5	15	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7790	" {15} He died for all, that those who live should no longer live to themselves, but to him who for their sakes died and rose again."
2CO	5	16	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7791	" {16} Therefore we know no one after the flesh from now on. Even though we have known Christ after the flesh, yet now we know him so no more."
2CO	5	17	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7792	" {17} Therefore if anyone is in Christ, he is a new creature. The old things have passed away. Behold, all things have become new."
2CO	5	18	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7793	" {18} But all things are of God, who reconciled us to himself through Jesus Christ, and gave to us the ministry of reconciliation;"
2CO	5	19	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7794	" {19} namely, that God was in Christ reconciling the world to himself, not reckoning to them their trespasses."
2CO	5	19	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7795	 He has committed to us the word of reconciliation.
2CO	5	20	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7796	" {20} We are therefore ambassadors on behalf of Christ, as though God were entreating by us: we beg you on behalf of Christ, be reconciled to God."
2CO	5	21	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7797	" {21} For him who knew no sin he made to be sin on our behalf; so that in him we might become the righteousness of God. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
2CO	6	<<	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7798	2 CORINTHIANS CHP 6
2CO	6	1	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7799	" {1} Working together, we entreat also that you not receive the grace of God in vain, {2} for he says,"
2CO	6	2	God-FX1	#20		7800	" “At an acceptable time I listened to you, in a day of salvation I helped you.”"
2CO	6	2	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7801	" Behold, now is the acceptable time. Behold, now is the day of salvation."
2CO	6	3	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7802	" {3} We give no occasion of stumbling in anything, that our service may not be blamed,"
2CO	6	4	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7803	" {4} but in everything commending ourselves, as servants of God, in great endurance, in afflictions, in hardships, in distresses,"
2CO	6	5	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7804	" {5} in beatings, in imprisonments, in riots, in labors, in watchings, in fastings;"
2CO	6	6	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7805	" {6} in pureness, in knowledge, in patience, in kindness, in the Holy Spirit, in sincere love,"
2CO	6	7	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7806	" {7} in the word of truth, in the power of God; by the armor of righteousness on the right hand and on the left,"
2CO	6	8	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7807	" {8} by glory and dishonor, by evil report and good report; as deceivers, and yet true;"
2CO	6	9	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7808	" {9} as unknown, and yet well known; as dying, and behold, we live; as punished, and not killed;"
2CO	6	10	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7809	" {10} as sorrowful, yet always rejoicing; as poor, yet making many rich; as having nothing, and yet possessing all things."
2CO	6	11	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7810	" {11} Our mouth is open to you, Corinthians. Our heart is enlarged."
2CO	6	12	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7811	" {12} You are not restricted by us, but you are restricted by your own affections."
2CO	6	13	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7812	" {13} Now in return, I speak as to my children, you also be open wide."
2CO	6	14	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7813	" {14} Don't be unequally yoked with unbelievers, for what fellowship have righteousness and iniquity? Or what fellowship has light with darkness?"
2CO	6	15	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7814	 {15} What agreement has Christ with Belial? Or what portion has a believer with an unbeliever?
2CO	6	16	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7815	" {16} What agreement has a temple of God with idols? For you are a temple of the living God. Even as God said,"
2CO	6	16	God-FX1	#20		7816	" “I will dwell in them, and walk in them; and I will be their God, and they will be my people.”"
2CO	6	17	God-FX1	#20		7817	" {17} Therefore “'Come out from among them, and be separate,' says the Lord. 'Touch no unclean thing. I will receive you."
2CO	6	18	God-FX1	#20		7818	" {18} I will be to you a Father. You will be to me sons and daughters,' says the Lord Almighty.”*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
2CO	7	<<	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7819	2 CORINTHIANS CHP 7
2CO	7	1	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7820	" {1} Having therefore these promises, beloved, let us cleanse ourselves from all defilement of flesh and spirit, perfecting holiness in the fear of God."
2CO	7	2	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7821	 {2} Open your hearts to us. We wronged no one. We corrupted no one. We took advantage of no one.
2CO	7	3	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7822	" {3} I say this not to condemn you, for I have said before, that you are in our hearts to die together and live together."
2CO	7	4	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7823	 {4} Great is my boldness of speech toward you. Great is my boasting on your behalf.
2CO	7	4	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7824	 I am filled with comfort. I overflow with joy in all our affliction.
2CO	7	5	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7825	" {5} For even when we had come into Macedonia, our flesh had no relief, but we were afflicted on every side. Fightings were outside. Fear was inside."
2CO	7	6	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7826	" {6} Nevertheless, he who comforts the lowly, God, comforted us by the coming of Titus;"
2CO	7	7	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7827	" {7} and not by his coming only, but also by the comfort with which he was comforted in you."
2CO	7	7	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7828	" He has told us of your longing, your mourning, and your zeal for me; so that I rejoiced still more."
2CO	7	8	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7829	" {8} For though I made you sorry with my letter, I do not regret it, though I did regret it."
2CO	7	8	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7830	" For I see that my letter made you sorry, though just for a while."
2CO	7	9	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7831	" {9} I now rejoice, not that you were made sorry, but that you were made sorry to repentance."
2CO	7	9	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7832	" For you were made sorry in a godly way, that you might suffer loss by us in nothing."
2CO	7	10	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7833	" {10} For godly sorrow works repentance to salvation, which brings no regret. But the sorrow of the world works death."
2CO	7	11	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7834	" {11} For behold, this same thing, that you were made sorry in a godly way, what earnest care it worked in you."
2CO	7	11	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7835	" Yes, what defense, indignation, fear, longing, zeal, and vengeance! In everything you demonstrated yourselves to be pure in the matter."
2CO	7	12	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7836	" {12} So although I wrote to you, I wrote not for his cause that did the wrong, nor for his cause that suffered the wrong."
2CO	7	12	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7837	 I wrote that your earnest care for us might be revealed in you in the sight of God.
2CO	7	13	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7838	" {13} Therefore we have been comforted. In our comfort we rejoiced the more exceedingly for the joy of Titus, because his spirit has been refreshed by you all."
2CO	7	14	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7839	" {14} For if in anything I have boasted to him on your behalf, I was not disappointed."
2CO	7	14	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7840	" But as we spoke all things to you in truth, so our glorying also which I made before Titus was found to be truth."
2CO	7	15	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7841	" {15} His affection is more abundantly toward you, while he remembers all of your obedience, how with fear and trembling you received him."
2CO	7	16	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7842	" {16} I rejoice that in everything I am confident concerning you. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
2CO	8	<<	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7843	2 CORINTHIANS CHP 8
2CO	8	1	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7844	" {1} Moreover, brothers, we make known to you the grace of God which has been given in the assemblies of Macedonia;"
2CO	8	2	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7845	" {2} They have been put to the test by much trouble, but they have much joy. They have given much even though they were very poor."
2CO	8	3	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7846	" {3} For according to their power, I testify, yes and beyond their power, they gave of their own accord."
2CO	8	4	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7847	 {4} They begged us with much entreaty to receive this grace and the fellowship in the service to the saints.
2CO	8	5	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7848	" {5} This was not as we had hoped, but first they gave their own selves to the Lord, and to us through the will of God."
2CO	8	6	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7849	" {6} So we urged Titus, that as he made a beginning before, so he would also complete in you this grace."
2CO	8	7	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7850	" {7} But as you abound in everything, in faith, utterance, knowledge, all earnestness, and in your love to us, see that you also abound in this grace."
2CO	8	8	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7851	" {8} I speak not by way of commandment, but as proving through the earnestness of others the sincerity also of your love."
2CO	8	9	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7852	" {9} For you know the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, that, though he was rich, yet for your sakes he became poor, that you through his poverty might become rich."
2CO	8	10	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7853	" {10} I give a judgment in this: for this is expedient for you, who were the first to start a year ago, not only to do, but also to be willing."
2CO	8	11	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7854	" {11} But now complete the doing also, that as there was the readiness to be willing, so there may be the completion also out of your ability."
2CO	8	12	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7855	" {12} For if the readiness is there, it is acceptable according to what you have, not according to what you don't have."
2CO	8	13	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7856	 {13} This is not that others may be eased and you distressed.
2CO	8	14	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7857	 {14} It is for equality. Your abundance at this present time supplies their lack.
2CO	8	14	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7858	" One day their abundance also may become a supply for your lack; that there may be equality. {15} As it is written,"
2CO	8	15	Scripture Quote-FX1	#13		7859	" “He who gathered much had nothing left over, and he who gathered little had no lack.”"
2CO	8	16	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7860	" {16} But thanks be to God, who puts the same earnest care for you into the heart of Titus."
2CO	8	17	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7861	" {17} For he indeed accepted our exhortation, but being himself very earnest, he went out to you of his own accord."
2CO	8	18	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7862	 {18} We have sent together with him the brother whose praise in the Good News is known through all the assemblies.
2CO	8	19	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7863	" {19} Not only so, but who was also appointed by the assemblies to travel with us in this grace."
2CO	8	19	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7864	" It is served by us to the glory of the Lord himself, and to show our readiness."
2CO	8	20	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7865	" {20} We are avoiding this, that any man should blame us concerning this abundance which is administered by us."
2CO	8	21	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7866	" {21} Having regard for honorable things, not only in the sight of the Lord, but also in the sight of men."
2CO	8	22	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7867	" {22} We have sent with them our brother, whom we have many times proved earnest in many things."
2CO	8	22	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7868	" But now much more earnest, by reason of the great confidence which he has in you."
2CO	8	23	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7869	" {23} As for Titus, he is my partner and fellow worker for you. As for our brothers, they are the apostles of the assemblies, the glory of Christ."
2CO	8	24	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7870	" {24} Therefore show the proof of your love to them in front of the assemblies, and of our boasting on your behalf. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
2CO	9	<<	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7871	2 CORINTHIANS CHP 9
2CO	9	1	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7872	 {1} It is indeed unnecessary for me to write to you concerning the service to the saints.
2CO	9	2	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7873	" {2} I know your readiness, of which I boast on your behalf to them of Macedonia, that Achaia has been prepared for a year past."
2CO	9	2	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7874	 Your zeal has stirred up very many of them.
2CO	9	3	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7875	" {3} But I have sent the brothers that our boasting on your behalf may not be in vain in this respect, that, just as I said, you may be prepared."
2CO	9	4	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7876	" {4} This is so that I won't by any means, if there come with me any of Macedonia and find you unprepared, we (to say nothing of you) should be disappointed in this confident boasting."
2CO	9	5	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7877	 {5} I thought it necessary therefore to entreat the brothers that they would go before to you.
2CO	9	5	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7878	" I did this that they might arrange ahead of time the generous gift that you promised before, that the same might be ready as a matter of generosity, and not of greediness."
2CO	9	6	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7879	 {6} Remember this: he who sows sparingly will also reap sparingly. He who sows bountifully will also reap bountifully.
2CO	9	7	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7880	" {7} Let each man give according as he has determined in his heart; not grudgingly, or under compulsion; for God loves a cheerful giver."
2CO	9	8	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7881	" {8} And God is able to make all grace abound to you, that you, always having all sufficiency in everything, may abound to every good work. {9} As it is written,"
2CO	9	9	Scripture Quote-FX1	#13		7882	" “He has scattered abroad, he has given to the poor. His righteousness remains forever.”"
2CO	9	10	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7883	" {10} Now may he who supplies seed to the sower and bread for food, supply and multiply your seed for sowing, and increase the fruits of your righteousness."
2CO	9	11	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7884	" {11} God will enrich you in everything to all liberality, which works through us thanksgiving to God."
2CO	9	12	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7885	" {12} For this service of giving that you perform not only makes up for lack among the saints, but abounds also through many givings of thanks to God;"
2CO	9	13	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7886	" {13} seeing that through the proof given by this service, they glorify God for the obedience of your confession to the Good News of Christ."
2CO	9	13	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7887	 For the liberality of your contribution to them and to all.
2CO	9	14	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7888	" {14} They themselves also, with supplication on your behalf, yearn for you by reason of the exceeding grace of God in you."
2CO	9	15	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7889	" {15} Now thanks be to God for his unspeakable gift! *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
2CO	10	<<	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7890	2 CORINTHIANS CHP 10
2CO	10	1	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7891	" {1} Now I Paul, myself, entreat you by the humility and gentleness of Christ; I who in your presence am lowly among you, but being absent am bold toward you."
2CO	10	2	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7892	" {2} Yes, I beg you that I may not, when present, show courage with the confidence with which I intend to be bold against some."
2CO	10	2	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7893	 With those who consider us to be walking according to the flesh.
2CO	10	3	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7894	" {3} For though we walk in the flesh, we don't wage war according to the flesh."
2CO	10	4	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7895	" {4} For the weapons of our warfare are not of the flesh, but mighty before God to the throwing down of strongholds."
2CO	10	5	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7896	 {5} We throw down imaginations and every high thing that is exalted against the knowledge of God.
2CO	10	5	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7897	 We bring every thought into captivity to the obedience of Christ;
2CO	10	6	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7898	" {6} We are in readiness to avenge all disobedience, when your obedience will be made full."
2CO	10	7	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7899	 {7} Do you look at things only as they appear in front of your face?
2CO	10	7	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7900	" If anyone trusts in himself that he is Christ's, let him consider this again with himself, that, even as he is Christ's, so also we are Christ's."
2CO	10	8	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7901	" {8} For though I should boast somewhat abundantly concerning our authority, (which the Lord gave for building you up, and not for casting you down). I will not be disappointed."
2CO	10	9	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7902	 {9} I do not want to terrify you by my letters.
2CO	10	10	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7903	" {10} For, “His letters,“ they say, “are weighty and strong, but his bodily presence is weak, and his speech is despised.”"
2CO	10	11	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7904	" {11} Let such a person consider this, that what we are in word by letters when we are absent, such are we also in deed when we are present."
2CO	10	12	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7905	 {12} For we are not bold to number or compare ourselves with some of those who commend themselves.
2CO	10	12	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7906	" But they themselves, measuring themselves by themselves, and comparing themselves with themselves, are without understanding."
2CO	10	13	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7907	" {13} But we will not boast beyond proper limits, but within the boundaries with which God appointed to us, which reach even to you."
2CO	10	14	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7908	" {14} For we don't stretch ourselves too much, as though we didn't reach to you. For we came even as far as to you with the Good News of Christ,"
2CO	10	15	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7909	 {15} not boasting beyond proper limits in other men's labors.
2CO	10	15	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7910	" But having hope that as your faith grows, we will be abundantly enlarged by you in our sphere of influence."
2CO	10	16	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7911	" {16} We hope to preach the Good News even to the parts beyond you, not to boast in what someone else has already done. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
2CO	10	17	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7912	" {17} But “he who boasts, let him boast in the Lord.”"
2CO	10	18	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7913	" {18} For it isn't he who commends himself who is approved, but whom the Lord commends. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
2CO	11	<<	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7914	2 CORINTHIANS CHP 11
2CO	11	1	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7915	" {1} I wish that you would bear with me in a little foolishness, but indeed you do bear with me."
2CO	11	2	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7916	" {2} For I am jealous over you with a godly jealousy. For I married you to one husband, that I might present you as a pure virgin to Christ."
2CO	11	3	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7917	" {3} But I am afraid that somehow, as the serpent deceived Eve in his craftiness, so your minds might be corrupted from the simplicity that is in Christ."
2CO	11	4	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7918	" {4} For if he who comes preaches another Jesus, whom we did not preach, or if you receive a different spirit, which you did not receive,"
2CO	11	4	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7919	" or a different “good news“, which you did not accept, you put up with that well enough."
2CO	11	5	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7920	 {5} For I reckon that I am not at all behind the very best apostles.
2CO	11	6	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7921	" {6} But though I am unskilled in speech, yet I am not unskilled in knowledge. No, in every way we have been revealed to you in all things."
2CO	11	7	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7922	" {7} Or did I commit a sin in humbling myself that you might be exalted, because I preached to you God's Good News free of charge?"
2CO	11	8	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7923	" {8} I robbed other assemblies, taking wages from them that I might serve you."
2CO	11	9	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7924	" {9} When I was present with you and was in need, I wasn't a burden on anyone, for the brothers, when they came from Macedonia, supplied the measure of my need."
2CO	11	9	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7925	" In everything I kept myself from being burdensome to you, and I will continue to do so."
2CO	11	10	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7926	" {10} As the truth of Christ is in me, no one will stop me from this boasting in the regions of Achaia."
2CO	11	11	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7927	 {11} Why? Because I don't love you? God knows.
2CO	11	12	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7928	" {12} But what I do, that I will do, that I may cut off occasion from them that desire an occasion, that in which they boast, they may be found even as we."
2CO	11	13	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7929	" {13} For such men are false apostles, deceitful workers, masquerading as Christ's apostles."
2CO	11	14	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7930	" {14} And no wonder, for even Satan masquerades as an angel of light."
2CO	11	15	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7931	" {15} It is no great thing therefore if his servants also masquerade as servants of righteousness, whose end will be according to their works."
2CO	11	16	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7932	" {16} I say again, let no one think me foolish. But if so, yet receive me as foolish, that I also may boast a little."
2CO	11	17	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7933	" {17} That which I speak, I don't speak according to the Lord, but as in foolishness, in this confidence of boasting."
2CO	11	18	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7934	" {18} Seeing that many boast after the flesh, I will also boast."
2CO	11	19	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7935	" {19} For you bear with the foolish gladly, being wise."
2CO	11	20	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7936	" {20} For you bear with a man, if he brings you into bondage, if he devours you, if he takes you captive, if he exalts himself, if he strikes you on the face."
2CO	11	21	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7937	" {21} I speak by way of disparagement, as though we had been weak. Yet however any is bold (I speak in foolishness), I am bold also."
2CO	11	22	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7938	 {22} Are they Hebrews? So am I. Are they Israelites? So am I. Are they the seed of Abraham? So am I.
2CO	11	23	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7939	 {23} Are they servants of Christ? (I speak as one beside himself).
2CO	11	23	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7940	" I am more so; in labors more abundantly, in prisons more abundantly, in stripes above measure, in deaths often."
2CO	11	24	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7941	 {24} Five times from the Jews I received forty stripes minus one.
2CO	11	25	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7942	 {25} Three times I was beaten with rods. Once I was stoned. Three times I suffered shipwreck. I have been a night and a day in the deep.
2CO	11	26	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7943	" {26} I have been in travels often, perils of rivers, perils of robbers, perils from my countrymen, perils from the Gentiles,"
2CO	11	26	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7944	" perils in the city, perils in the wilderness, perils in the sea, perils among false brothers;"
2CO	11	27	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7945	" {27} in labor and travail, in watchings often, in hunger and thirst, in fastings often, and in cold and nakedness."
2CO	11	28	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7946	" {28} Besides those things that are outside, there is that which presses on me daily, anxiety for all the assemblies."
2CO	11	29	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7947	" {29} Who is weak, and I am not weak? Who is caused to stumble, and I don't burn with indignation?"
2CO	11	30	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7948	" {30} If I must boast, I will boast of the things that concern my weakness."
2CO	11	31	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7949	" {31} The God and Father of the Lord Jesus Christ, he who is blessed forevermore, knows that I don't lie."
2CO	11	32	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7950	 {32} In Damascus the governor under King Aretas guarded the city of the Damascenes desiring to arrest me.
2CO	11	33	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7951	" {33} Through a window I was let down in a basket by the wall, and escaped his hands. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
2CO	12	<<	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7952	2 CORINTHIANS CHP 12
2CO	12	1	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7953	 {1} It is doubtless not profitable for me to boast. For I will come to visions and revelations of the Lord.
2CO	12	2	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7954	" ||| DO NOT COMBINE |||*~*{Music--Starts @ v2}*~**~* {2} I know a man in Christ, fourteen years ago he was caught up into the third heaven."
2CO	12	2	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7955	" (whether in the body, I don't know, or whether out of the body, I don't know; God knows)"
2CO	12	3	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7956	" {3} I know such a man (whether in the body, or outside of the body, I don't know; God knows),"
2CO	12	4	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7957	" {4} how he was caught up into Paradise, and heard unspeakable words, which it is not lawful for a man to utter."
2CO	12	5	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7958	" {5} On behalf of such a one I will boast, but on my own behalf I will not boast, except in my weaknesses."
2CO	12	6	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7959	" {6} For if I would desire to boast, I will not be foolish; for I will speak the truth."
2CO	12	6	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7960	" But I refrain, so that no man may think more of me than that which he sees in me, or hears from me."
2CO	12	7	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7961	" {7} By reason of the exceeding greatness of the revelations, that I should not be exalted excessively,"
2CO	12	7	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7962	" there was given to me a thorn in the flesh, a messenger of Satan to torment me, that I should not be exalted excessively."
2CO	12	8	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7963	" {8} Concerning this thing, I begged the Lord three times that it might depart from me."
2CO	12	9	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7964	" {9} He has said to me, “My grace is sufficient for you, for my power is made perfect in weakness.”"
2CO	12	9	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7965	" Most gladly therefore I will rather glory in my weaknesses, that the power of Christ may rest on me."
2CO	12	10	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7966	" {10} Therefore I take pleasure in weaknesses, in injuries, in necessities, in persecutions, in distresses, for Christ's sake."
2CO	12	10	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7967	" For when I am weak, then am I strong."
2CO	12	11	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7968	" {11} I have become foolish in boasting. You compelled me, for I ought to have been commended by you."
2CO	12	11	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7969	" For in nothing was I inferior to the very best apostles, though I am nothing."
2CO	12	12	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7970	" {12} Truly the signs of an apostle were worked among you in all patience, in signs and wonders and mighty works."
2CO	12	13	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7971	" {13} For what is there in which you were made inferior to the rest of the assemblies, unless it is that I myself was not a burden to you? Forgive me this wrong."
2CO	12	14	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7972	" {14} Behold, this is the third time I am ready to come to you, and I will not be a burden to you; for I seek not your possessions, but you."
2CO	12	14	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7973	" For the children ought not to save up for the parents, but the parents for the children."
2CO	12	15	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7974	" {15} I will most gladly spend and be spent for your souls. If I love you more abundantly, am I loved the less?"
2CO	12	16	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7975	" {16} But be it so, I did not myself burden you. But, being crafty, I caught you with deception."
2CO	12	17	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7976	 {17} Did I take advantage of you by anyone of them whom I have sent to you?
2CO	12	18	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7977	" {18} I exhorted Titus, and I sent the brother with him. Did Titus take any advantage of you?"
2CO	12	18	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7978	 Didn't we walk in the same spirit? Didn't we walk in the same steps?
2CO	12	19	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7979	" {19} Again, do you think that we are excusing ourselves to you?"
2CO	12	19	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7980	" In the sight of God we speak in Christ. But all things, beloved, are for your edifying."
2CO	12	20	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7981	" {20} For I am afraid that by any means, when I come, I might find you not the way I want to, and that I might be found by you as you don't desire;"
2CO	12	20	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7982	" that by any means there would be strife, jealousy, outbursts of anger, factions, slander, whisperings, proud thoughts, riots;"
2CO	12	21	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7983	" {21} that again when I come my God would humble me before you, and I would mourn for many of those who have sinned before now."
2CO	12	21	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7984	" For those who have not repented of the uncleanness and sexual immorality and lustfulness which they committed. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
2CO	13	<<	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7985	2 CORINTHIANS CHP 13
2CO	13	1	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7986	 {1} This is the third time I am coming to you. “At the mouth of two or three witnesses shall every word be established.”
2CO	13	2	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7987	" {2} During my second visit, I spoke to you who have been sinning and to all the others."
2CO	13	2	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7988	" While I am away, I tell you this again. The next time I come, I will be hard on those who sin."
2CO	13	3	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7989	" {3} Since you want to know, I will prove to you that Christ speaks through me."
2CO	13	3	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7990	 Christ is not weak when he works in your hearts. He uses his power in you.
2CO	13	4	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7991	" {4} For he was crucified through weakness, yet he lives through the power of God."
2CO	13	4	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7992	" For we also are weak in him, but we will live with him through the power of God toward you."
2CO	13	5	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7993	" {5} Test your own selves, whether you are in the faith. Test your own selves."
2CO	13	5	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7994	" Or don't you know as to your own selves, that Jesus Christ is in you?--unless indeed you are disqualified."
2CO	13	6	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7995	 {6} But I hope that you will know that we aren't disqualified.
2CO	13	7	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7996	" {7} Now I pray to God that you do no evil; not that we may appear approved, but that you may do that which is honorable, though we are as reprobate."
2CO	13	8	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7997	" {8} For we can do nothing against the truth, but for the truth."
2CO	13	9	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7998	" {9} For we rejoice when we are weak and you are strong. And this we also pray for, even your perfecting."
2CO	13	10	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		7999	" {10} For this cause I write these things while absent, that I may not deal sharply when present."
2CO	13	10	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		8000	" According to the authority which the Lord gave me for building up, and not for tearing down."
2CO	13	11	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		8001	" {11} Finally, brothers, rejoice. Be perfected, be comforted, be of the same mind, live in peace, and the God of love and peace will be with you."
2CO	13	12	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		8002	 {12} Greet one another with a holy kiss. {13} All the saints greet you.
2CO	13	14	Narr_008: 2Corinthians	#19		8003	" {14} The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, the love of God, and the fellowship of the Holy Spirit, be with you all. Amen. *~**~*||| + 5 SECs |||*~*"
GAL	1	<<	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8004	"GALATIANS*~*GALATIANS CHP 1"
GAL	1	1	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8005	" {1} Paul, an apostle (not from men, neither through man, but through Jesus Christ, and God the Father, who raised him from the dead),"
GAL	1	2	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8006	" {2} and all the brothers who are with me, to the assemblies of Galatia:"
GAL	1	3	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8007	" {3} Grace to you and peace from God the Father, and our Lord Jesus Christ,"
GAL	1	4	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8008	" {4} who gave himself for our sins, that he might deliver us out of this present evil age, according to the will of our God and Father--"
GAL	1	5	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8009	 {5} to whom be the glory forever and ever. Amen.
GAL	1	6	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8010	 {6} I marvel that you are so quickly deserting him who called you in the grace of Christ to a different “good news“.
GAL	1	7	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8011	" {7} There isn't another “good news.” Only there are some who trouble you, and want to pervert the Good News of Christ."
GAL	1	8	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8012	" {8} But even though we, or an angel from heaven, should preach to you any “good news“ other than that which we preached to you, let him be cursed."
GAL	1	9	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8013	" {9} As we have said before, so I now say again: if any man preaches to you any “good news“ other than that which you received, let him be cursed."
GAL	1	10	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8014	" {10} For am I now seeking the favor of men, or of God? Or am I striving to please men?"
GAL	1	10	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8015	" For if I were still pleasing men, I wouldn't be a servant of Christ."
GAL	1	11	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8016	" {11} But I make known to you, brothers, concerning the Good News which was preached by me, that it is not according to man."
GAL	1	12	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8017	" {12} For neither did I receive it from man, nor was I taught it, but it came to me through revelation of Jesus Christ."
GAL	1	13	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8018	" ||| DO NOT COMBINE |||*~*{Music--Ends before v13}*~**~* {13} For you have heard of my way of living in time past in the Jews' religion."
GAL	1	13	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8019	" How that beyond measure I persecuted the assembly of God, and ravaged it."
GAL	1	14	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8020	" {14} I advanced in the Jews' religion beyond many of my own age among my countrymen, being more exceedingly zealous for the traditions of my fathers."
GAL	1	15	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8021	" {15} But when it was the good pleasure of God, who separated me from my mother's womb, and called me through his grace,"
GAL	1	16	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8022	" {16} to reveal his Son in me, that I might preach him among the Gentiles, I didn't immediately confer with flesh and blood,"
GAL	1	17	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8023	" {17} nor did I go up to Jerusalem to those who were apostles before me, but I went away into Arabia. Then I returned to Damascus."
GAL	1	18	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8024	" {18} Then after three years I went up to Jerusalem to visit Peter, and stayed with him fifteen days."
GAL	1	19	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8025	" {19} But of the other apostles I saw no one, except James, the Lord's brother."
GAL	1	20	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8026	 {20} I assure you before God that what I am writing to you is no lie.
GAL	1	21	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8027	 {21} Then I came to the regions of Syria and Cilicia. {22} I was still unknown by face to the assemblies of Judea which were in Christ.
GAL	1	23	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8028	 {23} They only heard: “He who once persecuted us now preaches the faith that he once tried to destroy.”
GAL	1	24	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8029	" {24} And they glorified God in me.*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
GAL	2	<<	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8030	GALATIANS CHP 2
GAL	2	1	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8031	" {1} Then after a period of fourteen years I went up again to Jerusalem with Barnabas, taking Titus also with me."
GAL	2	2	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8032	" {2} I went up by revelation, and I laid before them the Good News which I preach among the Gentiles."
GAL	2	2	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8033	" And privately before those who were respected, for fear that I might be running, or had run, in vain."
GAL	2	3	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8034	" {3} But not even Titus, who was with me, being a Greek, was compelled to be circumcised."
GAL	2	4	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8035	 {4} This was because of the false brothers secretly brought in.
GAL	2	4	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8036	" They stole in to spy out our liberty which we have in Christ Jesus, that they might bring us into bondage."
GAL	2	5	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8037	" {5} We gave no place in the way of subjection, not for an hour, that the truth of the Good News might continue with you."
GAL	2	6	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8038	" {6} But from those who were reputed to be important (whatever they were, it makes no difference to me; God doesn't show partiality to man)--"
GAL	2	6	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8039	" they, I say, who were respected imparted nothing to me,"
GAL	2	7	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8040	" {7} but to the contrary, when they saw that I had been entrusted with the Good News for the uncircumcision, even as Peter with the Good News for the circumcision"
GAL	2	8	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8041	 {8} (for he who appointed Peter to the apostleship of the circumcision appointed me also to the Gentiles);
GAL	2	9	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8042	" {9} and when they perceived the grace that was given to me, James and Cephas and John,"
GAL	2	9	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8043	" they who were reputed to be pillars, gave to me and Barnabas the right hand of fellowship, that we should go to the Gentiles, and they to the circumcision."
GAL	2	10	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8044	 {10} They only asked us to remember the poor--which very thing I was also zealous to do.
GAL	2	11	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8045	" {11} But when Peter came to Antioch, I resisted him to his face, because he stood condemned."
GAL	2	12	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8046	" {12} For before some people came from James, he ate with the Gentiles."
GAL	2	12	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8047	" But when they came, he drew back and separated himself, fearing those who were of the circumcision."
GAL	2	13	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8048	 {13} And the rest of the Jews joined him in his hypocrisy; so that even Barnabas was carried away with their hypocrisy.
GAL	2	14	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8049	" {14} But when I saw that they didn't walk uprightly according to the truth of the Good News, I said to Peter before them all,"
GAL	2	14	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8050	" “If you, being a Jew, live as the Gentiles do, and not as the Jews do, why do you compel the Gentiles to live as the Jews do?"
GAL	2	15	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8051	" {15} “We were born Jews by nature, and not Gentile sinners."
GAL	2	16	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8052	" {16} Even so, we know that a man is not justified by the works of the law but through faith in Jesus Christ."
GAL	2	16	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8053	" Even we believed in Christ Jesus, that we might be justified by faith in Christ, and not by the works of the law."
GAL	2	16	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8054	 No flesh will be justified by the works of the law.
GAL	2	17	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8055	" {17} But if, while we sought to be justified in Christ, we ourselves also were found sinners, is Christ a servant of sin? Certainly not!"
GAL	2	18	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8056	" {18} For if I build up again those things which I destroyed, I prove myself a law-breaker."
GAL	2	19	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8057	" {19} For I, through the law, died to the law, that I might live to God."
GAL	2	20	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8058	" {20} I have been crucified with Christ, and it is no longer I that live, but Christ living in me."
GAL	2	20	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8059	" That life which I now live in the flesh, I live by faith in the Son of God, who loved me, and gave himself up for me."
GAL	2	21	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8060	" {21} I don't make void the grace of God. For if righteousness is through the law, then Christ died for nothing!”*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
GAL	3	<<	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8061	GALATIANS CHP 3
GAL	3	1	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8062	" {1} Foolish Galatians, who has bewitched you not to obey the truth, before whose eyes Jesus Christ was openly set forth among you as crucified?"
GAL	3	2	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8063	" {2} I just want to learn this from you. Did you receive the Spirit by the works of the law, or by hearing of faith?"
GAL	3	3	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8064	" {3} Are you so foolish? Having begun in the Spirit, are you now completed in the flesh?"
GAL	3	4	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8065	" {4} Did you suffer so many things in vain, if it is indeed in vain?"
GAL	3	5	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8066	" {5} He therefore who supplies the Spirit to you, and works miracles among you, does he do it by the works of the law, or by hearing of faith?"
GAL	3	6	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8067	 {6} Even as Abraham
GAL	3	6	Scripture Quote-FX1	#13		8068	" “believed God, and it was counted to him for righteousness.”"
GAL	3	7	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8069	" {7} Know therefore that those who are of faith, the same are children of Abraham."
GAL	3	8	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8070	" {8} The Scripture, foreseeing that God would justify the Gentiles by faith, preached the Good News beforehand to Abraham, saying,"
GAL	3	8	God-FX1	#20		8071	 “In you all the nations will be blessed.”
GAL	3	9	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8072	" {9} So then, those who are of faith are blessed with the faithful Abraham."
GAL	3	10	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8073	" {10} For as many as are of the works of the law are under a curse. For it is written,"
GAL	3	10	God-FX1	#20		8074	" “Cursed is everyone who doesn't continue in all things that are written in the book of the law, to do them.”"
GAL	3	11	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8075	" {11} Now that no man is justified by the law before God is evident, for,"
GAL	3	11	God-FX1	#20		8076	 “The righteous will live by faith.”
GAL	3	12	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8077	" {12} The law is not of faith, but,"
GAL	3	12	God-FX1	#20		8078	 “The man who does them will live by them.”
GAL	3	13	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8079	" {13} Christ redeemed us from the curse of the law, having become a curse for us. For it is written,"
GAL	3	13	God-FX1	#20		8080	" “Cursed is everyone who hangs on a tree,"""
GAL	3	14	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8081	 {14} that the blessing of Abraham might come on the Gentiles through Christ Jesus; that we might receive the promise of the Spirit through faith.
GAL	3	15	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8082	" {15} Brothers, speaking of human terms, though it is only a man's covenant, yet when it has been confirmed, no one makes it void, or adds to it."
GAL	3	16	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8083	" {16} Now the promises were spoken to Abraham and to his seed. He doesn't say, “To seeds,“ as of many, but as of one, “To your seed,“ which is Christ."
GAL	3	17	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8084	 {17} Now I say this. A covenant confirmed beforehand by God in Christ.
GAL	3	17	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8085	" The law, which came four hundred thirty years after, does not annul, so as to make the promise of no effect."
GAL	3	18	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8086	" {18} For if the inheritance is of the law, it is no more of promise; but God has granted it to Abraham by promise."
GAL	3	19	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8087	 {19} What then is the law? It was added because of transgressions.
GAL	3	19	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8088	 Until the seed should come to whom the promise has been made. It was ordained through angels by the hand of a mediator.
GAL	3	20	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8089	" {20} Now a mediator is not between one, but God is one."
GAL	3	21	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8090	 {21} Is the law then against the promises of God? Certainly not!
GAL	3	21	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8091	" For if there had been a law given which could make alive, most certainly righteousness would have been of the law."
GAL	3	22	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8092	" {22} But the Scriptures imprisoned all things under sin, that the promise by faith in Jesus Christ might be given to those who believe."
GAL	3	23	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8093	" {23} But before faith came, we were kept in custody under the law, confined for the faith which should afterwards be revealed."
GAL	3	24	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8094	" {24} So that the law has become our tutor to bring us to Christ, that we might be justified by faith."
GAL	3	25	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8095	" {25} But now that faith has come, we are no longer under a tutor."
GAL	3	26	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8096	" {26} For you are all children of God, through faith in Christ Jesus."
GAL	3	27	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8097	 {27} For as many of you as were baptized into Christ have put on Christ.
GAL	3	28	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8098	" {28} There is neither Jew nor Greek, there is neither slave nor free man, there is neither male nor female; for you are all one in Christ Jesus."
GAL	3	29	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8099	" {29} If you are Christ's, then you are Abraham's seed and heirs according to promise.*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
GAL	4	<<	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8100	GALATIANS CHP 4
GAL	4	1	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8101	" {1} But I say that so long as the heir is a child, he is no different from a bondservant, though he is lord of all;"
GAL	4	2	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8102	" ||| DO NOT COMBINE |||*~*{Music--Starts @ v2}*~**~* {2} but is under guardians and stewards until the day appointed by the father."
GAL	4	3	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8103	" {3} So we also, when we were children, were held in bondage under the elemental principles of the world."
GAL	4	4	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8104	" {4} But when the fullness of the time came, God sent out his Son, born to a woman, born under the law,"
GAL	4	5	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8105	" {5} that he might redeem those who were under the law, that we might receive the adoption of children."
GAL	4	6	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8106	" {6} And because you are children, God sent out the Spirit of his Son into your hearts, crying, “Abba, Father!”"
GAL	4	7	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8107	" {7} So you are no longer a bondservant, but a son; and if a son, then an heir of God through Christ."
GAL	4	8	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8108	" {8} However at that time, not knowing God, you were in bondage to those who by nature are not gods."
GAL	4	9	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8109	" {9} You have come to know God, or rather to be known by God. Why do you turn back again to the weak and miserable elemental principles, to which you desire to be in bondage all over again?"
GAL	4	10	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8110	" {10} You observe days, months, seasons, and years."
GAL	4	11	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8111	" {11} I am afraid for you, that I might have wasted my labor for you."
GAL	4	12	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8112	" {12} I beg you, brothers, become as I am, for I also have become as you are. You did me no wrong."
GAL	4	13	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8113	 {13} You know that because of weakness of the flesh I preached the Good News to you the first time.
GAL	4	14	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8114	" {14} That which was a temptation to you in my flesh, you didn't despise nor reject; but you received me as an angel of God, even as Christ Jesus."
GAL	4	15	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8115	" {15} What was the blessing you enjoyed? For I testify to you that, if possible, you would have plucked out your eyes and given them to me."
GAL	4	16	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8116	" {16} So then, have I become your enemy by telling you the truth?"
GAL	4	17	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8117	" {17} They zealously seek you in no good way. No, they desire to alienate you, that you may seek them."
GAL	4	18	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8118	" {18} But it is always good to be zealous in a good cause, and not only when I am present with you."
GAL	4	19	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8119	" ||| DO NOT COMBINE |||*~*{Music--Ends before v19}*~**~* {19} My little children, I am again in travail until Christ is formed in you."
GAL	4	20	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8120	" {20} I could wish to be present with you now, and to change my tone, for I am perplexed about you."
GAL	4	21	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8121	" {21} Tell me, you that desire to be under the law, don't you listen to the law?"
GAL	4	22	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8122	" {22} For it is written that Abraham had two sons, one by the handmaid, and one by the free woman."
GAL	4	23	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8123	" {23} However, the son by the handmaid was born according to the flesh, but the son by the free woman was born through promise."
GAL	4	24	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8124	" {24} These things contain an allegory, for these are two covenants. One is from Mount Sinai, bearing children to bondage, which is Hagar."
GAL	4	25	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8125	" {25} For this Hagar is Mount Sinai in Arabia, and answers to the Jerusalem that exists now, for she is in bondage with her children."
GAL	4	26	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8126	" {26} But the Jerusalem that is above is free, which is the mother of us all. {27} For it is written,"
GAL	4	27	Isaiah-FX1	#04		8127	" “Rejoice, you barren who don't bear. Break forth and shout, you that don't travail."
GAL	4	27	Isaiah-FX1	#04		8128	 For more are the children of the desolate than of her who has a husband.”
GAL	4	28	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8129	" {28} Now we, brothers, as Isaac was, are children of promise."
GAL	4	29	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8130	" {29} But as then, he who was born according to the flesh persecuted him who was born according to the Spirit, so also it is now."
GAL	4	30	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8131	 {30} However what does the Scripture say?
GAL	4	30	God-FX1	#20		8132	" “Throw out the handmaid and her son, for the son of the handmaid will not inherit with the son of the free woman.”"
GAL	4	31	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8133	" {31} So then, brothers, we are not children of a handmaid, but of the free woman.*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
GAL	5	<<	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8134	GALATIANS CHP 5
GAL	5	1	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8135	" {1} Stand firm therefore in the liberty by which Christ has made us free, and don't be entangled again with a yoke of bondage."
GAL	5	2	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8136	" {2} Behold, I, Paul, tell you that if you receive circumcision, Christ will profit you nothing."
GAL	5	3	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8137	" {3} Yes, I testify again to every man who receives circumcision, that he is a debtor to do the whole law."
GAL	5	4	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8138	" {4} Christ has become of no effect to you, you who desire to be justified by the law. You have fallen away from grace."
GAL	5	5	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8139	" {5} For we, through the Spirit, by faith wait for the hope of righteousness."
GAL	5	6	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8140	" {6} For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision amounts to anything, nor uncircumcision, but faith working through love."
GAL	5	7	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8141	 {7} You were running well! Who interfered with you that you should not obey the truth?
GAL	5	8	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8142	 {8} This persuasion is not from him who calls you.
GAL	5	9	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8143	 {9} A little yeast grows through the whole lump.
GAL	5	10	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8144	" {10} I have confidence toward you in the Lord that you will think no other way. But he who troubles you will bear his judgment, whoever he is."
GAL	5	11	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8145	" {11} But I, brothers, if I still preach circumcision, why am I still persecuted? Then the stumbling block of the cross has been removed."
GAL	5	12	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8146	 {12} I wish that those who disturb you would cut themselves off.
GAL	5	13	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8147	" {13} For you, brothers, were called for freedom. Only don't use your freedom for gain to the flesh, but through love be servants to one another."
GAL	5	14	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8148	" {14} For the whole law is fulfilled in one word, in this:"
GAL	5	14	God-FX1	#20		8149	 “You shall love your neighbor as yourself.”
GAL	5	15	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8150	" {15} But if you bite and devour one another, be careful that you don't consume one another."
GAL	5	16	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8151	" ||| DO NOT COMBINE |||*~*{Music--Ends before v16}*~**~* {16} But I say, walk by the Spirit, and you won't fulfill the lust of the flesh."
GAL	5	17	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8152	" {17} For the flesh lusts against the Spirit, and the Spirit against the flesh."
GAL	5	17	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8153	" These are contrary to one another, that you may not do the things that you desire."
GAL	5	18	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8154	" {18} But if you are led by the Spirit, you are not under the law."
GAL	5	19	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8155	" {19} Now the works of the flesh are obvious, which are: adultery, sexual immorality, uncleanness, lustfulness,"
GAL	5	20	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8156	" {20} idolatry, sorcery, hatred, strife, jealousies, outbursts of anger, rivalries, divisions, heresies,"
GAL	5	21	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8157	" {21} envyings, murders, drunkenness, orgies, and things like these;"
GAL	5	21	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8158	" of which I forewarn you, even as I also forewarned you, that those who practice such things will not inherit the Kingdom of God."
GAL	5	22	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8159	" {22} But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faith,"
GAL	5	23	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8160	" {23} gentleness, and self-control. Against such things there is no law."
GAL	5	24	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8161	 {24} Those who belong to Christ have crucified the flesh with its passions and lusts.
GAL	5	25	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8162	" {25} If we live by the Spirit, let's also walk by the Spirit."
GAL	5	26	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8163	" {26} Let's not become conceited, provoking one another, and envying one another.*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
GAL	6	<<	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8164	GALATIANS CHP 6
GAL	6	1	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8165	" {1} Brothers, even if a man is caught in some fault,"
GAL	6	1	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8166	 you who are spiritual must restore such a one in a spirit of gentleness; looking to yourself so that you also aren't tempted.
GAL	6	2	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8167	" {2} Bear one another's burdens, and so fulfill the law of Christ."
GAL	6	3	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8168	" {3} For if a man thinks himself to be something when he is nothing, he deceives himself."
GAL	6	4	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8169	" {4} But let each man test his own work, and then he will take pride in himself and not in his neighbor."
GAL	6	5	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8170	 {5} For each man will bear his own burden.
GAL	6	6	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8171	 {6} But let him who is taught in the word share all good things with him who teaches.
GAL	6	7	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8172	" {7} Don't be deceived. God is not mocked, for whatever a man sows, that he will also reap."
GAL	6	8	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8173	 {8} For he who sows to his own flesh will from the flesh reap corruption. But he who sows to the Spirit will from the Spirit reap eternal life.
GAL	6	9	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8174	" {9} Let us not be weary in doing good, for we will reap in due season, if we don't give up."
GAL	6	10	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8175	" {10} So then, as we have opportunity, let's do what is good toward all men, and especially toward those who are of the household of the faith."
GAL	6	11	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8176	 {11} See with what large letters I write to you with my own hand.
GAL	6	12	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8177	" {12} As many as desire to look good in the flesh, they compel you to be circumcised; only that they may not be persecuted for the cross of Christ."
GAL	6	13	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8178	" {13} For even they who receive circumcision don't keep the law themselves, but they desire to have you circumcised, that they may boast in your flesh."
GAL	6	14	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8179	" {14} But far be it from me to boast, except in the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ, through which the world has been crucified to me, and I to the world."
GAL	6	15	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8180	" {15} For in Christ Jesus neither is circumcision anything, nor uncircumcision, but a new creation."
GAL	6	16	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8181	" {16} As many as walk by this rule, peace and mercy be on them, and on God's Israel."
GAL	6	17	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8182	" {17} From now on, let no one cause me any trouble, for I bear the marks of the Lord Jesus branded on my body."
GAL	6	18	Narr_009: Galatians	#19		8183	" {18} The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit, brothers. Amen. *~**~*||| + 5 SECs |||*~*"
EPH	1	<<	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8184	"EPHESIANS*~*EPHESIANS CHP 1"
EPH	1	1	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8185	" {1} Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus through the will of God, to the saints who are at Ephesus, and the faithful in Christ Jesus:"
EPH	1	2	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8186	 {2} Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
EPH	1	3	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8187	" {3} Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed us with every spiritual blessing in the heavenly places in Christ;"
EPH	1	4	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8188	" {4} even as he chose us in him before the foundation of the world, that we would be holy and without blemish before him in love;"
EPH	1	5	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8189	" {5} He predestined us for adoption as children through Jesus Christ to himself, according to the good pleasure of his desire."
EPH	1	6	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8190	" {6} We give thanks to God for his grace, by which he has accepted us in the Beloved."
EPH	1	7	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8191	" {7} In him we have our redemption through his blood, the forgiveness of our trespasses, according to the riches of his grace,"
EPH	1	8	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8192	" {8} which he made to abound toward us in all wisdom and prudence,"
EPH	1	9	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8193	" ||| DO NOT COMBINE |||*~*{Music--Ends & New Music--Starts @ v9}*~**~* {9} He makes known to us the mystery of his will, according to his good pleasure which he purposed in Christ."
EPH	1	10	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8194	" {10} This plan is to be put into effect when the times have reached their fulfillment, to bring all things in heaven and on earth together under one head, even Christ."
EPH	1	11	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8195	" {11} In him also we were assigned an inheritance, having been foreordained."
EPH	1	11	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8196	 And this according to the purpose of him who works all things after the counsel of his will.
EPH	1	12	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8197	 {12} We who were the first to trust in Christ should thank him for his greatness.
EPH	1	13	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8198	" {13} You also, having heard the word of the truth, the Good News of your salvation in whom, having also believed, you were sealed with the Holy Spirit of promise,"
EPH	1	14	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8199	" {14} who is a pledge of our inheritance, to the redemption of God's own possession, to the praise of his glory."
EPH	1	15	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8200	" {15} For this cause I also, having heard of the faith in the Lord Jesus which is among you, and the love which you have toward all the saints,"
EPH	1	16	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8201	" {16} don't cease to give thanks for you, making mention of you in my prayers."
EPH	1	17	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8202	" {17} I keep asking that the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of glory, may give to you a spirit of wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of him."
EPH	1	18	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8203	" {18} I pray also that the eyes of your hearts are enlightened, that you may know what is the hope of his calling."
EPH	1	18	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8204	" and what are the riches of the glory of his inheritance in the saints,"
EPH	1	19	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8205	" {19} and what is the exceeding greatness of his power toward us who believe, according to that working of the strength of his might"
EPH	1	20	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8206	" {20} which he worked in Christ, when he raised him from the dead, and made him to sit at his right hand in the heavenly places,"
EPH	1	21	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8207	" {21} far above all rule, and authority, and power, and dominion."
EPH	1	21	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8208	" Far above every name that is named, not only in this age, but also in that which is to come."
EPH	1	22	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8209	" {22} He put all things in subjection under his feet, and gave him to be head over all things for the assembly,"
EPH	1	23	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8210	" {23} which is his body, the fullness of him who fills all in all. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"

EPH	2	3	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8215	" {3} We also once lived among them in the lust of our flesh, doing the desires of the flesh and of the mind."

EPH	2	4	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8217	" {4} But God, being rich in mercy, for his great love with which he loved us,"

EPH	2	10	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8223	" {10} For we are his workmanship, created in Christ Jesus for good works, which God prepared before that we would walk in them."
EPH	2	11	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8224	" {11} Therefore remember that once you, the Gentiles in the flesh, who are called “uncircumcision“ by that which is called “circumcision,“ (in the flesh, made by hands);"

EPH	2	13	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8227	 {13} But now in Christ Jesus you who once were far off are made near in the blood of Christ.
EPH	2	14	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8228	" {14} For he is our peace, who made both one, and broke down the middle wall of partition,"
EPH	2	15	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8229	" {15} having abolished in the flesh the hostility, the law of commandments contained in ordinances, that he might create in himself one new man of the two, making peace;"
EPH	2	16	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8230	" {16} and might reconcile them both in one body to God through the cross, having killed the hostility thereby."
EPH	2	17	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8231	 {17} He came and preached peace to you who were far off and to those who were near.
EPH	2	18	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8232	 {18} For through him we both have our access in one Spirit to the Father.
EPH	2	19	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8233	" {19} So then you are no longer strangers and foreigners, but you are fellow citizens with the saints, and of the household of God."
EPH	2	20	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8234	" {20} This family is being built on the foundation of the apostles and prophets, Christ Jesus himself being the chief cornerstone."
EPH	2	21	Narr_010: Ephesians	#19		8235	" {21} The whole building is in him, fitted together, grows into a holy temple in the Lord;"
