2TI	1	12	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8931	 I am persuaded that he is able to guard that which I have committed to him against that day.
2TI	1	13	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8932	" {13} Hold the pattern of sound words which you have heard from me, in faith and love which is in Christ Jesus."
2TI	1	14	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8933	" {14} That good thing which was committed to you, guard through the Holy Spirit who dwells in us."
2TI	1	15	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8934	" {15} This you know, that all who are in Asia turned away from me; of whom are Phygelus and Hermogenes."
2TI	1	16	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8935	" {16} May the Lord grant mercy to the house of Onesiphorus, for he often refreshed me, and was not ashamed of my chain."
2TI	1	17	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8936	" {17} But when he was in Rome, he sought me diligently, and found me."
2TI	1	18	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8937	" {18} When the Lord comes again may he show mercy to him. You know what a help he was to me in Ephesus.*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
2TI	2	<<	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8938	2 TIMOTHY CHP 2
2TI	2	1	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8939	" {1} You therefore, my child, be strengthened in the grace that is in Christ Jesus."
2TI	2	2	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8940	" {2} The things which you have heard from me among many witnesses, commit the same to faithful men, who will be able to teach others also."
2TI	2	3	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8941	" {3} You therefore must endure hardship, as a good soldier of Christ Jesus."
2TI	2	4	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8942	" {4} No soldier on duty entangles himself in the affairs of life, that he may please him who enrolled him as a soldier."
2TI	2	5	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8943	" {5} Also, if anyone competes in athletics, he isn't crowned unless he has competed by the rules."
2TI	2	6	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8944	 {6} The farmers who labor must be the first to get a share of the crops.
2TI	2	7	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8945	" {7} Consider what I say, and may the Lord give you understanding in all things."
2TI	2	8	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8946	" {8} Remember Jesus Christ, risen from the dead, of the seed of David, according to my Good News,"
2TI	2	9	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8947	 {9} in which I suffer hardship to the point of chains as a criminal. But God's word isn't chained.
2TI	2	10	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8948	" {10} Therefore I endure all things for the chosen ones' sake, that they also may obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory."
2TI	2	11	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8949	" {11} This saying is faithful: “For if we died with him, we will also live with him."
2TI	2	12	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8950	" {12} If we endure, we will also reign with him. If we deny him, he also will deny us."
2TI	2	13	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8951	" {13} If we are faithless, he remains faithful. He can't deny himself.”"
2TI	2	14	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8952	" {14} Remind them of these things, charging them in the sight of the Lord, that they don't argue about words."
2TI	2	14	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8953	" It is of no profit, subverting of those who hear."
2TI	2	15	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8954	" {15} Study to present yourself approved by God, a workman who doesn't need to be ashamed, properly handling the Word of Truth."
2TI	2	16	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8955	" {16} But shun empty chatter, for it will go further in ungodliness."
2TI	2	17	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8956	 {17} Their teaching will consume like gangrene. Hymenaeus and Philetus are like this.
2TI	2	18	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8957	" {18} They have turned from the truth, saying that the resurrection is already past, and overthrowing the faith of some."
2TI	2	19	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8958	" {19} However God's firm foundation stands, having this seal,"
2TI	2	19	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8959	" “The Lord knows those who are his,“ and, “Let every one who names the name of the Lord depart from unrighteousness.”"
2TI	2	20	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8960	" {20} Now in a large house there are not only vessels of gold and of silver, but also of wood and of clay. Some are for honor, and some for dishonor."
2TI	2	21	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8961	" {21} If anyone therefore purges himself from these, he will be a vessel for honor, sanctified."
2TI	2	21	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8962	" A vessel suitable for the master's use, prepared for every good work."
2TI	2	22	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8963	" {22} Flee from youthful lusts; but pursue righteousness, faith, love, and peace with those who call on the Lord out of a pure heart."
2TI	2	23	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8964	" {23} But refuse foolish and ignorant questionings, knowing that they generate strife."
2TI	2	24	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8965	" {24} The Lord's servant must not quarrel, but be gentle towards all, able to teach, and be patient."
2TI	2	25	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8966	 {25} In gentleness he must correct those who oppose him: perhaps God may give them repentance leading to a full knowledge of the truth.
2TI	2	26	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8967	" {26} Then they may recover themselves out of the devil's snare, having been taken captive by him to his will. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
2TI	3	<<	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8968	2 TIMOTHY CHP 3
2TI	3	1	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8969	" {1} But know this, that in the last days, grievous times will come."
2TI	3	2	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8970	" {2} For men will be lovers of self, lovers of money, boastful, arrogant, blasphemers, disobedient to parents, unthankful, unholy,"
2TI	3	3	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8971	" {3} without natural affection, unforgiving, slanderers, without self-control, fierce, no lovers of those that are good,"
2TI	3	4	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8972	" {4} traitors, headstrong, conceited, lovers of pleasure rather than lovers of God;"
2TI	3	5	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8973	" {5} holding a form of godliness, but having denied its power. Turn away from these, also."
2TI	3	6	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8974	" {6} For some of these are people who creep into houses, and take captive gullible women loaded down with sins, led away by various lusts."
2TI	3	7	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8975	" {7} Such women are always learning, but never able to come to the knowledge of the truth."
2TI	3	8	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8976	" {8} Even as Jannes and Jambres opposed Moses, so do these also oppose the truth; men corrupted in mind, who concerning the faith, are rejected."
2TI	3	9	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8977	" {9} But they will proceed no further. For their folly will be evident to all men, as theirs also came to be."
2TI	3	10	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8978	" {10} But you however know all about my teaching, conduct, purpose, faith, patience, love, steadfastness,"
2TI	3	11	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8979	" {11} persecutions, and sufferings: those things that happened to me at Antioch, Iconium, and Lystra."
2TI	3	11	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8980	 I endured those persecutions. Out of them all the Lord delivered me.
2TI	3	12	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8981	" {12} Yes, and all who desire to live godly in Christ Jesus will suffer persecution."
2TI	3	13	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8982	" {13} But evil men and impostors will grow worse and worse, deceiving and being deceived."
2TI	3	14	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8983	" {14} But you remain in the things which you have learned and have been assured of, knowing from whom you have learned them."
2TI	3	15	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8984	" {15} From infancy, you have known the holy Scriptures which are able to make you wise for salvation through faith, which is in Christ Jesus."
2TI	3	16	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8985	" {16} Every Scripture is God-breathed and profitable for teaching, for reproof, for correction, and for instruction in righteousness."
2TI	3	17	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8986	" {17} It gives the man of God everything he needs so that he will be complete, thoroughly equipped for every good work. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
2TI	4	<<	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8987	2 TIMOTHY CHP 4
2TI	4	1	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8988	" {1} I command you therefore before God and the Lord Jesus Christ, who will judge the living and the dead at his appearing and his Kingdom:"
2TI	4	2	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8989	" {2} Preach the word; be urgent in season and out of season; reprove, rebuke, and exhort, with all patience and teaching."
2TI	4	3	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8990	 {3} For the time will come when they will not listen to the sound doctrine.
2TI	4	3	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8991	" Having itching ears, will heap up for themselves teachers after their own lusts."
2TI	4	4	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8992	" {4} They will turn away their ears from the truth, and turn aside to fables."
2TI	4	5	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8993	" {5} But you be sober in all things, suffer hardship, do the work of an evangelist, and fulfill your ministry."
2TI	4	6	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8994	" {6} For I am already being offered, and the time of my departure has come."
2TI	4	7	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8995	 {7} I have fought the good fight. I have finished the course. I have kept the faith.
2TI	4	8	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8996	" {8} From now on, there is stored up for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous judge, will give to me on that day;"
2TI	4	8	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8997	" and not to me only, but also to all those who have loved his appearing."
2TI	4	9	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8998	" {9} Be diligent to come to me soon,"
2TI	4	10	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		8999	" {10} for Demas left me, having loved this present world, and went to Thessalonica; Crescens to Galatia, and Titus to Dalmatia."
2TI	4	11	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		9000	" {11} Only Luke is with me. Take Mark, and bring him with you, for he is useful to me for service."
2TI	4	12	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		9001	 {12} But I sent Tychicus to Ephesus.
2TI	4	13	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		9002	" {13} Bring the cloak that I left at Troas with Carpus when you come, and the books, especially the parchments."
2TI	4	14	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		9003	" {14} Alexander, the coppersmith, did much evil to me. The Lord will repay him according to his works."
2TI	4	15	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		9004	 {15} You also must beware of him; for he greatly opposed our words.
2TI	4	16	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		9005	" {16} At my first defense, no one came to help me, but all left me. May it not be held against them."
2TI	4	17	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		9006	" {17} But the Lord stood by me, and strengthened me, that through me the message might be fully proclaimed,"
2TI	4	17	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		9007	 and that all the Gentiles might hear; and I was delivered out of the mouth of the lion.
2TI	4	18	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		9008	" {18} And the Lord will deliver me from every evil work, and will preserve me for his heavenly Kingdom; to whom be the glory forever and ever. Amen."
2TI	4	19	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		9009	" {19} Greet Prisca and Aquila, and the house of Onesiphorus."
2TI	4	20	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		9010	" {20} Erastus remained at Corinth, but I left Trophimus at Miletus sick."
2TI	4	21	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		9011	" {21} Be diligent to come before winter. Eubulus salutes you, as do Pudens, Linus, Claudia, and all the brothers."
2TI	4	22	Narr_016: 2Timothy	#19		9012	" {22} The Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Grace be with you. Amen. *~**~*||| + 5 SECs |||*~*"
TTS	1	<<	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9013	"TITUS*~*TITUS CHP 1"
TTS	1	1	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9014	" {1} Paul, a servant of God, and an apostle of Jesus Christ."
TTS	1	1	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9015	" According to the faith of God's chosen ones, and the knowledge of the truth which is according to godliness."
TTS	1	2	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9016	" {2} This truth gives hope of eternal life, which God, who can't lie, promised before time began."
TTS	1	3	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9017	 {3} In his own time he revealed his word in the message with which I was entrusted according to the commandment of God our Savior;
TTS	1	4	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9018	" {4} to Titus, my true child according to a common faith: Grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Savior."
TTS	1	5	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9019	" {5} I left you in Crete for this reason, that you would set in order the things that were lacking, and appoint elders in every city, as I directed you."
TTS	1	6	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9020	" {6} An elder must be blameless, the husband of one wife, having children who believe and who are not accused of loose or unruly behavior."
TTS	1	7	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9021	" {7} For the overseer must be blameless, as God's steward;"
TTS	1	7	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9022	" not self-pleasing, not easily angered, not given to wine, not violent, not greedy for dishonest gain."
TTS	1	8	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9023	" {8} But rather, he must be given to hospitality, a lover of good, sober minded, fair, holy, self-controlled."
TTS	1	9	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9024	 {9} He must hold firmly to the trustworthy word which is according to the teaching.
TTS	1	9	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9025	" Able to exhort in the sound doctrine, and to convict those who contradict him."
TTS	1	10	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9026	" {10} For there are also many unruly men, vain talkers and deceivers, especially those of the circumcision."
TTS	1	11	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9027	" {11} Their mouths must be stopped because they overthrow whole houses, teaching things which they ought not, for dishonest gain's sake."
TTS	1	12	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9028	" {12} One of them, a prophet of their own, said, “Cretans are always liars, evil beasts, and idle gluttons.”"
TTS	1	13	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9029	" {13} This testimony is true. For this cause, reprove them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith,"
TTS	1	14	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9030	 {14} not paying attention to Jewish fables and commandments of men who turn away from the truth.
TTS	1	15	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9031	" {15} To the pure, all things are pure; but to those who are defiled and unbelieving, nothing is pure; but both their mind and their conscience are defiled."
TTS	1	16	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9032	" {16} They profess that they know God, but by their works they deny him, being abominable, disobedient, and unfit for any good work. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
TTS	2	<<	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9033	TITUS CHP 2
TTS	2	1	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9034	" {1} But say the things which fit sound doctrine,"
TTS	2	2	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9035	" {2} that older men should be temperate, sensible, sober minded, sound in faith, in love, and in patience."
TTS	2	3	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9036	" {3} Teach the older women likewise to be reverent in behavior, not slanderers nor enslaved to much wine, teachers of that which is good;"
TTS	2	4	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9037	" {4} Then they can train the young women to love their husbands, to love their children,"
TTS	2	5	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9038	" {5} to be sober minded, chaste, workers at home, kind, being in subjection to their own husbands, that God's word may not be blasphemed."
TTS	2	6	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9039	" {6} Likewise, exhort the younger men to be sober minded."
TTS	2	7	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9040	" {7} In all things be an example of good works; in your teaching show integrity, seriousness, incorruptibility,"
TTS	2	8	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9041	" {8} and soundness of speech that can't be condemned; that he who opposes you may be ashamed, having no evil thing to say about us."
TTS	2	9	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9042	" {9} Exhort servants to be in subjection to their own masters, and to be well-pleasing in all things; not contradicting;"
TTS	2	10	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9043	" {10} not stealing, but showing all good fidelity; that they may adorn the doctrine of God, our Savior, in all things."
TTS	2	11	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9044	" {11} For the grace of God has appeared, bringing salvation to all men."
TTS	2	12	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9045	" {12} It teaches us to say ""No"" to ungodliness and worldly lusts, so that we will live soberly, righteously, and godly in this present world."
TTS	2	13	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9046	" {13} We are to be looking for the blessed hope and appearing of the glory of our great God and Savior, Jesus Christ."
TTS	2	14	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9047	" {14} He gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and purify for himself a people for his own possession, zealous for good works."
TTS	2	15	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9048	" {15} Say these things and exhort and reprove with all authority. Let no man despise you. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
TTS	3	<<	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9049	TITUS CHP 3
TTS	3	1	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9050	" {1} Remind them to be in subjection to rulers and to authorities, to be obedient, to be ready for every good work."
TTS	3	2	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9051	" {2} They should speak evil of no one, and they should not be contentious. They should be gentle, showing all humility toward all men."
TTS	3	3	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9052	" {3} For we were also once foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving various lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful, and hating one another."
TTS	3	4	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9053	" {4} But when the kindness of God our Savior and his love toward mankind appeared,"
TTS	3	5	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9054	" {5} not by works of righteousness, which we did ourselves, but according to his mercy."
TTS	3	5	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9055	" He saved us, through the washing of regeneration and renewing by the Holy Spirit,"
TTS	3	6	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9056	" {6} He poured out his Holy Spirit on us richly, through Jesus Christ our Savior."
TTS	3	7	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9057	" {7} Because of this, we are justified by his grace, that we might be made heirs according to the hope of eternal life."
TTS	3	8	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9058	" {8} This saying is faithful, and concerning these things I desire that you affirm confidently,"
TTS	3	8	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9059	 so that those who have believed God may be careful to maintain good works. These things are good and profitable to men.
TTS	3	9	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9060	" {9} Shun foolish questionings, genealogies, strife, and disputes about the law; for they are unprofitable and vain."
TTS	3	10	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9061	" ||| DO NOT COMBINE |||*~*{Music--Ends before v10}*~**~* {10} Avoid a factious man after a first and second warning;"
TTS	3	11	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9062	" {11} knowing that such a one is perverted, and sins, being self-condemned."
TTS	3	12	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9063	" {12} When I send Artemas to you, or Tychicus, be diligent to come to me to Nicopolis, for I have determined to winter there."
TTS	3	13	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9064	" {13} Send Zenas, the lawyer, and Apollos on their journey speedily, that nothing may be lacking for them."
TTS	3	14	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9065	" {14} Let our people also learn to maintain good works for necessary uses, that they may not be unfruitful."
TTS	3	15	Narr_017: Titus	#19		9066	" {15} All who are with me greet you. Greet those who love us in faith. Grace be with you all. Amen. *~**~*||| + 5 SECs |||*~*"
PHM	1	<<	Narr_018: Philemon	#19		9067	"PHILEMON *~*PHILEMON CHP 1"
PHM	1	1	Narr_018: Philemon	#19		9068	" {1} Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother, to Philemon, our beloved fellow worker,"
PHM	1	2	Narr_018: Philemon	#19		9069	" {2} to the beloved Apphia, to Archippus, our fellow soldier, and to the assembly in your house:"
PHM	1	3	Narr_018: Philemon	#19		9070	 {3} Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
PHM	1	4	Narr_018: Philemon	#19		9071	" {4} I thank my God always, making mention of you in my prayers,"
PHM	1	5	Narr_018: Philemon	#19		9072	" {5} hearing of your love, and of the faith which you have toward the Lord Jesus, and toward all the saints;"
PHM	1	6	Narr_018: Philemon	#19		9073	" {6} that the fellowship of your faith may become effective, in the knowledge of every good thing which is in us in Christ Jesus."
PHM	1	7	Narr_018: Philemon	#19		9074	" {7} For we have much joy and comfort in your love, because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed through you, brother."
PHM	1	8	Narr_018: Philemon	#19		9075	" {8} Therefore though I have all boldness in Christ to command you that which is appropriate,"
PHM	1	9	Narr_018: Philemon	#19		9076	" {9} yet for love's sake I rather beg. I am Paul, an old man, here in prison because of Jesus Christ."
PHM	1	10	Narr_018: Philemon	#19		9077	" {10} I beg you for my child, whom I have become the father of in my chains, Onesimus,"
PHM	1	11	Narr_018: Philemon	#19		9078	" {11} who once was useless to you, but now is useful to you and to me."
PHM	1	12	Narr_018: Philemon	#19		9079	" {12} I am sending him back. Therefore receive him, that is, my own heart,"
PHM	1	13	Narr_018: Philemon	#19		9080	" {13} whom I desired to keep with me, that on your behalf he might serve me in my chains for the Good News."
PHM	1	14	Narr_018: Philemon	#19		9081	" {14} But I was willing to do nothing without your consent, that your goodness would not be as of necessity, but of free will."
PHM	1	15	Narr_018: Philemon	#19		9082	" {15} For perhaps he was therefore separated from you for a while, that you would have him forever."
PHM	1	16	Narr_018: Philemon	#19		9083	" {16} Do not think of him any longer as a slave, but more than a slave, a beloved brother."
PHM	1	16	Narr_018: Philemon	#19		9084	" Especially to me, but how much rather to you, both in the flesh and in the Lord."
PHM	1	17	Narr_018: Philemon	#19		9085	" {17} If then you count me a partner, receive him as you would receive me."
PHM	1	18	Narr_018: Philemon	#19		9086	" {18} But if he has wronged you at all, or owes you anything, put that to my account."
PHM	1	19	Narr_018: Philemon	#19		9087	" {19} I, Paul, write this with my own hand: I will repay it (not to mention to you that you owe to me even your own self besides)."
PHM	1	20	Narr_018: Philemon	#19		9088	" {20} Yes, brother, let me have joy from you in the Lord. Refresh my heart in the Lord."
PHM	1	21	Narr_018: Philemon	#19		9089	" {21} Having confidence in your obedience, I write to you, knowing that you will do even beyond what I say."
PHM	1	22	Narr_018: Philemon	#19		9090	" {22} Also, prepare a guest room for me, for I hope that through your prayers I will be restored to you."
PHM	1	23	Narr_018: Philemon	#19		9091	" {23} Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, greets you,"
PHM	1	24	Narr_018: Philemon	#19		9092	" {24} as do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, my fellow workers."
PHM	1	25	Narr_018: Philemon	#19		9093	" {25} The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen. *~**~*||| + 5 SECs |||*~*"
HEB	1	<<	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9094	"HEBREWS*~*HEBREWS CHP 1"
HEB	1	1	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9095	" {1} God has, in the past, spoken to the fathers through the prophets at many times and in various ways."
HEB	1	2	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9096	" {2} He has at the end of these days spoken to us by his Son, whom he appointed heir of all things, through whom also he made the worlds."
HEB	1	3	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9097	" {3} His Son is the radiance of his glory, the very image of his substance, and upholding all things by the word of his power."
HEB	1	3	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9098	" When he had by himself purged our sins, he sat down on the right hand of the Majesty on high."
HEB	1	4	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9099	" {4} The Son of God was made so much better than the angels, as he has inherited a more excellent name than they have."
HEB	1	5	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9100	" {5} For to which of the angels did he say at any time,"
HEB	1	5	God-FX1	#20		9101	" “You are my Son. Today I have become your father."""
HEB	1	5	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9102	" and again,"
HEB	1	5	God-FX1	#20		9103	" “I will be to him a Father, and he will be to me a Son.”"
HEB	1	6	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9104	" {6} Again, when he brings in the firstborn into the world he says,"
HEB	1	6	God-FX1	#20		9105	 “Let all the angels of God worship him.”
HEB	1	7	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9106	" {7} Of the angels he says,"
HEB	1	7	God-FX1	#20		9107	" “Who makes his angels winds, and his servants a flame of fire.”"
HEB	1	8	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9108	" {8} But of the Son he says,"
HEB	1	8	God-FX1	#20		9109	" “Your throne, O God, is forever and ever. The scepter of uprightness is the scepter of your Kingdom."
HEB	1	9	God-FX1	#20		9110	" {9} You have loved righteousness, and hated iniquity; therefore God, your God, has anointed you with the oil of gladness above your fellows.”"
HEB	1	10	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9111	" {10} And,"
HEB	1	10	God-FX1	#20		9112	" “You, Lord, in the beginning, laid the foundation of the earth. The heavens are the works of your hands."
HEB	1	11	God-FX1	#20		9113	" {11} They will perish, but you continue. They all will grow old like a garment does."
HEB	1	12	God-FX1	#20		9114	" {12} As a mantle, you will roll them up, and they will be changed; but you are the same. Your years will not fail.”"
HEB	1	13	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9115	" {13} But which of the angels has he told at any time,"
HEB	1	13	God-FX1	#20		9116	" “Sit at my right hand, until I make your enemies the footstool of your feet?”"
HEB	1	14	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9117	" {14} Aren't they all serving spirits, sent out to do service for the sake of those who will inherit salvation? *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
HEB	2	<<	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9118	HEBREWS CHP 2
HEB	2	1	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9119	" {1} Therefore we ought to pay greater attention to the things that were heard, lest perhaps we drift away."
HEB	2	2	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9120	" {2} For if the word spoken through angels proved steadfast, and every transgression and disobedience received a just recompense;"
HEB	2	3	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9121	 {3} how will we escape if we neglect so great a salvation?
HEB	2	3	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9122	" Salvation which at the first, having been spoken through the Lord, was confirmed to us by those who heard;"
HEB	2	4	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9123	" {4} God also testifying with them, both by signs and wonders, by various works of power, and by gifts of the Holy Spirit, according to his own will?"
HEB	2	5	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9124	" {5} For he didn't subject the world to come, of which we speak, to angels."
HEB	2	6	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9125	" {6} But one has somewhere testified, saying,"
HEB	2	6	Scripture Quote-FX1	#04		9126	" “What is man, that you think of him? Or the son of man, that you care for him?"
HEB	2	7	Scripture Quote-FX1	#04		9127	 {7} You made him a little lower than the angels. You crowned him with glory and honor; and did set him over the works of your hands.
HEB	2	8	Scripture Quote-FX1	#04		9128	 {8} You have put all things in subjection under his feet.”
HEB	2	8	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9129	" For in that he subjected all things to him, he left nothing that is not subject to him. But now we don't see all things subjected to him, yet."
HEB	2	9	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9130	" {9} But we see him who has been made a little lower than the angels, Jesus."
HEB	2	9	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9131	" Because of the suffering of death crowned with glory and honor, that by the grace of God he should taste of death for everyone."
HEB	2	10	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9132	" {10} For it became him, for whom are all things, and through whom are all things,"
HEB	2	10	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9133	" in bringing many children to glory, to make the author of their salvation perfect through sufferings."
HEB	2	11	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9134	" {11} For both he who sanctifies and those who are sanctified are all from one, for which cause he is not ashamed to call them brothers, {12} saying,"
HEB	2	12	Jesus-FX1	#07		9135	 “I will declare your name to my brothers. In the midst of the congregation I will sing your praise.”
HEB	2	13	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9136	" {13} Again,"
HEB	2	13	Jesus-FX1	#07		9137	 “I will put my trust in him.”
HEB	2	13	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9138	" Again,"
HEB	2	13	Jesus-FX1	#07		9139	" “Behold, here I am with the children whom God has given me.”"
HEB	2	14	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9140	" {14} Since then the children have shared in flesh and blood, he also himself in the same way partook of the same,"
HEB	2	14	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9141	" that through death he might bring to nothing him who had the power of death, that is, the devil."
HEB	2	15	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9142	" {15} People were like slaves all their lives because they were afraid of death. In dying, Jesus freed them."
HEB	2	16	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9143	" {16} For most certainly, he doesn't give help to angels, but he gives help to the seed of Abraham."
HEB	2	17	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9144	" {17} Therefore he was obligated in all things to be made like his brothers, that he might become a merciful and faithful high priest in things pertaining to God, to make atonement for the sins of the people."
HEB	2	18	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9145	" {18} For in that he himself has suffered being tempted, he is able to help those who are tempted. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
HEB	3	<<	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9146	HEBREWS CHP 3
HEB	3	1	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9147	" {1} Therefore, holy brothers, partakers of a heavenly calling, consider the Apostle and High Priest of our confession, Christ Jesus."
HEB	3	2	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9148	" {2} Jesus was faithful to him who appointed him, as also was Moses in all his house."
HEB	3	3	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9149	" {3} For he has been counted worthy of more glory than Moses, inasmuch as he who built the house has more honor than the house."
HEB	3	4	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9150	 {4} For every house is built by someone; but he who built all things is God.
HEB	3	5	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9151	" {5} Moses indeed was faithful in all his house as a servant, for a testimony of those things which were afterward to be spoken."
HEB	3	6	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9152	" {6} But Christ is faithful as a Son over his house; whose house we are, if we hold fast our confidence and the glorying of our hope firm to the end."
HEB	3	7	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9153	" {7} Therefore, even as the Holy Spirit says,"
HEB	3	7	Holy Spirit-FX1	#20		9154	" “Today if you will hear his voice, {8} don't harden your hearts, as in the rebellion, like as in the day of the trial in the wilderness."
HEB	3	9	Holy Spirit-FX1	#20		9155	" {9} Your fathers tested me by proving me, and saw my works for forty years."
HEB	3	10	Holy Spirit-FX1	#20		9156	" {10} Therefore I was displeased with that generation, and said, 'They always err in their heart, but they didn't know my ways.'"
HEB	3	11	Holy Spirit-FX1	#20		9157	" {11} I swore in my wrath, 'They will not enter into my rest.”"
HEB	3	12	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9158	" {12} Beware, brothers, lest perhaps there be in any one of you an evil heart of unbelief, in falling away from the living God."
HEB	3	13	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9159	" {13} Exhort one another day by day, so long as it is called “today“; lest any one of you be hardened by the deceitfulness of sin."
HEB	3	14	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9160	" {14} For we have become partakers of Christ, if we hold fast the beginning of our confidence firm to the end: {15} while it is said,"
HEB	3	15	Holy Spirit-FX1	#20		9161	" “Today if you will hear his voice, don't harden your hearts, as in the rebellion.”"
HEB	3	16	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9162	" {16} For who, when they heard, rebelled? No, didn't all those who came out of Egypt by Moses?"
HEB	3	17	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9163	" {17} With whom was he displeased forty years? Wasn't it with those who sinned, whose bodies fell in the wilderness?"
HEB	3	18	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9164	" {18} To whom did he swear that they wouldn't enter into his rest, but to those who were disobedient?"
HEB	3	19	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9165	" {19} We see that they were not able to enter in because of unbelief. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
HEB	4	<<	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9166	HEBREWS CHP 4
HEB	4	1	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9167	" {1} Let us fear therefore, lest perhaps anyone of you should seem to have come short of a promise of entering into his rest."
HEB	4	2	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9168	" {2} For indeed we have had good news preached to us, even as they also did, but the word they heard didn't profit them,"
HEB	4	2	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9169	 because it wasn't mixed with faith by those who heard.
HEB	4	3	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9170	" {3} For we who have believed do enter into that rest, even as he has said,"
HEB	4	3	Holy Spirit-FX1	#20		9171	" “As I swore in my wrath, they will not enter into my rest“"
HEB	4	3	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9172	 although the works were finished from the foundation of the world.
HEB	4	4	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9173	" {4} For he has said this somewhere about the seventh day,"
HEB	4	4	Holy Spirit-FX1	#20		9174	 “God rested on the seventh day from all his works“
HEB	4	5	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9175	" {5} and in this place again,"
HEB	4	5	Holy Spirit-FX1	#20		9176	 “They will not enter into my rest.”
HEB	4	6	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9177	 {6} Those who received the good news first did not obey. So they do not enter God's rest. Others may therefore still enter.
HEB	4	7	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9178	" {7} God again defines a certain day, today, saying through David so long a time afterward (just as has been said),"
HEB	4	7	Holy Spirit-FX1	#20		9179	" “Today if you will hear his voice, don't harden your hearts.”"
HEB	4	8	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9180	" {8} For if Joshua had given them rest, he would not have spoken afterward of another day."
HEB	4	9	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9181	 {9} There remains therefore a Sabbath rest for the people of God.
HEB	4	10	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9182	" {10} For he who has entered into his rest has himself also rested from his works, as God did from his."
HEB	4	11	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9183	" {11} Let us therefore give diligence to enter into that rest, lest anyone fall after the same example of disobedience."
HEB	4	12	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9184	" {12} For the word of God is living, and active, and sharper than any two-edged sword."
HEB	4	12	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9185	" It pierces even to the dividing of soul and spirit, of both joints and marrow, and is able to discern the thoughts and intentions of the heart."
HEB	4	13	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9186	" {13} There is no creature that is hidden from his sight, but all things are naked and laid open before the eyes of him with whom we have to do."
HEB	4	14	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9187	" {14} Having then a great high priest, who has passed through the heavens, Jesus, the Son of God, let us hold tightly to our confession."
HEB	4	15	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9188	 {15} For we don't have a high priest who can't be touched with the feeling of our infirmities.
HEB	4	15	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9189	" But one who has been in all points tempted like we are, yet without sin."
HEB	4	16	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9190	 {16} Let us therefore draw near with boldness to the throne of grace.
HEB	4	16	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9191	" So that we may receive mercy, and may find grace for help in time of need. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
HEB	5	<<	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9192	HEBREWS CHP 5
HEB	5	1	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9193	" {1} For every high priest, being taken from among men, is appointed for men in things pertaining to God, that he may offer both gifts and sacrifices for sins."
HEB	5	2	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9194	" {2} The high priest can deal gently with those who are ignorant and going astray, because he himself is also surrounded with weakness."
HEB	5	3	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9195	" {3} Because of this, he must offer sacrifices for sins for the people, as well as for himself."
HEB	5	4	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9196	" {4} Nobody takes this honor on himself, but he is called by God, just like Aaron was."
HEB	5	5	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9197	" {5} So also Christ didn't glorify himself to be made a high priest, but it was he who said to him,"
HEB	5	5	God-FX1	#20		9198	 “You are my Son. Today I have become your father.”
HEB	5	6	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9199	" {6} As he says also in another place,"
HEB	5	6	God-FX1	#20		9200	" “You are a priest forever, after the order of Melchizedek.”"
HEB	5	7	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9201	" {7} He, in the days of his flesh, offered up prayers and petitions with strong crying and tears."
HEB	5	7	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9202	" He prayed to him who was able to save him from death, and God heard him because Christ honored God."
HEB	5	8	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9203	" {8} Though he was God's Son, yet he learned obedience by the things which he suffered."
HEB	5	9	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9204	" {9} Having been made perfect, he became to all of those who obey him the author of eternal salvation,"
HEB	5	10	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9205	 {10} named by God a high priest after the order of Melchizedek.
HEB	5	11	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9206	" {11} About him we have many words to say, and hard to interpret, seeing you have become dull of hearing."
HEB	5	12	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9207	" {12} For although by this time you should be teachers, you again need to have someone teach you the rudiments of the first principles of the oracles of God."
HEB	5	12	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9208	" You have come to need milk, and not solid food."
HEB	5	13	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9209	" {13} For everyone who lives on milk is not experienced in the word of righteousness, for he is a baby."
HEB	5	14	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9210	" {14} But solid food is for those who are full grown, who by reason of use have their senses exercised to discern good and evil. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
HEB	6	<<	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9211	HEBREWS CHP 6
HEB	6	1	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9212	" {1} Therefore leaving the teaching of the first principles of Christ, let us press on to perfection--"
HEB	6	1	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9213	" Let us not lay again the foundation of repentance from dead works, of faith toward God,"
HEB	6	2	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9214	" {2} of the teaching of baptisms, of laying on of hands, of resurrection of the dead, and of eternal judgment."
HEB	6	3	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9215	" {3} This will we do, if God permits."
HEB	6	4	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9216	 {4} Consider the case of those who have fallen back into their former lives: they were illuminated by the light of God.
HEB	6	4	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9217	 They tasted the gift from heaven and they received the Holy Spirit.
HEB	6	5	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9218	" {5} They loved the beautiful word of God, they felt the powerful forces of the world to come."
HEB	6	6	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9219	 {6} And yet they have fallen back into their old life. It is impossible for these people to be brought back to repentance.
HEB	6	6	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9220	" They have nailed the Son of God on the cross again, and have subjected him to public disgrace."
HEB	6	7	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9221	" {7} For the land which has drunk the rain that comes often on it,"
HEB	6	7	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9222	" and brings forth a crop suitable for them for whose sake it is also tilled, receives blessing from God."
HEB	6	8	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9223	" {8} But if it bears thorns and thistles, it is rejected and in danger of being cursed. In the end, it will be burned."
HEB	6	9	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9224	" {9} But, beloved, we are persuaded of better things for you, and things that accompany salvation, even though we speak like this."
HEB	6	10	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9225	" {10} For God is not unrighteous, so as to forget your work and the labor of love which you showed toward his name."
HEB	6	10	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9226	" You served the saints, and still do serve them."
HEB	6	11	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9227	 {11} We desire that each one of you may show the same diligence to the fullness of hope even to the end.
HEB	6	12	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9228	" {12} We do not want you to be sluggish, but rather, imitators of those who through faith and patience inherited the promises."
HEB	6	13	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9229	" {13} For when God made a promise to Abraham, since he could swear by none greater, he swore by himself, {14} saying,"
HEB	6	14	God-FX1	#20		9230	 “Surely I will bless you and I will multiply you.”
HEB	6	15	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9231	" {15} Thus, having patiently endured, he obtained the promise."
HEB	6	16	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9232	" {16} For men indeed swear by a greater one, and in every dispute of theirs the oath is final for confirmation."
HEB	6	17	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9233	" {17} In this way God, being determined to show more abundantly to the heirs of the promise the immutability of his counsel, interposed with an oath;"
HEB	6	18	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9234	" {18} that by two immutable things, in which it is impossible for God to lie, we may have a strong encouragement."
HEB	6	18	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9235	 We have fled for refuge to take hold of the hope set before us.
HEB	6	19	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9236	" {19} This hope we have as an anchor of the soul, a hope both sure and steadfast and entering into hat which is within the veil."
HEB	6	20	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9237	" {20} Jesus has already entered for us, having become a high priest forever after the order of Melchizedek. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
HEB	7	<<	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9238	HEBREWS CHP 7
HEB	7	1	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9239	" {1} For this Melchizedek was king of Salem, priest of God Most High. He met Abraham returning from the slaughter of the kings and blessed him."
HEB	7	2	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9240	 {2} Abraham divided and gave to Melchizedek a tenth part of all
HEB	7	2	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9241	" (being first, by interpretation, king of righteousness, and then also king of Salem, which is king of peace."
HEB	7	3	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9242	" {3} Melchizedek was without father, without mother, and without a genealogy."
HEB	7	3	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9243	" He has neither beginning of days nor end of life. Like the Son of God, he remains a priest forever."
HEB	7	4	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9244	" {4} Now consider how great this man was, to whom even Abraham, the patriarch, gave a tenth out of the best spoils."
HEB	7	5	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9245	 {5} They indeed of the sons of Levi who receive the priest's office have a commandment to take tithes of the people according to the law.
HEB	7	5	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9246	" That is, of their brothers, though these have come out of the body of Abraham."
HEB	7	6	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9247	" {6} Melchizedek, whose genealogy is not counted from them, has accepted tithes from Abraham and has blessed him who has the promises."
HEB	7	7	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9248	 {7} But without any dispute the lesser is blessed by the greater.
HEB	7	8	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9249	" {8} Here people who die receive tithes, but there one receives tithes of whom it is testified that he lives."
HEB	7	9	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9250	" {9} We can say that through Abraham even Levi, who receives tithes, has paid tithes."
HEB	7	10	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9251	 {10} We can say this because he was yet in the body of his father when Melchizedek met him.
HEB	7	11	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9252	" {11} Now if there were perfection through the Levitical priesthood (for under it the people have received the law),"
HEB	7	11	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9253	" what further need was there for another priest to arise after the order of Melchizedek, and not be called after the order of Aaron?"
HEB	7	12	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9254	" {12} For the priesthood being changed, there is of necessity a change made also in the law."
HEB	7	13	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9255	" {13} For he of whom these things are said belongs to another tribe, from which no one has officiated at the altar."
HEB	7	14	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9256	" {14} For it is evident that our Lord has sprung out of Judah, about which tribe Moses spoke nothing concerning priesthood."
HEB	7	15	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9257	" {15} Here is why things are even clearer: another priest came, and he looks like Melchizedek."
HEB	7	16	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9258	 {16} It is not a priest according to a rule and according to human commandments. He became a priest by the power of a life that can not end.
HEB	7	17	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9259	" {17} It is true, the Holy Scriptures say:"
HEB	7	17	God-FX1	#20		9260	" “You are a priest forever, according to the order of Melchizedek.”"
HEB	7	18	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9261	 {18} God put aside the previous law of Moses because it was weak and useless.
HEB	7	19	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9262	" {19} (For the law made nothing perfect), and a bringing in of a better hope, through which we draw near to God."
HEB	7	20	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9263	 {20} Inasmuch as he was not made priest without the taking of an oath.
HEB	7	21	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9264	" {21} (They indeed have been made priests without an oath), but he with an oath by him that says of him,"
HEB	7	21	God-FX1	#20		9265	" “The Lord swore and will not change his mind, 'You are a priest forever, according to the order of Melchizedek.”"
HEB	7	22	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9266	" {22} By so much, Jesus has become the collateral of a better covenant."
HEB	7	23	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9267	" {23} Many, indeed, have been made priests, because they are hindered from continuing by death."
HEB	7	24	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9268	" {24} But he, because he lives forever, has his priesthood unchangeable."
HEB	7	25	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9269	" {25} Therefore he is also able to save to the uttermost those who draw near to God through him,"
HEB	7	25	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9270	 seeing that he lives forever to make intercession for them.
HEB	7	26	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9271	" {26} For such a high priest was fitting for us: holy, guiltless, undefiled, separated from sinners, and made higher than the heavens;"
HEB	7	27	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9272	" {27} who doesn't need, like those high priests, to offer up sacrifices daily, first for his own sins, and then for the sins of the people."
HEB	7	27	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9273	" For he did this once for all, when he offered up himself."
HEB	7	28	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9274	" {28} For the law appoints men as high priests who have weakness,"
HEB	7	28	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9275	" but the word of the oath which came after the law appoints a Son forever who has been perfected. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
HEB	8	<<	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9276	HEBREWS CHP 8
HEB	8	1	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9277	" {1} Now in the things which we are saying, the main point is this."
HEB	8	1	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9278	" We have such a high priest, who sat down on the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens."
HEB	8	2	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9279	" {2} He is a servant of the sanctuary, and of the true tabernacle, which the Lord pitched, not man."
HEB	8	3	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9280	 {3} For every high priest is appointed to offer both gifts and sacrifices.
HEB	8	3	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9281	 Therefore it is necessary that this high priest also have something to offer.
HEB	8	4	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9282	" {4} For if he were on earth, he would not be a priest at all, seeing there are priests who offer the gifts according to the law."
HEB	8	5	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9283	" {5} They serve a copy and shadow of the heavenly things, even as Moses was warned by God when he was about to make the tabernacle, for he said,"
HEB	8	5	God-FX1	#20		9284	" “See, you shall make everything according to the pattern that was shown to you on the mountain.”"
HEB	8	6	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9285	" {6} But now he has obtained a more excellent ministry, by so much as he is also the mediator of a better covenant."
HEB	8	6	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9286	 A better covenant which on better promises has been given as law.
HEB	8	7	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9287	" {7} For if that first covenant had been faultless, then no place would have been sought for a second."
HEB	8	8	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9288	" {8} For finding fault with them, he said,"
HEB	8	8	God-FX1	#20		9289	" “Behold, the days come,“ says the Lord, “that I will make a new covenant with the house of Israel and with the house of Judah."
HEB	8	9	God-FX1	#20		9290	" {9} It will not be according to the covenant that I made with their fathers, in the day that I took them by the hand to lead them out of the land of Egypt;"
HEB	8	9	God-FX1	#20		9291	" for they didn't continue in my covenant, and I disregarded them,“ says the Lord."
HEB	8	10	God-FX1	#20		9292	" {10} “For this is the covenant that I will make with the house of Israel. After those days,“ says the Lord;"
HEB	8	10	God-FX1	#20		9293	" “I will put my laws into their mind, I will also write them on their heart. I will be their God, and they will be my people."
HEB	8	11	God-FX1	#20		9294	" {11} They will not teach every man his fellow citizen, and every man his brother, saying, 'Know the Lord.'"
HEB	8	11	God-FX1	#20		9295	" All will know me, from their least to their greatest."
HEB	8	12	God-FX1	#20		9296	 {12} For I will be merciful to their unrighteousness. I will remember their sins and lawless deeds no more.”
HEB	8	13	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9297	" {13} In that he says, “A new covenant,“ he has made the first old."
HEB	8	13	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9298	" But that which is becoming old and grows aged is near to vanishing away. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
HEB	9	<<	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9299	HEBREWS CHP 9
HEB	9	1	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9300	" {1} Now indeed even the first covenant had ordinances of divine service, and an earthly sanctuary."
HEB	9	2	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9301	" {2} For a tabernacle was prepared. In the first part were the lampstand, the table, and the show bread; which is called the Holy Place."
HEB	9	3	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9302	 {3} After the second veil was the tabernacle which is called the Holy of Holies.
HEB	9	4	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9303	" {4} In the Holy of Holies was a golden altar of incense, and the ark of the covenant overlaid on all sides with gold."
HEB	9	4	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9304	" In this ark was a golden pot holding the manna, Aaron's rod that budded, and the tablets of the covenant."
HEB	9	5	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9305	" {5} Above the ark were the cherubim of glory overshadowing the mercy seat, but we cannot discuss these things in detail now."
HEB	9	6	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9306	" {6} Now these things having been thus prepared, the priests go in continually into the first tabernacle, accomplishing the services."
HEB	9	7	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9307	" {7} But into the second, the high priest enters alone, once a year,"
HEB	9	7	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9308	" and never without blood which he offers for himself, and for the sins of the people."
HEB	9	8	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9309	" {8} The Holy Spirit is indicating this, that the way into the Holy Place wasn't yet revealed while the first tabernacle was still standing."
HEB	9	9	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9310	 {9} This is a symbol of the present age.
HEB	9	9	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9311	" Where gifts and sacrifices are offered that are incapable, concerning the conscience, of making the worshipper perfect."
HEB	9	10	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9312	" {10} They are only (with meats and drinks and various washings) fleshly ordinances, imposed until a time of reformation."
HEB	9	11	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9313	 {11} But Christ came as a high priest of the good things God promised. He made the way for man to go to God.
HEB	9	11	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9314	 He was a greater and more perfect tent (Tabernacle). He was not made by human hands and he was not a part of this earth.
HEB	9	12	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9315	 {12} Christ went into the Most Holy Place one time for all people. He did not take the blood of goats and young cows to give to God as a gift in worship.
HEB	9	12	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9316	 He gave his own blood. Thus he bought us with his own blood and made us free from sin forever.
HEB	9	13	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9317	" {13} The blood of goats and bulls, and the ashes of a heifer sprinkling those who have been defiled, sanctify them so they are outwardly clean."
HEB	9	14	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9318	" {14} How much more then will the blood of Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered himself without blemish to God,"
HEB	9	14	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9319	 cleanse your conscience from dead works to serve the living God?
HEB	9	15	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9320	" {15} For this reason he is the mediator of a new covenant, since a death has occurred for the redemption of the transgressions that were under the first covenant."
HEB	9	15	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9321	 That those who have been called may receive the promise of the eternal inheritance.
HEB	9	16	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9322	" {16} For where a last will and testament is, there must of necessity be the death of him who made it."
HEB	9	17	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9323	" {17} For a will is in force where there has been death, for it is never in force while he who made it lives."
HEB	9	18	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9324	 {18} Therefore even the first covenant has not been dedicated without blood.
HEB	9	19	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9325	" {19} For when every commandment had been spoken by Moses to all the people according to the law,"
HEB	9	19	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9326	" he took the blood of the calves and the goats, with water and scarlet wool and hyssop, and sprinkled both the book itself and all the people, {20} saying,"
HEB	9	20	Moses-FX1	#03		9327	 “This is the blood of the covenant which God has commanded you.”
HEB	9	21	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9328	 {21} Moreover he sprinkled the tabernacle and all the vessels of the ministry in the same way with the blood.
HEB	9	22	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9329	" {22} According to the law, nearly everything is cleansed with blood, and apart from shedding of blood there is no remission."
HEB	9	23	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9330	 {23} It was necessary therefore that the copies of the things in the heavens should be cleansed with these;
HEB	9	23	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9331	 but the heavenly things themselves with better sacrifices than these.
HEB	9	24	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9332	" {24} For Christ hasn't entered into holy places made with hands, which are representations of the true,"
HEB	9	24	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9333	" but into heaven itself, now to appear in the presence of God for us."
HEB	9	25	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9334	" {25} Nor did he enter heaven to offer himself again and again, as the high priest enters into the holy place year by year with blood not his own."
HEB	9	26	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9335	 {26} Then Christ would have had to suffer many times since the foundation of the world.
HEB	9	26	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9336	" But now once at the end of the ages, he has been revealed to put away sin by the sacrifice of himself."
HEB	9	27	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9337	" {27} It is appointed for all men to die once, and after this, judgment."
HEB	9	28	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9338	 {28} It is the same with Christ also. He was offered once to bear the sins of many.
HEB	9	28	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9339	" He will come a second time, without sin, to those who are eagerly waiting for him for salvation. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
HEB	10	<<	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9340	HEBREWS CHP 10
HEB	10	1	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9341	" {1} For the law, having a shadow of the good to come, not the very image of the things,"
HEB	10	1	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9342	" can never with the same sacrifices year by year, which they offer continually, make perfect those who draw near."
HEB	10	2	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9343	" {2} Or else wouldn't they have ceased to be offered, because the worshippers, having been once cleansed, would have had no more consciousness of sins?"
HEB	10	3	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9344	 {3} But in those sacrifices there is a yearly reminder of sins.
HEB	10	4	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9345	 {4} For it is impossible that the blood of bulls and goats should take away sins.
HEB	10	5	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9346	" {5} Therefore when he comes into the world, he says,"
HEB	10	5	Jesus-FX1	#07		9347	" “Sacrifice and offering you didn't desire, but you prepared a body for me;"
HEB	10	6	Jesus-FX1	#07		9348	 {6} You had no pleasure in whole burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin.
HEB	10	7	Jesus-FX1	#07		9349	" {7} Then I said, 'Behold, I have come (in the scroll of the book it is written of me) to do your will, O God.”"
HEB	10	8	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9350	" {8} Previously saying,"
HEB	10	8	Jesus-FX1	#07		9351	" “Sacrifices and offerings and whole burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin you didn't desire, neither had pleasure in them“"
HEB	10	8	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9352	" (although the law required them to be made), {9} then he has said,"
HEB	10	9	Jesus-FX1	#07		9353	" “Behold, I have come to do your will.”"
HEB	10	9	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9354	" He takes away the first, that he may establish the second."
HEB	10	10	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9355	" {10} By that sacrifice, we have been sanctified through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once for all."
HEB	10	11	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9356	" {11} Every priest indeed stands day by day serving and often offering the same sacrifices, which can never take away sins."
HEB	10	12	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9357	" {12} But he, when he had offered one sacrifice for sins forever, sat down on the right hand of God."
HEB	10	13	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9358	 {13} Since that time he waits until his enemies are made the footstool of his feet.
HEB	10	14	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9359	 {14} For by one offering he has perfected forever those who are being sanctified.
HEB	10	15	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9360	" {15} The Holy Spirit also testifies to us, for after saying,"
HEB	10	16	Holy Spirit-FX1	#20		9361	 {16} “This is the covenant that I will make with them:
HEB	10	16	Holy Spirit-FX1	#20		9362	" 'After those days,' says the Lord, 'I will put my laws on their heart, I will also write them on their mind;”"
HEB	10	17	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9363	" {17} then he says,"
HEB	10	17	Holy Spirit-FX1	#20		9364	 “I will remember their sins and their iniquities no more.”
HEB	10	18	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9365	" {18} Now where remission of these is, there is no more offering for sin."
HEB	10	19	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9366	" {19} Having therefore, brothers, boldness to enter into the holy place by the blood of Jesus."
HEB	10	20	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9367	" {20} We now come to God by the way which he dedicated for us, a new and living way, through the veil, that is to say, his flesh."
HEB	10	21	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9368	 {21} We have a great priest over God's house.
HEB	10	22	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9369	" {22} Therefore, let's draw near with a true heart in fullness of faith, having our hearts sprinkled from an evil conscience, and having our body washed with pure water."
HEB	10	23	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9370	 {23} Let us hold fast the confession of our hope without wavering; for he who promised is faithful.
HEB	10	24	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9371	" {24} Let us consider how to provoke one another to love and good works,"
HEB	10	25	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9372	" {25} not forsaking our own assembling together, as the custom of some is, but exhorting one another; and so much the more, as you see the Day approaching."
HEB	10	26	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9373	" {26} For if we sin willfully after we have received the knowledge of the truth, there remains no more a sacrifice for sins."
HEB	10	27	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9374	 {27} Instead their will be a certain fearful expectation of judgment and a fierceness of fire which will devour the adversaries.
HEB	10	28	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9375	 {28} A man who disregards Moses' law dies without compassion on the word of two or three witnesses.
HEB	10	29	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9376	" {29} How much worse punishment, do you think, will he be judged worthy of, who has trodden under foot the Son of God?"
HEB	10	29	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9377	" And who has counted the blood of the covenant with which he was sanctified an unholy thing, and has insulted the Spirit of grace?"
HEB	10	30	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9378	" {30} For we know him who said,"
HEB	10	30	God-FX1	#20		9379	" “Vengeance belongs to me,“ says the Lord, “I will repay.”"
HEB	10	30	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9380	" Again,"
HEB	10	30	God-FX1	#20		9381	 “The Lord will judge his people.”
HEB	10	31	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9382	 {31} It is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God.
HEB	10	32	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9383	" {32} But remember the former days, in which, after you were enlightened, you endured a great struggle with sufferings."
HEB	10	33	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9384	" {33} People laughed at you and beat you. When others suffered, you suffered with them."
HEB	10	34	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9385	 {34} For you both had compassion on me in my chains.
HEB	10	34	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9386	" You joyfully accepted the plundering of your possessions, knowing that you have for yourselves a better possession and an enduring one in heaven."
HEB	10	35	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9387	" {35} Therefore don't throw away your boldness, which has a great reward."
HEB	10	36	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9388	" {36} For you need endurance so that, having done the will of God, you may receive the promise. {37} Because,"
HEB	10	37	God-FX1	#20		9389	" “In a very little while, he who comes will come, and will not wait."
HEB	10	38	God-FX1	#20		9390	" {38} But the righteous will live by faith. If he shrinks back, my soul has no pleasure in him.”"
HEB	10	39	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9391	" {39} But we are not of those who shrink back to destruction, but of those who have faith to the saving of the soul. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
HEB	11	<<	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9392	HEBREWS CHP 11
HEB	11	1	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9393	" {1} Now faith is assurance of things hoped for, proof of things not seen."
HEB	11	2	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9394	" {2} For by this, the elders obtained testimony."
HEB	11	3	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9395	" {3} By faith, we understand that the universe has been framed by the word of God, so that what is seen has not been made out of things which are visible."
HEB	11	4	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9396	" {4} By faith, Abel offered to God a more excellent sacrifice than Cain, through which he had testimony given to him that he was righteous,"
HEB	11	4	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9397	" God testifying with respect to his gifts; and through it he, being dead, still speaks."
HEB	11	5	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9398	" {5} By faith, Enoch was taken away, so that he wouldn't see death, and he was not found, because God translated him."
HEB	11	5	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9399	 For he has had testimony given to him that before his translation he had been well pleasing to God.
HEB	11	6	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9400	 {6} Without faith it is impossible to be well pleasing to him.
HEB	11	6	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9401	" He who comes to God must believe that he exists, and that he is a rewarder of those who seek him."
HEB	11	7	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9402	" {7} By faith, Noah, being warned about things not yet seen, moved with godly fear."
HEB	11	7	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9403	" He prepared a ship for the saving of his house, through which he condemned the world, and became heir of the righteousness which is according to faith."
HEB	11	8	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9404	" {8} By faith, Abraham, when he was called, obeyed to go out to the place which he was to receive for an inheritance. He went out, not knowing where he went."
HEB	11	9	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9405	" {9} By faith, he lived as an alien in the land of promise, as in a land not his own,"
HEB	11	9	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9406	" dwelling in tents, with Isaac and Jacob, the heirs with him of the same promise."
HEB	11	10	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9407	" {10} For he looked for the city which has the foundations, whose builder and maker is God."
HEB	11	11	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9408	" {11} By faith, even Sarah herself received power to conceive, and she bore a child when she was past age, since she counted him faithful who had promised."
HEB	11	12	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9409	" {12} Therefore as many as the stars of the sky in multitude, and as innumerable as the sand which is by the sea shore, were fathered by one man, and him as good as dead."
HEB	11	13	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9410	" {13} These all died in faith, not having received the promises, but having seen them and embraced them from afar."
HEB	11	13	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9411	 They confessed that they were strangers and pilgrims on the earth.
HEB	11	14	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9412	 {14} For those who say such things make it clear that they are seeking a country of their own.
HEB	11	15	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9413	" {15} If indeed they had been thinking of that country from which they went out, they would have had enough time to return."
HEB	11	16	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9414	" {16} But now they desire a better country, that is, a heavenly one."
HEB	11	16	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9415	" Therefore God is not ashamed of them, to be called their God, for he has prepared a city for them."
HEB	11	17	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9416	" {17} By faith, Abraham, being tested, offered up Isaac. Yes, he who had gladly received the promises was offering up his one and only son;"
HEB	11	18	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9417	" {18} even he to whom it was said,"
HEB	11	18	God-FX1	#20		9418	 “In Isaac will your seed be called“
HEB	11	19	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9419	" {19} concluding that God is able to raise up even from the dead. Figuratively speaking, he also did receive him back from the dead."
HEB	11	20	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9420	" {20} By faith, Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau, even concerning things to come."
HEB	11	21	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9421	" {21} By faith, Jacob, when he was dying, blessed each of the sons of Joseph, and worshiped, leaning on the top of his staff."
HEB	11	22	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9422	" {22} By faith, Joseph, when his end was near, made mention of the departure of the children of Israel; and gave instructions concerning his bones."
HEB	11	23	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9423	" {23} By faith, Moses, when he was born, was hidden for three months by his parents."
HEB	11	23	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9424	" They saw that he was a beautiful child, and they were not afraid of the king's commandment."
HEB	11	24	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9425	" {24} By faith, Moses, when he had grown up, refused to be called the son of Pharaoh's daughter."
HEB	11	25	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9426	" {25} He choose rather to share ill treatment with God's people, than to enjoy the pleasures of sin for a time;"
HEB	11	26	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9427	 {26} accounting the reproach of Christ greater riches than the treasures of Egypt; for he looked to the reward.
HEB	11	27	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9428	" {27} By faith, he left Egypt, not fearing the wrath of the king; for he endured, as seeing him who is invisible."
HEB	11	28	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9429	" {28} By faith, he kept the Passover, and the sprinkling of the blood, that the destroyer of the firstborn should not touch them."
HEB	11	29	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9430	" {29} By faith, they passed through the Red Sea as on dry land. When the Egyptians tried to do so, they were swallowed up."
HEB	11	30	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9431	" {30} By faith, the walls of Jericho fell down, after they had been encircled for seven days."
HEB	11	31	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9432	" {31} By faith, Rahab the prostitute, didn't perish with those who were disobedient, having received the spies in peace."
HEB	11	32	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9433	" {32} What more shall I say? For the time would fail me if I told of Gideon, Barak, Samson, Jephthah, David, Samuel, and the prophets."
HEB	11	33	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9434	" {33} These people through faith subdued kingdoms, worked out righteousness, obtained promises, and stopped the mouths of lions."
HEB	11	34	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9435	" {34} They quenched the power of fire, escaped the edge of the sword, from weakness they were made strong. They grew mighty in war and caused foreign armies to flee."
HEB	11	35	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9436	" {35} Women received their dead by resurrection. Others were tortured, not accepting their deliverance, that they might obtain a better resurrection."
HEB	11	36	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9437	" {36} Others were tried by mocking and scourging, yes, moreover by bonds and imprisonment."
HEB	11	37	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9438	 {37} They were stoned. They were sawn apart. They were tempted. They were slain with the sword.
HEB	11	37	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9439	" They went around in sheep skins and in goat skins; being destitute, afflicted, and ill-treated."
HEB	11	38	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9440	" {38} (The world was not worthy of them.) They wandered in deserts, mountains, caves, and the holes of the earth."
HEB	11	39	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9441	" {39} These all, having had testimony given to them through their faith, didn't receive the promise."
HEB	11	40	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9442	" {40} God had planned something better for us so that only together with us would they be made perfect. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
HEB	12	<<	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9443	HEBREWS CHP 12
HEB	12	1	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9444	" {1} Therefore let us also, seeing we are surrounded by so great a cloud of witnesses, lay aside every weight and the sin which so easily entangles us."
HEB	12	1	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9445	 Let us run with patience the race that is set before us.
HEB	12	2	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9446	" {2} Let us look to Jesus, the author and perfecter of faith."
HEB	12	2	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9447	" Who for the joy that was set before him endured the cross, despising its shame, and has sat down at the right hand of the throne of God."
HEB	12	3	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9448	" {3} For consider him who has endured such contradiction of sinners against himself, that you don't grow weary, fainting in your souls."
HEB	12	4	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9449	" {4} In your struggle against sin, you have not yet resisted to the point of shedding your blood."
HEB	12	5	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9450	" {5} You have forgotten that word of encouragement that addresses you as sons,"
HEB	12	5	Scripture Quote-FX1	#04		9451	" “My son, don't take lightly the chastening of the Lord, nor faint when you are reproved by him;"
HEB	12	6	Scripture Quote-FX1	#04		9452	" {6} For whom the Lord loves, he chastens, and scourges every son whom he receives.”"
HEB	12	7	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9453	" {7} It is for discipline that you endure. God deals with you as with children, for what son is there whom his father doesn't discipline?"
HEB	12	8	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9454	" {8} But if you are without discipline, of which all have been made partakers, then are you illegitimate, and not children."
HEB	12	9	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9455	" {9} Furthermore, we had the fathers of our flesh to chasten us, and we paid them respect."
HEB	12	9	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9456	" Shall we not much rather be in subjection to the Father of spirits, and live?"
HEB	12	10	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9457	" {10} For they indeed, for a few days, punished us as seemed good to them; but he for our profit, that we may be partakers of his holiness."
HEB	12	11	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9458	 {11} All chastening seems for the present to be not joyous but grievous;
HEB	12	11	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9459	 yet afterward it yields the peaceful fruit of righteousness to those who have been exercised thereby.
HEB	12	12	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9460	 {12} Therefore lift up the hands that hang down and the feeble knees.
HEB	12	13	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9461	" {13} Make straight paths for your feet, so that that which is lame may not be dislocated, but rather be healed."
HEB	12	14	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9462	" {14} Follow after peace with all men, and the sanctification without which no man will see the Lord."
HEB	12	15	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9463	" {15} Look carefully lest there be any man who falls short of the grace of God; lest any root of bitterness springing up trouble you, and many be defiled by it."
HEB	12	16	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9464	" {16} See that no one is sexually immoral, or is godless like Esau, who sold his birthright for one meal."
HEB	12	17	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9465	" {17} For you know that even when he afterward desired to inherit the blessing, he was rejected."
HEB	12	17	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9466	 He found no place for a change of mind though he sought it diligently with tears.
HEB	12	18	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9467	" {18} You did not come to a mountain that you could touch: there was no bonfire, no darkness, no night, no storm."
HEB	12	19	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9468	 {19} You did not hear the sound of the trumpet or the sound of words. The Israelites who heard this noise refused to listen to another word.
HEB	12	20	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9469	 {20} They could not withstand this order:
HEB	12	20	God-FX1	#20		9470	" “If even an animal touches the mountain, it shall be stoned,"""
HEB	12	21	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9471	" {21} and so fearful was the appearance, that Moses said,"
HEB	12	21	Moses-FX1	#03		9472	 “I am terrified and trembling.”
HEB	12	22	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9473	" {22} But you have come to Mount Zion, and to the city of the living God, the heavenly Jerusalem, and to innumerable multitudes of angels,"
HEB	12	23	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9474	" {23} to the general assembly and assembly of the firstborn who are enrolled in heaven, to God the Judge of all, to the spirits of just men made perfect,"
HEB	12	24	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9475	" {24} to Jesus, the mediator of a new covenant, and to the blood of sprinkling that speaks better than that of Abel."
HEB	12	25	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9476	 {25} See that you don't refuse him who speaks.
HEB	12	25	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9477	" For if they didn't escape when they refused him who warned on the earth, how much more will we not escape who turn away from him who warns from heaven."
HEB	12	26	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9478	" {26} His voice shook the earth then, but now he has promised, saying,"
HEB	12	26	God-FX1	#20		9479	" “Yet once more I will shake not only the earth, but also the heavens.”"
HEB	12	27	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9480	" {27} This phrase, “Yet once more,“ signifies the removing of those things that are shaken, as of things that have been made, that those things which are not shaken may remain."
HEB	12	28	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9481	" {28} Therefore, receiving a Kingdom that can't be shaken, let us have grace, through which we serve God acceptably, with reverence and awe,"
HEB	12	29	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9482	" {29} for our God is a consuming fire. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
HEB	13	<<	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9483	HEBREWS CHP 13
HEB	13	1	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9484	 {1} Let brotherly love continue.
HEB	13	2	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9485	" {2} Don't forget to show hospitality to strangers, for in doing so, some have entertained angels without knowing it."
HEB	13	3	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9486	" {3} Remember those who are in bonds, as bound with them; and those who are ill-treated, since you are also in the body."
HEB	13	4	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9487	" {4} Let marriage be held in honor among all, and let the bed be undefiled: but God will judge the sexually immoral and adulterers."
HEB	13	5	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9488	" {5} Be free from the love of money, content with such things as you have, for he has said,"
HEB	13	5	God-FX1	#20		9489	" “I will in no way leave you, neither will I in any way forsake you.”"
HEB	13	6	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9490	" {6} So that with good courage we say,"
HEB	13	6	Man	#06		9491	 “The Lord is my helper. I will not fear. What can man do to me?”
HEB	13	7	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9492	" {7} Remember your leaders, men who spoke to you the word of God, and considering the results of their conduct, imitate their faith."
HEB	13	8	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9493	" {8} Jesus Christ is the same yesterday, today, and forever."
HEB	13	9	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9494	 {9} Don't be carried away by various and strange teachings.
HEB	13	9	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9495	" It is good that the heart be established by grace, not by food, through which those who were so occupied were not benefited."
HEB	13	10	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9496	 {10} We have an altar from which those who serve the holy tabernacle have no right to eat.
HEB	13	11	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9497	" {11} For the bodies of those animals, whose blood is brought into the holy place by the high priest as an offering for sin, are burned outside of the camp."
HEB	13	12	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9498	" {12} Therefore Jesus also, that he might sanctify the people through his own blood, suffered outside of the gate."
HEB	13	13	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9499	" {13} Let us therefore go out to him outside of the camp, bearing his reproach."
HEB	13	14	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9500	" {14} For we don't have here an enduring city, but we seek that which is to come."
HEB	13	15	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9501	" {15} Through him, then, let us offer up a sacrifice of praise to God continually, that is, the fruit of lips which proclaim allegiance to his name."
HEB	13	16	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9502	" {16} But don't forget to be doing good and sharing, for with such sacrifices God is well pleased."
HEB	13	17	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9503	" {17} Obey your leaders and submit to them, for they watch on behalf of your souls."
HEB	13	17	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9504	" As those who will give account, that they may do this with joy, and not with groaning, for that would be unprofitable for you."
HEB	13	18	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9505	" {18} Pray for us, for we are persuaded that we have a good conscience, desiring to live honorably in all things."
HEB	13	19	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9506	" {19} I strongly urge you to do this, that I may be restored to you sooner."
HEB	13	20	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9507	" {20} Now may the God of peace, who brought again from the dead the great shepherd of the sheep with the blood of an eternal covenant, our Lord Jesus,"
HEB	13	21	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9508	" {21} make you complete in every good work to do his will, working in you that which is well pleasing in his sight."
HEB	13	21	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9509	 To Jesus Christ be the glory forever and ever. Amen.
HEB	13	22	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9510	" {22} But I exhort you, brothers, endure the word of exhortation, for I have written to you in few words."
HEB	13	23	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9511	" {23} Know that our brother Timothy has been freed, with whom, if he comes shortly, I will see you."
HEB	13	24	Narr_019: Hebrews	#10		9512	" {24} Greet all of your leaders and all the saints. The Italians greet you. {25} Grace be with you all. Amen. *~**~*||| + 5 SECs |||*~*"
JMS	1	<<	Narr_020: James	#15		9513	"JAMES *~*JAMES CHP 1"
JMS	1	1	Narr_020: James	#15		9514	" {1} James, a servant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ, to the twelve tribes which are in the Dispersion: Greetings."
JMS	1	2	Narr_020: James	#15		9515	" {2} Count it all joy, my brothers, when you fall into various temptations."
JMS	1	3	Narr_020: James	#15		9516	 {3} Know that the testing of your faith produces endurance.
JMS	1	4	Narr_020: James	#15		9517	" {4} Let endurance have its perfect work, that you may be perfect and complete, lacking in nothing."
JMS	1	5	Narr_020: James	#15		9518	" {5} But if any of you lacks wisdom, let him ask of God, who gives to all liberally and without reproach; and it will be given to him."
JMS	1	6	Narr_020: James	#15		9519	" {6} But let him ask in faith, without any doubting, for he who doubts is like a wave of the sea, driven by the wind and tossed."
JMS	1	7	Narr_020: James	#15		9520	 {7} For let that man not think that he will receive anything from the Lord.
JMS	1	8	Narr_020: James	#15		9521	" {8} He is a double-minded man, unstable in all his ways."
JMS	1	9	Narr_020: James	#15		9522	 {9} But let the brother in humble circumstances glory in his high position;
JMS	1	10	Narr_020: James	#15		9523	" {10} and the rich, in that he is made humble, because like the flower in the grass, he will pass away."
JMS	1	11	Narr_020: James	#15		9524	" {11} For the sun arises with the scorching wind, and withers the grass, and the flower in it falls, and the beauty of its appearance perishes."
