JMS	1	11	Narr_020: James	#15		9525	 So also will the rich man fade away in his pursuits.
JMS	1	12	Narr_020: James	#15		9526	 {12} Blessed is the man who endures temptation.
JMS	1	12	Narr_020: James	#15		9527	" When he has been approved, he will receive the crown of life, which the Lord promised to those who love him."
JMS	1	13	Narr_020: James	#15		9528	" {13} Let no man say when he is tempted, “I am tempted by God,“ for God can't be tempted by evil, and he himself tempts no one."
JMS	1	14	Narr_020: James	#15		9529	" {14} But each one is tempted, when he is drawn away by his own lust, and enticed."
JMS	1	15	Narr_020: James	#15		9530	" {15} Then the lust, when it has conceived, bears sin; and the sin, when it is full grown, brings forth death."
JMS	1	16	Narr_020: James	#15		9531	" {16} Don't be deceived, my beloved brothers."
JMS	1	17	Narr_020: James	#15		9532	" {17} Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above, coming down from the Father of lights, with whom can be no variation, nor turning shadow."
JMS	1	18	Narr_020: James	#15		9533	" {18} Of his own will he brought us forth by the word of truth, that we should be a kind of first fruits of his creatures."
JMS	1	19	Narr_020: James	#15		9534	" {19} So, then, my beloved brothers, let every man be swift to hear, slow to speak, and slow to anger."
JMS	1	20	Narr_020: James	#15		9535	 {20} For the anger of man doesn't produce the righteousness of God.
JMS	1	21	Narr_020: James	#15		9536	" {21} Therefore, put away all filthiness and overflowing of wickedness."
JMS	1	21	Narr_020: James	#15		9537	" Receive with humility the implanted word, which is able to save your souls."
JMS	1	22	Narr_020: James	#15		9538	" {22} But be doers of the word, and not only hearers, deluding your own selves."
JMS	1	23	Narr_020: James	#15		9539	" {23} For if anyone is a hearer of the word and not a doer, he is like a man looking at his natural face in a mirror."
JMS	1	24	Narr_020: James	#15		9540	" {24} He sees himself and goes away, and immediately forgets what kind of man he was."
JMS	1	25	Narr_020: James	#15		9541	" {25} But he who looks into the perfect law of freedom, and continues, not being a hearer who forgets, but a doer of the work, this man will be blessed in what he does."
JMS	1	26	Narr_020: James	#15		9542	" {26} If anyone among you thinks himself to be religious while he doesn't bridle his tongue, but deceives his heart, this man's religion is worthless."
JMS	1	27	Narr_020: James	#15		9543	 {27} Pure religion and undefiled before our God and Father is this:
JMS	1	27	Narr_020: James	#15		9544	" to visit the fatherless and widows in their affliction, and to keep oneself unstained by the world. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
JMS	2	<<	Narr_020: James	#15		9545	JAMES CHP 2
JMS	2	1	Narr_020: James	#15		9546	" {1} My brothers, don't hold the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ of glory with partiality."
JMS	2	2	Narr_020: James	#15		9547	" {2} For if a man with a gold ring, in fine clothing, comes into your synagogue, and a poor man in filthy clothing also comes in;"
JMS	2	3	Narr_020: James	#15		9548	" {3} and if you pay special attention to him who wears the fine clothing, and say, “Sit here in a good place“; and you tell the poor man, “Stand there,“ or “Sit by my footstool“"
JMS	2	4	Narr_020: James	#15		9549	" {4} haven't you shown partiality among yourselves, and become judges with evil thoughts?"
JMS	2	5	Narr_020: James	#15		9550	" {5} Listen, my beloved brothers. Didn't God choose those who are poor in this world to be rich in faith."
JMS	2	5	Narr_020: James	#15		9551	 And heirs of the Kingdom which he promised to those who love him?
JMS	2	6	Narr_020: James	#15		9552	" {6} But you have dishonored the poor man. Don't the rich oppress you, and personally drag you before the courts?"
JMS	2	7	Narr_020: James	#15		9553	 {7} Don't they blaspheme the honorable name by which you are called?
JMS	2	8	Narr_020: James	#15		9554	" {8} However, if you fulfill the royal law, according to the Scripture,"
JMS	2	8	God-FX1	#20		9555	" “You shall love your neighbor as yourself,"""
JMS	2	8	Narr_020: James	#15		9556	" you do well. {9} But if you show partiality, you commit sin, being convicted by the law as transgressors."
JMS	2	10	Narr_020: James	#15		9557	" {10} For whoever keeps the whole law, and yet stumbles in one point, he has become guilty of all. {11} For he who said,"
JMS	2	11	God-FX1	#20		9558	" “Do not commit adultery,”"
JMS	2	11	Narr_020: James	#15		9559	" also said,"
JMS	2	11	God-FX1	#20		9560	 “Do not commit murder.”
JMS	2	11	Narr_020: James	#15		9561	" Now if you do not commit adultery, but murder, you have become a transgressor of the law."
JMS	2	12	Narr_020: James	#15		9562	" {12} So speak, and so do, as men who are to be judged by a law of freedom."
JMS	2	13	Narr_020: James	#15		9563	 {13} For judgment is without mercy to him who has shown no mercy. Mercy triumphs over judgment.
JMS	2	14	Narr_020: James	#15		9564	" {14} What good is it, my brothers, if a man says he has faith, but has no works? Can faith save him?"
JMS	2	15	Narr_020: James	#15		9565	" {15} For example, a brother or sister is naked and in lack of daily food."
JMS	2	16	Narr_020: James	#15		9566	" {16} One of you tells them, “Go in peace, be warmed and filled“; and yet you didn't give them the things the body needs, what good is it?"
JMS	2	17	Narr_020: James	#15		9567	" {17} Even so faith, if it has no works, is dead in itself."
JMS	2	18	Narr_020: James	#15		9568	" {18} Yes, a man will say, “You have faith, and I have works.” Show me your faith without works, and I by my works will show you my faith."
JMS	2	19	Narr_020: James	#15		9569	" {19} You believe that God is one. You do well. The demons also believe, and shudder."
JMS	2	20	Narr_020: James	#15		9570	" {20} But do you want to know, vain man, that faith apart from works is dead?"
JMS	2	21	Narr_020: James	#15		9571	" {21} Wasn't Abraham our father justified by works, in that he offered up Isaac his son on the altar?"
JMS	2	22	Narr_020: James	#15		9572	" {22} You see that faith worked with his works, and by works faith was perfected;"
JMS	2	23	Narr_020: James	#15		9573	" {23} and the Scripture was fulfilled which says,"
JMS	2	23	Scripture Quote-FX1	#19		9574	" “Abraham believed God, and it was accounted to him as righteousness“"
JMS	2	23	Narr_020: James	#15		9575	 and he was called the friend of God.
JMS	2	24	Narr_020: James	#15		9576	" {24} You see then that by works, a man is justified, and not only by faith."
JMS	2	25	Narr_020: James	#15		9577	" {25} In the same way, wasn't Rahab the prostitute also justified by works, in that she received the messengers, and sent them out another way?"
JMS	2	26	Narr_020: James	#15		9578	" {26} For as the body apart from the spirit is dead, even so faith apart from works is dead. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
JMS	3	<<	Narr_020: James	#15		9579	JAMES CHP 3
JMS	3	1	Narr_020: James	#15		9580	" {1} Let not many of you be teachers, my brothers, knowing that we will receive heavier judgment."
JMS	3	2	Narr_020: James	#15		9581	" {2} For in many things we all stumble. If anyone doesn't stumble in word, the same is a perfect man, able to bridle the whole body also."
JMS	3	3	Narr_020: James	#15		9582	" {3} Indeed, we put bits into the horses' mouths so that they may obey us, and we guide their whole body."
JMS	3	4	Narr_020: James	#15		9583	" {4} Behold, the ships also, though they are so big and are driven by fierce winds, are yet guided by a very small rudder, wherever the pilot desires."
JMS	3	5	Narr_020: James	#15		9584	" {5} So the tongue is also a little member, and boasts great things. See how a small fire can spread to a large forest!"
JMS	3	6	Narr_020: James	#15		9585	" {6} And the tongue is a fire. The world of iniquity among our members is the tongue, which defiles the whole body, and sets on fire the course of nature, and is set on fire by Gehenna."
JMS	3	7	Narr_020: James	#15		9586	" {7} For every kind of animal, bird, creeping thing, and thing in the sea, is tamed, and has been tamed by mankind."
JMS	3	8	Narr_020: James	#15		9587	" {8} But nobody can tame the tongue. It is a restless evil, full of deadly poison."
JMS	3	9	Narr_020: James	#15		9588	" {9} With it we bless our God and Father, and with it we curse men, who are made in the image of God."
JMS	3	10	Narr_020: James	#15		9589	" {10} Out of the same mouth comes forth blessing and cursing. My brothers, these things ought not to be so."
JMS	3	11	Narr_020: James	#15		9590	 {11} Does a spring send out from the same opening fresh and bitter water?
JMS	3	12	Narr_020: James	#15		9591	" {12} Can a fig tree, my brothers, yield olives, or a vine figs? Thus no spring yields both salt water and fresh water."
JMS	3	13	Narr_020: James	#15		9592	 {13} Who is wise and understanding among you? Let him show by his good conduct that his deeds are done in gentleness of wisdom.
JMS	3	14	Narr_020: James	#15		9593	" {14} But if you have bitter jealousy and selfish ambition in your heart, don't boast and don't lie against the truth."
JMS	3	15	Narr_020: James	#15		9594	" {15} This wisdom is not that which comes down from above, but is earthly, sensual, and demonic."
JMS	3	16	Narr_020: James	#15		9595	" {16} For where jealousy and selfish ambition are, there is confusion and every evil deed."
JMS	3	17	Narr_020: James	#15		9596	" {17} But the wisdom that is from above is first pure, then peaceful, gentle,"
JMS	3	17	Narr_020: James	#15		9597	" reasonable, full of mercy and good fruits, without partiality, and without hypocrisy."
JMS	3	18	Narr_020: James	#15		9598	" {18} Now the fruit of righteousness is sown in peace by those who make peace. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
JMS	4	<<	Narr_020: James	#15		9599	JAMES CHP 4
JMS	4	1	Narr_020: James	#15		9600	 {1} Where do wars and fightings among you come from? Don't they come from your pleasures that war in your members?
JMS	4	2	Narr_020: James	#15		9601	" {2} You lust, and don't have. You kill, covet, and can't obtain. You fight and make war. You don't have, because you don't ask."
JMS	4	3	Narr_020: James	#15		9602	" {3} You ask, and don't receive, because you ask with wrong motives, so that you may spend it for your pleasures."
JMS	4	4	Narr_020: James	#15		9603	" {4} You adulterers and adulteresses, don't you know that friendship with the world is enmity with God?"
JMS	4	4	Narr_020: James	#15		9604	 Whoever therefore wants to be a friend of the world makes himself an enemy of God.
JMS	4	5	Narr_020: James	#15		9605	" {5} Or do you think that the Scripture says in vain,"
JMS	4	5	Narr_020: James	#15		9606	 “The Spirit who lives in us yearns jealously“?
JMS	4	6	Narr_020: James	#15		9607	" {6} But he gives more grace. Therefore it says,"
JMS	4	6	Scripture Quote-FX1	#19		9608	" “God resists the proud, but gives grace to the humble.”"
JMS	4	7	Narr_020: James	#15		9609	" {7} Be subject therefore to God. But resist the devil, and he will flee from you."
JMS	4	8	Narr_020: James	#15		9610	" {8} Draw near to God, and he will draw near to you. Cleanse your hands, you sinners; and purify your hearts, you double-minded."
JMS	4	9	Narr_020: James	#15		9611	" {9} Lament, mourn, and weep. Let your laughter be turned to mourning, and your joy to gloom."
JMS	4	10	Narr_020: James	#15		9612	" {10} Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and he will exalt you."
JMS	4	11	Narr_020: James	#15		9613	" {11} Don't speak against one another, brothers. He who speaks against a brother and judges his brother, speaks against the law and judges the law. But if you judge the law, you are not a doer of the law, but a judge."
JMS	4	12	Narr_020: James	#15		9614	" {12} Only one is the lawgiver, who is able to save and to destroy. But who are you to judge another?"
JMS	4	13	Narr_020: James	#15		9615	" {13} Come now, you who say, “Today or tomorrow let's go into this city, and spend a year there, trade, and make a profit.”"
JMS	4	14	Narr_020: James	#15		9616	" {14} Whereas you don't know what your life will be like tomorrow. For what is your life? For you are a vapor, that appears for a little time, and then vanishes away."
JMS	4	15	Narr_020: James	#15		9617	" {15} For you ought to say, “If the Lord wills, we will both live, and do this or that.”"
JMS	4	16	Narr_020: James	#15		9618	 {16} But now you glory in your boasting. All such boasting is evil.
JMS	4	17	Narr_020: James	#15		9619	" {17} To him therefore who knows to do good, and doesn't do it, to him it is sin. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
JMS	5	<<	Narr_020: James	#15		9620	JAMES CHP 5
JMS	5	1	Narr_020: James	#15		9621	" {1} Come now, you rich, weep and howl for your miseries that are coming on you."
JMS	5	2	Narr_020: James	#15		9622	 {2} Your riches are corrupted and your garments are moth-eaten.
JMS	5	3	Narr_020: James	#15		9623	" {3} Your gold and your silver are corroded, and their corrosion will be for a testimony against you, and will eat your flesh like fire."
JMS	5	3	Narr_020: James	#15		9624	 You have laid up your treasure in the last days.
JMS	5	4	Narr_020: James	#15		9625	" {4} Behold, the wages of the laborers who mowed your fields, which you have kept back by fraud, cry out."
JMS	5	4	Narr_020: James	#15		9626	 And the cries of those who reaped have entered into the ears of the Lord of Armies.
JMS	5	5	Narr_020: James	#15		9627	" {5} You have lived delicately on the earth, and taken your pleasure. You have nourished your hearts as in a day of slaughter."
JMS	5	6	Narr_020: James	#15		9628	" {6} You have condemned, you have murdered the righteous one. He doesn't resist you."
JMS	5	7	Narr_020: James	#15		9629	" {7} Be patient therefore, brothers, until the coming of the Lord."
JMS	5	7	Narr_020: James	#15		9630	" Behold, the farmer waits for the precious fruit of the earth, being patient over it, until it receives the early and late rain."
JMS	5	8	Narr_020: James	#15		9631	" {8} You also be patient. Establish your hearts, for the coming of the Lord is at hand."
JMS	5	9	Narr_020: James	#15		9632	" {9} Don't grumble, brothers, against one another, so that you won't be judged. Behold, the judge stands at the door."
JMS	5	10	Narr_020: James	#15		9633	" {10} Take, brothers, for an example of suffering and of patience, the prophets who spoke in the name of the Lord."
JMS	5	11	Narr_020: James	#15		9634	" {11} Behold, we call them blessed who endured."
JMS	5	11	Narr_020: James	#15		9635	" You have heard of the patience of Job, and have seen the Lord in the outcome, and how the Lord is full of compassion and mercy."
JMS	5	12	Narr_020: James	#15		9636	" {12} But above all things, my brothers, don't swear, neither by heaven, nor by the earth, nor by any other oath;"
JMS	5	12	Narr_020: James	#15		9637	" but let your “yes“ be “yes,“ and your “no,“ “no“; so that you don't fall into hypocrisy."
JMS	5	13	Narr_020: James	#15		9638	 {13} Is any among you suffering? Let him pray. Is any cheerful? Let him sing praises.
JMS	5	14	Narr_020: James	#15		9639	" {14} Is any among you sick? Let him call for the elders of the assembly, and let them pray over him, anointing him with oil in the name of the Lord,"
JMS	5	15	Narr_020: James	#15		9640	" {15} and the prayer of faith will heal him who is sick, and the Lord will raise him up. If he has committed sins, he will be forgiven."
JMS	5	16	Narr_020: James	#15		9641	" {16} Confess your offenses to one another, and pray for one another, that you may be healed."
JMS	5	16	Narr_020: James	#15		9642	 The insistent prayer of a righteous person is powerfully effective.
JMS	5	17	Narr_020: James	#15		9643	" {17} Elijah was a man with a nature like ours, and he prayed earnestly that it might not rain, and it didn't rain on the earth for three years and six months."
JMS	5	18	Narr_020: James	#15		9644	" {18} He prayed again, and the sky gave rain, and the earth brought forth its fruit."
JMS	5	19	Narr_020: James	#15		9645	" {19} Brothers, if any among you wanders from the truth, and someone turns him back,"
JMS	5	20	Narr_020: James	#15		9646	" {20} let him know that he who turns a sinner from the error of his way will save a soul from death, and will cover a multitude of sins. *~**~*||| + 5 SECs |||*~*"
1PE	1	<<	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9647	"1 PETER *~*1 PETER CHP 1"
1PE	1	1	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9648	" {1} Peter, an apostle of Jesus Christ, to the chosen ones who are living as foreigners in the Dispersion in Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia,"
1PE	1	2	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9649	" {2} according to the foreknowledge of God the Father, in sanctification of the Spirit,"
1PE	1	2	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9650	 that you may obey Jesus Christ and be sprinkled with his blood: Grace to you and peace be multiplied.
1PE	1	3	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9651	 {3} Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.
1PE	1	3	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9652	" Who according to his great mercy became our father again to a living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead,"
1PE	1	4	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9653	" {4} to an incorruptible and undefiled inheritance that doesn't fade away, reserved in Heaven for you."
1PE	1	5	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9654	 {5} By the power of God you are being guarded through faith for a salvation ready to be revealed in the last time.
1PE	1	6	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9655	" {6} This is why you greatly rejoice, though now for a little while, if need be, you have been put to grief in various trials."
1PE	1	7	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9656	" {7} These trials have come so that the proof of your faith,"
1PE	1	7	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9657	" which is more precious than gold that perishes even though it is tested by fire, may be found to result in praise, glory, and honor at the revelation of Jesus Christ."
1PE	1	8	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9658	" {8} Though you have not seen him, you love him;"
1PE	1	8	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9659	" and even though you do not see him now, you believe in him and are filled with inexpressible and glorious joy."
1PE	1	9	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9660	" {9} For you are receiving the goal of your faith, the salvation of your souls."
1PE	1	10	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9661	" {10} Concerning this salvation, the prophets sought and searched diligently. They prophesied of the grace that would come to you."
1PE	1	11	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9662	" {11} They wondered who or what kind of time the Spirit of Christ, which was in them, pointed to,"
1PE	1	11	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9663	" when he predicted the sufferings of Christ, and the glories that would follow them."
1PE	1	12	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9664	" {12} To them it was revealed, that not to themselves, but to you, they ministered these things,"
1PE	1	12	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9665	 which now have been announced to you through those who preached the Good News to you by the Holy Spirit sent out from heaven; which things angels desire to look into.
1PE	1	13	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9666	 {13} Therefore prepare your minds for action!
1PE	1	13	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9667	 Be sober and set your hope fully on the grace that will be brought to you at the revelation of Jesus Christ.
1PE	1	14	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9668	" {14} Be as children of obedience, not conforming yourselves according to your former lusts as in your ignorance."
1PE	1	15	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9669	" {15} But just as he who called you is holy, you yourselves also be holy in all of your behavior; {16} because it is written,"
1PE	1	16	God-FX1	#20		9670	 “You shall be holy; for I am holy.”
1PE	1	17	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9671	" {17} If you call on him as Father, who without respect of persons judges according to each man's work, pass the time of your living as foreigners here in reverent fear."
1PE	1	18	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9672	" {18} Know that you were redeemed, and not with corruptible things, with silver or gold, from the useless way of life handed down from your fathers."
1PE	1	19	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9673	" {19} You were redeemed with precious blood, as of a faultless and pure lamb, the blood of Christ."
1PE	1	20	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9674	" {20} Christ was foreknown indeed before the foundation of the world, but was revealed at the end of times for your sake."
1PE	1	21	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9675	" {21} Through him you are believers in God, who raised him from the dead, and gave him glory; so that your faith and hope might be in God."
1PE	1	22	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9676	" {22} Now that you have purified your souls in your obedience to the truth through the Spirit in sincere brotherly affection,"
1PE	1	22	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9677	 love one another from the heart fervently.
1PE	1	23	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9678	" {23} For you have been born again, not of corruptible seed, but of incorruptible, through the word of God, which lives and remains forever. {24} For,"
1PE	1	24	Isaiah-FX1	#04		9679	" “All flesh is like grass, and all of man's glory like the flower in the grass. The grass withers, and its flower falls;"
1PE	1	25	Isaiah-FX1	#04		9680	 {25} but the Lord's word endures forever.”
1PE	1	25	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9681	" This is the word of Good News which was preached to you. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
1PE	2	<<	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9682	1 PETER CHP 2

1PE	2	2	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9684	" {2} Be like newborn babes, desiring always the pure spiritual milk, so that drinking it, you can grow and be saved."
1PE	2	3	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9685	" {3} For as the Scriptures say: ""You have discovered for yourself that the Lord is good."""
1PE	2	4	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9686	" {4} Come to him as a living stone, rejected indeed by men, but chosen by God and precious to him."
1PE	2	5	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9687	" {5} You also, as living stones, are built up as a spiritual house,"
1PE	2	5	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9688	" to be a holy priesthood, to offer up spiritual sacrifices, acceptable to God through Jesus Christ."

1PE	2	6	God-FX1	#20		9690	" “Behold, I lay in Zion a chief cornerstone, chosen, and precious: He who believes in him will not be disappointed.”"

1PE	2	8	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9693	" {8} and,"
1PE	2	8	Scripture Quote-FX1	#19		9694	" “a stone of stumbling, and a rock of offense.”"
1PE	2	8	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9695	" For they stumble at the word, being disobedient, to which also they were appointed."
1PE	2	9	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9696	" {9} But you are a chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation. A people for God's own possession,"
1PE	2	9	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9697	 that you may proclaim the excellence of him who called you out of darkness into his marvelous light.
1PE	2	10	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9698	" {10} In times past, you were no people, but now you are God's people. At one time you did not have God's mercy, but now you have obtained his mercy."
1PE	2	11	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9699	" {11} Beloved, I beg you as foreigners and pilgrims, to abstain from fleshly lusts, which war against the soul."
1PE	2	12	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9700	" {12} Have such good behavior among the nations, that when they speak against you as evildoers,"
1PE	2	12	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9701	" they may, by your good works which they see, glorify God in the day of visitation."
1PE	2	13	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9702	" {13} Therefore subject yourselves to every ordinance of man for the Lord's sake: whether to the king, as supreme;"
1PE	2	14	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9703	" {14} or to governors, as sent by him for vengeance on evildoers and for praise to those who do well."
1PE	2	15	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9704	" {15} For this is the will of God, that by well-doing you should put to silence the ignorance of foolish men:"
1PE	2	16	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9705	" {16} Live as free men, but do not use your freedom for a cloak of wickedness. Live as bondservants of God."
1PE	2	17	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9706	 {17} Honor all men. Love the brotherhood. Fear God. Honor the king.
1PE	2	18	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9707	" {18} Servants, be in subjection to your masters with all fear; not only to the good and gentle, but also to the wicked."
1PE	2	19	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9708	" {19} For it is commendable if someone endures pain, suffering unjustly, because of conscience toward God."
1PE	2	20	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9709	" {20} For what glory is it if, when you sin, you patiently endure beating?"
1PE	2	20	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9710	" But if, when you do well, you patiently endure suffering, this is commendable with God."
1PE	2	21	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9711	" {21} For to this you were called, because Christ also suffered for us, leaving you an example, that you should follow his steps,"
1PE	2	22	Isaiah-FX1	#04		9712	" {22} who did not sin, “neither was deceit found in his mouth.”"
1PE	2	23	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9713	" {23} When he was cursed, he didn't curse back. When he suffered, he didn't threaten, but committed himself to him who judges righteously."
1PE	2	24	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9714	" {24} He himself bore our sins in his body on the tree, that we, having died to sins, might live to righteousness; by whose stripes you were healed."
1PE	2	25	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9715	" {25} For you were going astray like sheep; but now have returned to the Shepherd and Overseer of your souls. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
1PE	3	<<	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9716	1 PETER CHP 3
1PE	3	1	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9717	" {1} In the same way, wives, be in subjection to your own husbands;"
1PE	3	1	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9718	" so that, even if any don't obey the Word, they may be won by the behavior of their wives without a word;"
1PE	3	2	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9719	 {2} seeing your pure behavior in fear.
1PE	3	3	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9720	" {3} Let your beauty be not just the outward adorning of braiding the hair, and of wearing jewels of gold, or of putting on fine clothing;"
1PE	3	4	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9721	" {4} but in the hidden person of the heart, in the incorruptible adornment of a gentle and quiet spirit, which is very precious in the sight of God."
1PE	3	5	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9722	" {5} For this is how the holy women before, who hoped in God also adorned themselves, being in subjection to their own husbands."
1PE	3	6	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9723	" {6} Sarah obeyed Abraham, calling him lord. You are her children if you do well, and are not put in fear by any terror."
1PE	3	7	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9724	" {7} You husbands, in the same way, live with your wives according to knowledge."
1PE	3	7	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9725	" Give honor to the woman, as to the weaker vessel, as being also joint heirs of the grace of life; that your prayers may not be hindered.*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
1PE	3	8	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9726	" {8} Finally, be all like-minded, compassionate, loving as brothers, tenderhearted, courteous."
1PE	3	9	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9727	" {9} Do not render evil for evil, or insult for insult; but instead blessing. Know that to this were you called, that you may inherit a blessing. {10} For,"
1PE	3	10	Scripture Quote-FX1	#19		9728	" “He who would love life, and see good days, let him keep his tongue from evil, and his lips from speaking deceit."
1PE	3	11	Scripture Quote-FX1	#19		9729	" {11} Let him turn away from evil, and do good. Let him seek peace, and pursue it."
1PE	3	12	Scripture Quote-FX1	#19		9730	" {12} For the eyes of the Lord are on the righteous, and his ears open to their prayer; but the face of the Lord is against those who do evil.”"
1PE	3	13	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9731	" {13} Now who is he who will harm you, if you become imitators of that which is good?"
1PE	3	14	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9732	" {14} But even if you should suffer for righteousness' sake, you are blessed. “Don't fear what they fear, neither be troubled.”"
1PE	3	15	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9733	 {15} But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts.
1PE	3	15	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9734	" Always be ready to give an answer to everyone who asks you a reason concerning the hope that is in you, with humility and fear."
1PE	3	16	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9735	" {16} Have a good conscience; that, while you are spoken against as evildoers, they may be disappointed who curse your good way of life in Christ."
1PE	3	17	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9736	" {17} For it is better, if it is God's will, that you suffer for doing well than for doing evil."
1PE	3	18	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9737	" {18} Because Christ also suffered for sins once, the righteous for the unrighteous, that he might bring you to God; being put to death in the flesh, but made alive in the spirit."
1PE	3	19	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9738	 {19} He also went and preached to the spirits in prison.
1PE	3	20	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9739	 {20} Those were the spirits of the people who were disobedient in the days of Noah.
1PE	3	20	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9740	 God waited patiently while the ship was being built. But only eight people were saved when the earth was flooded with water.
1PE	3	21	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9741	" {21} This water is a symbol of baptism, which now saves you--"
1PE	3	21	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9742	" not the putting away of the filth of the flesh, but the answer of a good conscience toward God, through the resurrection of Jesus Christ."
1PE	3	22	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9743	 {22} He has gone into heaven and is at the right hand of God.
1PE	3	22	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9744	" Having gone into heaven, angels, authorities, and powers have been made subject to him. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
1PE	4	<<	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9745	1 PETER CHP 4
1PE	4	1	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9746	" {1} Forasmuch then as Christ suffered for us in the flesh, arm yourselves also with the same mind; for suffering in the flesh puts an end to sin."
1PE	4	2	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9747	" {2} You should no longer live the rest of your time in the flesh for the lusts of men, but for the will of God."
1PE	4	3	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9748	 {3} For we have spent enough of our past time doing the desire of the Gentiles.
1PE	4	3	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9749	" Having walked in lewdness, lusts, drunken binges, orgies, carousings, and abominable idolatries."
1PE	4	4	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9750	" {4} They think it is strange that you don't run with them into the same excess of riot, blaspheming."
1PE	4	5	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9751	 {5} They will give account to him who is ready to judge the living and the dead.
1PE	4	6	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9752	" {6} For to this end the Good News was preached even to the dead, that they might be judged indeed as men in the flesh, but live as to God in the spirit."
1PE	4	7	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9753	" {7} But the end of all things is near. Therefore be of sound mind, self-controlled, and sober in prayer."
1PE	4	8	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9754	" {8} And above all things be earnest in your love among yourselves, for love covers a multitude of sins."
1PE	4	9	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9755	 {9} Be hospitable to one another without grumbling.
1PE	4	10	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9756	" {10} As each has received a gift, employ it in serving one another, as good managers of the grace of God in its various forms."
1PE	4	11	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9757	" {11} If anyone speaks, let it be as it were the very words of God. If anyone serves, let it be as of the strength which God supplies."
1PE	4	11	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9758	" That in all things God may be glorified through Jesus Christ, to whom belong the glory and the dominion forever and ever. Amen.*~**~*||| + 1.5 SECs |||*~*"
1PE	4	12	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9759	" {12} Beloved, don't be astonished at the fiery trial which has come upon you, to test you, as though a strange thing happened to you."
1PE	4	13	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9760	" {13} But because you are partakers of Christ's sufferings, rejoice; that at the revelation of his glory you also may rejoice with exceeding joy."
1PE	4	14	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9761	" {14} If you are insulted for the name of Christ, you are blessed;"
1PE	4	14	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9762	" because the Spirit of glory and of God rests on you. On their part he is blasphemed, but on your part he is glorified."
1PE	4	15	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9763	" {15} For let none of you suffer as a murderer, or a thief, or an evil doer, or a meddler in other men's matters."
1PE	4	16	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9764	" {16} But if one of you suffers for being a Christian, let him not be ashamed; but let him glorify God in this matter."
1PE	4	17	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9765	 {17} For the time has come for judgment to begin with the household of God.
1PE	4	17	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9766	" If it begins first with us, what will happen to those who don't obey the Good News of God?"
1PE	4	18	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9767	" {18} “If it is hard for the righteous to be saved, what will happen to the ungodly and the sinner?”"
1PE	4	19	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9768	" {19} Therefore let them also who suffer according to the will of God in doing good entrust their souls to him, as to a faithful Creator. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
1PE	5	<<	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9769	1 PETER CHP 5
1PE	5	1	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9770	" {1} I exhort the elders among you, as a fellow elder."
1PE	5	1	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9771	" As a witness of the sufferings of Christ, and as one who will also share in the glory that will be revealed."
1PE	5	2	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9772	 {2} Shepherd the flock of God which is among you.
1PE	5	2	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9773	" Exercise oversight, not under compulsion, but voluntarily, not for dishonest gain, but willingly."
1PE	5	3	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9774	" {3} Do not lord it over those entrusted to you, but make yourselves examples to the flock."
1PE	5	4	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9775	" {4} When the chief Shepherd is revealed, you will receive the crown of glory that doesn't fade away."
1PE	5	5	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9776	" {5} Likewise, you younger ones, be subject to the elder."
1PE	5	5	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9777	" Yes, all of you clothe yourselves with humility, to subject yourselves to one another; for"
1PE	5	5	Scripture Quote-FX1	#19		9778	" “God resists the proud, but gives grace to the humble.”"
1PE	5	6	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9779	" {6} Humble yourselves therefore under the mighty hand of God, that he may exalt you in due time."
1PE	5	7	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9780	" {7} Cast all your worries on him, because he cares for you."
1PE	5	8	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9781	" {8} Be sober and self-controlled. Be watchful. Your adversary, the devil, walks around like a roaring lion, seeking whom he may devour."
1PE	5	9	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9782	" {9} Withstand him steadfast in your faith, knowing that your brothers who are in the world are undergoing the same sufferings."
1PE	5	10	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9783	" {10} But may the God of all grace, who called you to his eternal glory by Christ Jesus,"
1PE	5	10	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9784	" after you have suffered a little while, perfect, establish, strengthen, and settle you."
1PE	5	11	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9785	 {11} To him be the glory and the power forever and ever. Amen.
1PE	5	12	Narr_021: 1Peter	#13		9786	" {12} Through Silvanus, our faithful brother, as I consider him, I have written to you briefly,"

2PE	1	<<	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9790	"2 PETER*~*2 PETER CHP 1"
2PE	1	1	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9791	" {1} Simon Peter, a servant and apostle of Jesus Christ,"
2PE	1	1	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9792	" to those who have obtained a like precious faith with us in the righteousness of our God and Savior, Jesus Christ:"
2PE	1	2	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9793	 {2} Grace to you and peace be multiplied in the knowledge of God and of Jesus our Lord.
2PE	1	3	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9794	" {3} His divine power has granted to us all things that pertain to life and godliness, through the knowledge of him who called us by his own glory and virtue."
2PE	1	4	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9795	" {4} Through his glory and virtue, he has granted to us his precious and exceedingly great promises;"
2PE	1	4	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9796	" that through these you may become partakers of the divine nature, having escaped from the corruption that is in the world by lust."
2PE	1	5	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9797	" {5} Yes, and for this very cause adding on your part all diligence, in your faith supply moral excellence; and in moral excellence, knowledge;"
2PE	1	6	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9798	" {6} and in knowledge, self-control; and in self-control patience; and in patience godliness;"
2PE	1	7	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9799	" {7} and in godliness brotherly affection; and in brotherly affection, love."
2PE	1	8	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9800	" {8} For if these things are yours and abound, they make you to be not idle nor unfruitful to the knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ."
2PE	1	9	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9801	" {9} For he who lacks these things is blind, seeing only what is near, having forgotten the cleansing from his old sins."
2PE	1	10	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9802	" {10} Therefore, brothers, be more diligent to make your calling and election sure. For if you do these things, you will never stumble."
2PE	1	11	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9803	" {11} For thus you will be richly supplied with the entrance into the eternal Kingdom of our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ."
2PE	1	12	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9804	" {12} Therefore I will not be negligent to remind you of these things, though you know them, and are established in the present truth."
2PE	1	13	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9805	" {13} I think it right, as long as I am alive, to stir you up by reminding you of these things."
2PE	1	14	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9806	" {14} I know that I will soon be leaving this body, even as our Lord Jesus Christ made clear to me."
2PE	1	15	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9807	" {15} Yes, I will make every effort that you may always be able to remember these things even after my departure."
2PE	1	16	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9808	" {16} For we did not follow cunningly devised fables, when we made known to you the power and coming of our Lord Jesus Christ."
2PE	1	16	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9809	 We were eyewitnesses of his majesty.
2PE	1	17	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9810	" {17} For he received from God the Father honor and glory, when the voice came to him from the Majestic Glory,"
2PE	1	17	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9811	" “This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.”"
2PE	1	18	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9812	 {18} We heard this voice come out of heaven when we were with him on the holy mountain.
2PE	1	19	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9813	" {19} We have the more sure word of prophecy; and you do well that you heed it,"
2PE	1	19	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9814	" as to a lamp shining in a dark place, until the day dawns, and the morning star arises in your hearts."
2PE	1	20	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9815	" {20} Know this first, that no prophecy of Scripture has been made up by prophet."
2PE	1	21	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9816	" {21} For no prophecy ever came by the will of man: but holy men of God spoke, being moved by the Holy Spirit. *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
2PE	2	<<	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9817	2 PETER CHP 2
2PE	2	1	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9818	" {1} But false prophets also arose among the people, as false teachers will also be among you."
2PE	2	1	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9819	" They will secretly bring in damnable heresies, denying even the Master who bought them, bringing on themselves swift destruction."
2PE	2	2	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9820	" {2} Many will follow their immoral ways, and as a result, the way of the truth will be maligned."
2PE	2	3	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9821	 {3} In covetousness they will exploit you with deceptive words:
2PE	2	3	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9822	" whose sentence now from of old doesn't linger, and their destruction will not slumber."
2PE	2	4	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9823	" {4} For God didn't spare angels when they sinned, but cast them down to Tartarus, and committed them to pits of darkness, to be reserved for judgment."
2PE	2	5	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9824	" {5} And God didn't spare the ancient world, but preserved Noah with seven others,"
2PE	2	5	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9825	" a preacher of righteousness, when he brought a flood on the world of the ungodly."
2PE	2	6	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9826	 {6} God turned the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah into ashes and condemned them to destruction.
2PE	2	6	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9827	 He made them an example to those who would live ungodly.
2PE	2	7	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9828	" {7} He delivered righteous Lot, who was very distressed by the lustful life of the wicked."
2PE	2	8	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9829	" {8} (For that righteous man dwelling among them, was tormented in his righteous soul from day to day with seeing and hearing lawless deeds)."
2PE	2	9	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9830	 {9} But the Lord knows how to deliver the godly out of temptation and to keep the unrighteous under punishment for the day of judgment.
2PE	2	10	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9831	" {10} This is especially true of those who walk after the flesh in the lust of defilement, and despise authority."
2PE	2	10	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9832	" Daring, self-willed, they are not afraid to speak evil of dignitaries."
2PE	2	11	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9833	" {11} Whereas angels, though greater in might and power, don't bring a railing judgment against them before the Lord."
2PE	2	12	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9834	" {12} But these, as unreasoning creatures, born natural animals to be taken and destroyed,"
2PE	2	12	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9835	" speaking evil in matters about which they are ignorant, will in their destroying surely be destroyed."
2PE	2	13	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9836	 {13} They will be paid back with harm for the harm that they have done. Their idea of pleasure is to revel in the daytime.
2PE	2	13	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9837	 They are blots and blemishes reveling in their deceit while they feast with you.
2PE	2	14	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9838	" {14} With eyes full of adultery, they can't cease from sin; enticing unsettled souls; having a heart trained in greed; children of cursing."
2PE	2	15	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9839	" {15} They forsake the right way. They went astray, having followed the way of Balaam the son of Beor, who loved the wages of wrongdoing."
2PE	2	16	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9840	 {16} But he was rebuked for his own disobedience. A mute donkey spoke with a man's voice and stopped the madness of the prophet.
2PE	2	17	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9841	" {17} These are wells without water, clouds driven by a storm; for whom the blackness of darkness has been reserved forever."
2PE	2	18	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9842	" {18} For, uttering great swelling words of emptiness, they entice in the lusts of the flesh, by licentiousness, those who are indeed escaping from those who live in error."
2PE	2	19	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9843	" {19} They promise them liberty, while they themselves are bondservants of corruption; for a man is brought into bondage by whoever overcomes him."
2PE	2	20	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9844	" {20} For if, after they have escaped the defilement of the world through the knowledge of the Lord and Savior Jesus Christ,"
2PE	2	20	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9845	" they are again entangled in it and overcome, the last state has become worse for them than the first."
2PE	2	21	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9846	" {21} For it would be better for them not to have known the way of righteousness, than, after knowing it, to turn back from the holy commandment delivered to them."
2PE	2	22	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9847	" {22} But it has happened to them according to the true proverb,"
2PE	2	22	Scripture Quote-FX1	#19		9848	" “The dog turns to his own vomit again,“ and “the sow that has washed to wallowing in the mire.”*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
2PE	3	<<	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9849	2 PETER CHP 3
2PE	3	1	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9850	" {1} This is now, beloved, the second letter that I have written to you;"
2PE	3	1	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9851	 and in both of them I stir up your sincere mind by reminding you of some things.
2PE	3	2	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9852	" {2} You should remember the words which were spoken before by the holy prophets, and the commandments of us, the apostles of the Lord and Savior."
2PE	3	3	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9853	" {3} First of all, I want you to know that in the last days mockers will come, walking after their own lusts."
2PE	3	4	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9854	" {4} They will be saying, “Where is the promise of his coming?"
2PE	3	4	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9855	" For, from the day that the fathers fell asleep, all things continue as they were from the beginning of the creation.”"
2PE	3	5	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9856	" {5} For this they willfully forget, that there were heavens from of old, and an earth formed out of water and amid water, by the word of God."
2PE	3	6	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9857	 {6} By these waters also the world of that time was deluged and destroyed.
2PE	3	7	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9858	" {7} But the heavens that now are, and the earth, by the same word have been stored up for fire,"
2PE	3	7	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9859	 being reserved against the day of judgment and destruction of ungodly men.
2PE	3	8	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9860	" {8} But don't forget this one thing, beloved, that one day is with the Lord as a thousand years, and a thousand years as one day."
2PE	3	9	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9861	" {9} The Lord is not slow concerning his promise, as some count slowness."
2PE	3	9	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9862	" He is patient with us, not wishing that any should perish, but that all should come to repentance."
2PE	3	10	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9863	" {10} But the day of the Lord will come as a thief in the night; in which the heavens will pass away with a great noise,"
2PE	3	10	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9864	" and the elements will be dissolved with fervent heat, and the earth and the works that are in it will be burned up."
2PE	3	11	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9865	" {11} Therefore since all these things will be destroyed like this, what kind of people ought you to be? You ought to live holy and godly lives."
2PE	3	12	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9866	" {12} You should be looking for and earnestly desiring the coming of the day of God,"
2PE	3	12	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9867	" which will cause the burning heavens to be dissolved, and the elements will melt with fervent heat?"
2PE	3	13	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9868	" {13} But, according to his promise, we look for new heavens and a new earth, in which righteousness dwells."
2PE	3	14	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9869	" {14} Therefore, beloved, seeing that you look for these things, be diligent to be found in peace, without blemish and blameless in his sight."
2PE	3	15	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9870	" {15} Regard the patience of our Lord as salvation; even as our beloved brother Paul also, according to the wisdom given to him, wrote to you."
2PE	3	16	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9871	" {16} He wrote about these things in all of his letters, speaking in them of these things."
2PE	3	16	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9872	" In those, there are some things that are hard to understand, which the ignorant and unsettled twist, as they also do to the other Scriptures, to their own destruction."
2PE	3	17	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9873	" {17} You therefore, beloved, know these things beforehand."
2PE	3	17	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9874	" Beware, lest being carried away with the error of the wicked, you fall from your own steadfastness."
2PE	3	18	Narr_022: 2Peter	#13		9875	" {18} But grow in the grace and knowledge of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. To him be the glory both now and forever. Amen. *~**~*||| + 5 SECs |||*~*"

1JN	2	3	Narr_023: 1John	#05		9893	 {3} This is how we know that we know him: if we keep his commandments.
1JN	2	4	Narr_023: 1John	#05		9894	" {4} One who says, “I know him,“ and doesn't keep his commandments, is a liar, and the truth isn't in him."
1JN	2	5	Narr_023: 1John	#05		9895	" {5} But whoever keeps his word, God's love has most certainly been perfected in him. This is how we know that we are in him:"
1JN	2	6	Narr_023: 1John	#05		9896	 {6} He who says he remains in him ought himself also to walk just like he walked.
1JN	2	7	Narr_023: 1John	#05		9897	" {7} Brothers, I write no new commandment to you, but an old commandment which you had from the beginning."
1JN	2	7	Narr_023: 1John	#05		9898	 The old commandment is the word which you heard from the beginning.
1JN	2	8	Narr_023: 1John	#05		9899	" {8} Again, I write a new commandment to you, which is true in him and in you;"
1JN	2	8	Narr_023: 1John	#05		9900	" because the darkness is passing away, and the true light already shines."
1JN	2	9	Narr_023: 1John	#05		9901	" {9} He who says he is in the light and hates his brother, is in the darkness even until now."
1JN	2	10	Narr_023: 1John	#05		9902	" {10} He who loves his brother remains in the light, and there is no occasion for stumbling in him."
1JN	2	11	Narr_023: 1John	#05		9903	" {11} But he who hates his brother is in the darkness, and walks in the darkness."
1JN	2	11	Narr_023: 1John	#05		9904	" He doesn't know where he is going, because the darkness has blinded his eyes."
1JN	2	12	Narr_023: 1John	#05		9905	" {12} I write to you, little children, because your sins are forgiven you for his name's sake."
1JN	2	13	Narr_023: 1John	#05		9906	" {13} I write to you, fathers, because you know him who is from the beginning."
1JN	2	13	Narr_023: 1John	#05		9907	" I write to you, young men, because you have overcome the evil one. I write to you, little children, because you know the Father."
1JN	2	14	Narr_023: 1John	#05		9908	" {14} I have written to you, fathers, because you know him who is from the beginning."
1JN	2	14	Narr_023: 1John	#05		9909	" I have written to you, young men, because you are strong, and the word of God remains in you, and you have overcome the evil one."
1JN	2	15	Narr_023: 1John	#05		9910	" ||| DO NOT COMBINE |||*~*{Music--Starts @ v15}*~**~* {15} Don't love the world, neither the things that are in the world. If anyone loves the world, the Father's love isn't in him."
1JN	2	16	Narr_023: 1John	#05		9911	" {16} For all that is in the world, the lust of the flesh, the lust of the eyes, and the pride of life, isn't the Father's, but is the world's."
1JN	2	17	Narr_023: 1John	#05		9912	" {17} The world is passing away with its lusts, but he who does God's will remains forever.*~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"
1JN	2	18	Narr_023: 1John	#05		9913	" {18} Little children, these are the end times, and as you heard that the Antichrist is coming, even now many antichrists have arisen."
1JN	2	18	Narr_023: 1John	#05		9914	 By this we know that it is the final hour.
1JN	2	19	Narr_023: 1John	#05		9915	" {19} They went out from us, but they didn't belong to us; for if they had belonged to us, they would have continued with us."
1JN	2	19	Narr_023: 1John	#05		9916	" But they left, that they might be revealed that none of them belong to us."
1JN	2	20	Narr_023: 1John	#05		9917	" ||| DO NOT COMBINE |||*~*{Music--Starts @ v20}*~**~* {20} You have an anointing from the Holy One, and you all have knowledge."
1JN	2	21	Narr_023: 1John	#05		9918	" {21} I have not written to you because you don't know the truth, but because you know it, and because no lie is of the truth."
1JN	2	22	Narr_023: 1John	#05		9919	" {22} Who is the liar but he who denies that Jesus is the Christ? This is the Antichrist, he who denies the Father and the Son."
1JN	2	23	Narr_023: 1John	#05		9920	" {23} Whoever denies the Son, the same doesn't have the Father. He who confesses the Son has the Father also."
1JN	2	24	Narr_023: 1John	#05		9921	" {24} Therefore, as for you, let that remain in you which you heard from the beginning."
1JN	2	24	Narr_023: 1John	#05		9922	" If that which you heard from the beginning remains in you, you also will remain in the Son, and in the Father."
1JN	2	25	Narr_023: 1John	#05		9923	" {25} This is the promise which he promised us, the eternal life."
1JN	2	26	Narr_023: 1John	#05		9924	 {26} These things I have written to you concerning those who would lead you astray.
1JN	2	27	Narr_023: 1John	#05		9925	" {27} As for you, the anointing which you received from him remains in you, and you don't need for anyone to teach you."

JUD	1	1	Narr_026: Jude	#11		10046	" {1} Jude, a servant of Jesus Christ, and brother of James, to those who are called, sanctified by God the Father, and kept for Jesus Christ:"
JUD	1	2	Narr_026: Jude	#11		10047	 {2} Mercy to you and peace and love be multiplied.
JUD	1	3	Narr_026: Jude	#11		10048	" {3} Beloved, while I was very eager to write to you about our common salvation,"
JUD	1	3	Narr_026: Jude	#11		10049	 I was constrained to write to you exhorting you to contend earnestly for the faith which was once for all delivered to the saints.
JUD	1	4	Narr_026: Jude	#11		10050	" {4} For there are certain men who crept in secretly, even those who were long ago written about for this condemnation:"
JUD	1	4	Narr_026: Jude	#11		10051	" ungodly men, turning the grace of our God into indecency, and denying our only Master, God, and Lord, Jesus Christ."
JUD	1	5	Narr_026: Jude	#11		10052	" {5} Now I desire to remind you, though you already know this,"
JUD	1	5	Narr_026: Jude	#11		10053	" that the Lord, having saved a people out of the land of Egypt, afterward destroyed those who didn't believe."
JUD	1	6	Narr_026: Jude	#11		10054	" {6} Angels who didn't keep their first domain, but deserted their own dwelling place,"
JUD	1	6	Narr_026: Jude	#11		10055	 he has kept in everlasting bonds under darkness for the judgment of the great day.
JUD	1	7	Narr_026: Jude	#11		10056	" {7} Even as Sodom and Gomorrah, and the cities around them, having, in the same way as these, given themselves over to sexual immorality and gone after strange flesh,"
JUD	1	7	Narr_026: Jude	#11		10057	" are set forth as an example, suffering the punishment of eternal fire."
JUD	1	8	Narr_026: Jude	#11		10058	" {8} Yet in the same way, these also in their dreaming defile the flesh, despise authority, and slander celestial beings."
JUD	1	9	Narr_026: Jude	#11		10059	" {9} But Michael, the archangel, when contending with the devil and arguing about the body of Moses,"
JUD	1	9	Narr_026: Jude	#11		10060	" dared not bring against him an abusive condemnation, but said, “May the Lord rebuke you!”"
JUD	1	10	Narr_026: Jude	#11		10061	 {10} But these speak evil of whatever things they don't know.
JUD	1	10	Narr_026: Jude	#11		10062	" What they understand naturally, like the creatures without reason, they are destroyed in these things."
JUD	1	11	Narr_026: Jude	#11		10063	" {11} Woe to them! For they went in the way of Cain, and ran riotously in the error of Balaam for hire, and perished in Korah's rebellion."
JUD	1	12	Narr_026: Jude	#11		10064	" ||| DO NOT COMBINE |||*~*{SFX--Eerie--Starts @ v12}*~**~* {12} These men are hidden rocky reefs in your love feasts when they feast with you,"
JUD	1	12	Narr_026: Jude	#11		10065	" shepherds who without fear feed themselves; clouds without water, carried along by winds."
JUD	1	12	Narr_026: Jude	#11		10066	" They are like autumn leaves without fruit, twice dead, plucked up by the roots."
JUD	1	13	Narr_026: Jude	#11		10067	" {13} They are like wild waves of the sea, foaming out their own shame;"
JUD	1	13	Narr_026: Jude	#11		10068	" wandering stars, for whom the blackness of darkness has been reserved forever."
JUD	1	14	Narr_026: Jude	#11		10069	" {14} About these also Enoch, the seventh from Adam, prophesied, saying,"
JUD	1	14	Enoch-FX1	#19		10070	" “Behold, the Lord came with ten thousands of his holy ones,"
JUD	1	15	Enoch-FX1	#19		10071	" {15} to execute judgment on all, and to convict all the ungodly of all their works of ungodliness which they have done in an ungodly way,"
JUD	1	15	Enoch-FX1	#19		10072	 and of all the hard things which ungodly sinners have spoken against him.”
JUD	1	16	Narr_026: Jude	#11		10073	" {16} These are murmurers and complainers, walking after their lusts"
JUD	1	16	Narr_026: Jude	#11		10074	" (and their mouth speaks proud things), showing respect of persons to gain advantage."
JUD	1	17	Narr_026: Jude	#11		10075	" ||| DO NOT COMBINE |||*~*{Music--Starts @ v17}*~**~* {17} But you, beloved, remember the words which have been spoken before by the apostles of our Lord Jesus Christ."
JUD	1	18	Narr_026: Jude	#11		10076	" {18} They said to you that “In the last time there will be mockers, walking after their own ungodly lusts.”"
JUD	1	19	Narr_026: Jude	#11		10077	" {19} These are they who cause divisions, and are sensual, not having the Spirit."
JUD	1	20	Narr_026: Jude	#11		10078	" {20} But you, beloved, keep building up yourselves on your most holy faith, praying in the Holy Spirit."
JUD	1	21	Narr_026: Jude	#11		10079	" {21} Keep yourselves in the love of God, looking for the mercy of our Lord Jesus Christ to eternal life."

JUD	1	23	Narr_026: Jude	#11		10081	" {23} Snatch others from the fire and save them. To others show mercy mixed with fear, hating even the clothing stained by the flesh."
JUD	1	24	Narr_026: Jude	#11		10082	" {24} Now to him who is able to keep them from stumbling, and to present you faultless before the presence of his glory in great joy --"
JUD	1	25	Narr_026: Jude	#11		10083	" {25} to God our Savior, who alone is wise, be glory and majesty, dominion and power, both now and forever. Amen. *~**~*||| + 5 SECs |||*~*"
REV	1	<<	Narr_027: Revelation	#05		10084	"REVELATION *~*REVELATION CHP 1"
REV	1	1	Narr_027: Revelation	#05		10085	" {1} This is the Revelation of Jesus Christ,"

REV	1	9	Narr_027: Revelation	#05		10100	 I was on the isle that is called Patmos because of God's Word and the testimony of Jesus Christ.
REV	1	10	Narr_027: Revelation	#05		10101	" {10} I was in the Spirit on the Lord's day, and I heard behind me a loud voice, like a trumpet {11} saying,"
REV	1	11	Jesus-FX1	#07		10102	" “I am the Alpha and Omega, the first and the last: and, What you see, write in a book and send to the seven assemblies:"
REV	1	11	Jesus-FX1	#07		10103	" to Ephesus, Smyrna, Pergamum, Thyatira, Sardis, Philadelphia, and to Laodicea.”"
REV	1	12	Narr_027: Revelation	#05		10104	" {12} I turned to see the voice that spoke with me. Having turned, I saw seven golden lampstands."
REV	1	13	Narr_027: Revelation	#05		10105	" {13} And among the lampstands was one like a son of man, clothed with a robe reaching down to his feet, and with a golden sash around his chest."
REV	1	14	Narr_027: Revelation	#05		10106	" {14} His head and his hair were white as white wool, like snow. His eyes were like a flame of fire."
REV	1	15	Narr_027: Revelation	#05		10107	" {15} His feet were like burnished brass, as if it had been refined in a furnace. His voice was like the voice of many waters."
REV	1	16	Narr_027: Revelation	#05		10108	 {16} He had seven stars in his right hand. Out of his mouth proceeded a sharp two-edged sword. His face was like the sun shining at its brightest.
REV	1	17	Narr_027: Revelation	#05		10109	" {17} When I saw him, I fell at his feet like a dead man. He laid his right hand on me, saying,"
REV	1	17	Jesus-FX1	#07		10110	" “Don't be afraid. I am the first and the last, {18} and the Living one."
REV	1	17	Jesus-FX1	#07		10111	" I was dead, and behold, I am alive forevermore. Amen. I have the keys of Death and of Hades."
REV	1	19	Jesus-FX1	#07		10112	" {19} Write therefore the things which you have seen, and the things which are, and the things which will happen hereafter."
REV	1	20	Jesus-FX1	#07		10113	" {20} Here is the hidden meaning of the seven stars that you see in my right hand, and the seven lamps of gold:"
REV	1	20	Jesus-FX1	#07		10114	" the seven stars are the angels of the seven churches, and the seven lamps are the seven churches. >> *~**~*||| + 2 SECs |||*~*"

REV	2	2	Jesus-FX1	#07		10119	" You have tested those who call themselves apostles, and they are not, and found them false."
REV	2	3	Jesus-FX1	#07		10120	" {3} You have perseverance and have endured for my name's sake, and have not grown weary."
REV	2	4	Jesus-FX1	#07		10121	" {4} But I have this against you, that you left your first love."
REV	2	5	Jesus-FX1	#07		10122	" {5} Remember therefore from where you have fallen, and repent and do the first works;"

REV	2	11	Jesus-FX1	#07		10132	" {11} He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the assemblies. He who overcomes won't be harmed by the second death."
REV	2	12	Jesus-FX1	#07		10133	 {12} “To the angel of the assembly in Pergamum write: “He who has the sharp two-edged sword says these things:
REV	2	13	Jesus-FX1	#07		10134	" {13} “I know your works and where you dwell, where Satan's seat is."
REV	2	13	Jesus-FX1	#07		10135	" You hold firmly to my name, and didn't deny my faith in the days of Antipas my witness, my faithful one, who was killed among you, where Satan dwells."
REV	2	14	Jesus-FX1	#07		10136	" {14} But I have a few things against you, because you have there some who hold the teaching of Balaam,"
REV	2	14	Jesus-FX1	#07		10137	" who taught Balak to throw a stumbling block before the children of Israel, to eat things sacrificed to idols, and to commit sexual immorality."
REV	2	15	Jesus-FX1	#07		10138	" {15} So you also have some who hold to the teaching of the Nicolaitans, which thing I hate."
REV	2	16	Jesus-FX1	#07		10139	" {16} Repent therefore, or else I am coming to you quickly, and I will make war against them with the sword of my mouth."
REV	2	17	Jesus-FX1	#07		10140	" {17} He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the assemblies. To him who overcomes, to him I will give of the hidden manna,"
REV	2	17	Jesus-FX1	#07		10141	" and I will give him a white stone, and on the stone a new name written, which no one knows but he who receives it."
REV	2	18	Jesus-FX1	#07		10142	 {18} “To the angel of the assembly in Thyatira write:
REV	2	18	Jesus-FX1	#07		10143	" “The Son of God, who has his eyes like a flame of fire, and his feet are like burnished brass, says these things:"
REV	2	19	Jesus-FX1	#07		10144	" {19} “I know your works, your love, faith, service, patient endurance, and that your last works are more than the first."
REV	2	20	Jesus-FX1	#07		10145	" {20} But I have this against you, that you tolerate your woman, Jezebel, who calls herself a prophetess."
REV	2	20	Jesus-FX1	#07		10146	" She teaches and seduces my servants to commit sexual immorality, and to eat things sacrificed to idols."
REV	2	21	Jesus-FX1	#07		10147	" {21} I gave her time to repent, but she refuses to repent of her sexual immorality."
REV	2	22	Jesus-FX1	#07		10148	" {22} So I will cast her on a bed of suffering, and I will make those who commit adultery with her suffer intensely, unless they repent of her ways."
REV	2	23	Jesus-FX1	#07		10149	 {23} I will strike her children dead.
REV	2	23	Jesus-FX1	#07		10150	" Then all the churches will know that I am he who searches hearts and minds, and I will repay each of you according to your deeds."
REV	2	24	Jesus-FX1	#07		10151	" {24} But to you I say, to the rest who are in Thyatira, as many as don't have this teaching,"
REV	2	24	Jesus-FX1	#07		10152	" who don't know what some call 'the deep things of Satan,' to you I say, I am not putting any other burden on you."
REV	2	25	Jesus-FX1	#07		10153	" {25} Nevertheless, hold that which you have firmly until I come."
REV	2	26	Jesus-FX1	#07		10154	" {26} He who overcomes, and he who keeps my works to the end, to him I will give authority over the nations."
